text: North Korea on Tuesday urged South Korea to end a military intelligence-sharing pact with Japan, calling it a "dangerous hurdle" that harms improving inter-Korean relations. The pact creates a war crisis on the Korean Peninsula, North Korea said. South Korea and Japan signed the agreement in 2016 to share sensitive information on the threat posed by North Korea.
summary: एन कोरिया ने एस कोरिया से जापान के साथ इंटेल-साझाकरण समझौते को समाप्त करने का आग्रह किया

text: Stating that Tibetan Buddhists continue to be in a very difficult situation, US Ambassador-at-Large for International Religious Freedom Sam Brownback has said, "China remains a very, very troubling country on religious freedom." There are between 60 to 80 lakh Tibetan Buddhists in China. The US envoy further raised concerns about the alleged persecution of Uighur Muslims in China.
summary: चीन धार्मिक स्वतंत्रता पर बहुत परेशान राष्ट्र बना हुआ है: यू.एस.

text: The Managing Trustee of Tata Trusts, R Venkataramanan, has been booked by the CBI in AirAsia corruption probe. Venkataramanan is a director at AirAsia India, a Tata Group and AirAsia joint venture. CBI alleged that top executives of AirAsia, including Group CEO Tony Fernandes, bribed government officials to obtain a flying permit and start international flights from the first day.
summary: भ्रष्टाचार जांच में सीबीआई द्वारा नामित टाटा ट्रस्ट्स के वेंकटरमनन

text: Actress Taapsee Pannu has rejected a film opposite actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui, as per reports. "Taapsee didn't like the project. Apparently, she wasn't too keen on being paired with Nawaz in the film, hence she refused the offer," reports stated. The film, which is said to be a crime thriller, will mark the directorial debut of casting director Honey Trehan.
summary: तपोसी ने नवाज़ुद्दीन सिद्दीकी के सामने फिल्म को खारिज कर दिया: रिपोर्ट

text: Swara Bhasker has revealed her friend, actress Sonam Kapoor postponed her wedding with Anand Ahuja so that Swara could attend it. Sonam's astrologer had picked the same date for her wedding as the date when Swara's brother Ishaan was also getting married. "Sonam even asked me if I could convince my parents to get Ishaan's wedding date changed," said Swara.
summary: स्वरा कहती हैं कि सोनम ने आनंद के साथ अपनी शादी स्थगित कर दी

text: Denying rumours of his wife Neha Dhupia being pregnant before marriage, Angad Bedi said, "When it happens, we'll come out and surely speak about it." "First we need to buy a house...When we make more money and get some more work, we'll start a family too," he added. Earlier, Neha's father Pradip Dhupia had also denied rumours of her pregnancy.
summary: शादी से पहले नेहा के प्रेग्नेंट होने की अफवाह का खंडन अंगद बेदी ने किया

text: Talking about the T20I against Windies on May 31, World XI head coach Andy Flower has said "we've got Pakistanis and Indians sharing a dressing room which doesn't happen often." "I've been involved in charity events before as a player...there's a wonderful feel to it," added the former Zimbabwean captain. The proceeds would go towards restoration of hurricane-hit Caribbean stadiums.
summary: हमने पाक और भारत का ड्रेसिंग रूम साझा किया है: वर्ल्ड इलेवन कोच

text: Al Jazeera has responded to the criticism by ICC for not co-operating on its match-fixing claims, saying the cricket governing body showed "a failure to understand investigative journalism". "No self-respecting media entity releases its evidence pre-publication," Al Jazeera said, adding, ICC needs to "respect ongoing sensitive legal considerations, including potential criminal investigations".
summary: ICC पत्रकारिता नहीं जानता: प्रमाण साझा न करने पर अल जज़ीरा

text: While talking about Facebook copying Snapchat features, the company's CEO Evan Spiegel has said, "We would really appreciate it if they copied our data protection practices also." Adding that Snapchat is not just a bunch of features, he also said, "It has an underlying philosophy that runs counter to traditional social media." "Our values are hard to copy," he added.
summary: फेसबुक को हमारी डेटा प्रथाओं को भी कॉपी करना चाहिए: स्नैपचैट के सीईओ

text: Talking about Facebook's social network format, Snapchat CEO Evan Spiegel has said, "DNA of their company is all about having people compete with each other online for attention." Adding that it is "flattering" that the social media major has been copying Snapchat features, Spiegel also said,  "Fundamentally, they're having a really hard time changing the DNA of their company."
summary: FB का डीएनए लोगों को ध्यान देने के लिए प्रतिस्पर्धा कर रहा है: स्नैप सीईओ

text: Alibaba along with a group of investors is leading a $1.38 billion investment in Chinese delivery service ZTO in exchange for 10% stake in the firm. The Alibaba-led investor group includes its own logistics arm Cainiao, the company said. The deal would be Alibaba's third investment in a Chinese courier after buying minority stakes in YTO Express and Best.
summary: अलीबाबा चीनी डिलीवरी फर्म में $ 1.4 बीएन निवेश का नेतृत्व करता है

text: Responding to Congress' claims of coming back into power after the 2019 elections, Union Minister Smriti Irani said party President Rahul Gandhi won't even be able to retain his constituency Amethi. She added, "In Amethi, he lost every Assembly seat, every local election in the past four years. What could be his chances of coming to power at the Centre?"
summary: राहुल 2019 के लोकसभा चुनाव में अमेठी नहीं जीतेंगे: स्मृति ईरानी

text: Bengaluru-based mobile payments startup ToneTag has raised $8-10 million from investors led by Amazon and Mastercard. ToneTag's investors include Manipal Global Education chairman Mohandas Pai, PremjiInvest's Chief Investment Officer TK Kurien, and Facebook executive Anand Chandrasekaran. Founded in 2014, ToneTag allows secure proximity payments using sound or Near-Field Communication (NFC).
summary: मोबाइल भुगतान स्टार्टअप ToneTag अमेज़न के नेतृत्व में $ 8-10mn उठाती है

text: Online grocer BigBasket is reportedly in advanced talks to acquire Mumbai-based micro-delivery startups RainCain and Supr Daily. Reports claimed RainCan had better chances of acquisition, given the terms and conditions of ongoing talk. Founded in 2015 by IIT Bombay alumni Munendra Singh and Abhijeet Kumar, RainCan offers a subscription model for daily essentials such as dairy, meat, and bakery.
summary: आईआईटीयन के स्टार्टअप रेनकन को खरीदने के लिए वार्ता में बिगबैकेट: रिपोर्ट

text: Laura Tenenbaum, a former science communicator for NASA, has said there is "fear and anxiety" in the space agency over cuts in climate science funding as it is considered a "sensitive subject" since US President Donald Trump assumed office. Tenenbaum said the "outcome has been chaos" adding she was warned off using the term "global warming" on social media.
summary: ट्रम्प बनने के बाद से 'भय, अराजकता' में नासा प्रीज़: पूर्व कर्मचारी

text: The Vishva Hindu Parishad has reportedly invited ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan to speak at the World Hindu Congress in Chicago, to be held from September 7-9. The event commemorates 125 years of Swami Vivekananda's historic address to the Parliament of World Religions. Other guests invited include Hollywood actor Richard Gere, SpiceJet Chairman Ajay Singh and Piramal Group Chairman Ajay Piramal.
summary: VHP ने शिकागो में हिंदू कांग्रेस के लिए रघुराम राजन को आमंत्रित किया

text: A day after a search for the missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 ended, Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad has said the search may be resumed if new evidence is found. "We have to come to a stage where we cannot keep searching for something we cannot find," he added. The flight carrying 239 people mysteriously disappeared on March 8, 2014.
summary: MH370 खोज फिर से शुरू हो सकती है अगर नए सबूत मिले: मलेशिया

text: Indian Air Force has joined the operation to douse a massive fire raging for 17 hours in a rubber godown in Delhi's Malviya Nagar after fire tenders failed to contain the blaze. An Mi-17 helicopter was seen pouring water on the fire, while 15 fire tenders were at the spot. The fire also spread to nearby buildings, including a school.
summary: दिल्ली में भारी गोलाबारी 17 घंटे के बाद भी, वायु सेना तैनात

text: Despite an international ban on whale hunting, Japan killed another 333 Antarctic minke whales last summer under the loophole of "scientific research". The killings, of which 122 were pregnant, were termed as "biological sampling", aiming to investigate "the dynamics of the Antarctic marine ecosystem." Japan has killed 333 whales in seasons ending in 2016 and 2017 also, drawing criticism globally.
summary: जापान ने वार्षिक 'शोध' में 333 और व्हेलों को मार गिराया

text: Sridevi's daughter, actress Janhvi Kapoor, has featured on the cover of the June edition of Vogue India, marking her debut on a magazine cover. She can be seen in a floral-print top and a sleeveless jacket, all from French luxury fashion house Louis Vuitton. Janhvi has been interviewed by filmmaker Karan Johar for the magazine's cover story on her.
summary: जान्हवी कपूर ने पहली बार वोग के कवर पर फीचर किया

text: Former world number one Serena Williams has revealed her "Wakanda-inspired catsuit" at the ongoing French Open is her way of being a "superhero", referring to the sci-fi movie 'Black Panther'. The full-length, skintight outfit is designed to protect against blood clots, the 23-time Grand Slam champion added. On Tuesday, Williams won her first Grand Slam match post giving birth.
summary: सुपरहीरो होने का मेरा तरीका: 'ब्लैक पैंथर' सूट पर सेरेना

text: Canadian citizen Karim Baratov who was responsible for a massive security breach at Yahoo in 2014 has been sentenced to five years in prison. Prosecutors alleged that the Russian security service hired Baratov to target email accounts using information obtained from the Yahoo hack. Baratov was indicted in February last year and pleaded guilty in the US later in November.
summary: 2014 के याहू हैक मामले में कनाडाई हैकर को 5 साल की सजा

text: A former software engineer at Snapchat parent Snap, Shannon Lubetich, in a recent interview accused the company of having a 'sexist' and 'toxic' culture. In the interview, Lubetich described various aspects of employee behaviour ranging from inappropriate jokes to company parties with hired female dancers in revealing clothing. Lubetich joined Snap in 2016 after working at Google.
summary: स्नैप के पूर्व कर्मचारी का दावा है कि कंपनी की 'सेक्सिस्ट' संस्कृति है

text: In a message being shared widely on social media, Shimla residents have requested tourists to not visit the Himachal Pradesh capital after seven days of water scarcity. "The city is facing acute water shortage, because of increased tourism, bad water management," the message read. Locals also demanded action against officials who supplied water mixed with sewage in some localities.
summary: स्थानीय लोग पर्यटकों से कहते हैं कि 7 दिनों के बाद शिमला से बचें

text: A 22-year-old daughter of BJP MLA Kushagra Sagar's domestic help in Uttar Pradesh has accused him of raping her several times between 2012 and 2014 on the pretext of marriage. Sagar, who is set to marry next month, denied the allegations saying, "This woman has already approached police in 2014 and came to a compromise taking Ã¢ÂÂ¹10 lakh from me."
summary: बीजेपी विधायक पर शादी से पहले महिला ने लगाया बलात्कार का आरोप

text: Former Uber executive Travis VanderZanden's e-scooter startup Bird is reportedly raising $150 million led by Sequoia Capital which values the company at $1 billion. It comes after Bird raised $100 million at $300-million valuation earlier in March. The new valuation will make Bird the first electric scooter unicorn, a term given to startups that are worth more than $1 billion.
summary: Ex-Uber exec के स्टार्टअप को $ 1 बिलियन वैल्यूएशन पर $ 150mn मिलता है: रिपोर्ट

text: Talking about the relationship between PM Narendra Modi and Chinese President Xi Jinping, External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj said if the leaders face any issue, they can now speak with each other over the phone. She further asserted that this rapport and "ease" was a result of the informal summit held between the two leaders in Wuhan last month.
summary: पीएम मोदी, प्रीज़ शी फोन उठा सकते हैं, मुद्दों को सुलझा सकते हैं: स्वराज

text: The Defence Acquisition Council headed by Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has approved the purchase of military equipment worth Ã¢ÂÂ¹6,900 crore. The equipment include thermal imaging night sights for rocket launchers to facilitate "accurate and continuous engagement" of enemy targets and destruction of bunkers in the dark. The equipment will also enhance the capabilities of Sukhoi-30 warplanes.
summary: सरकार ने सैन्य उपकरण खरीदने की मंजूरी दी, जिसकी कीमत ¢ cr6,900 करोड़ है

text: The Karnataka government has announced that all schools and colleges in Mangaluru and Udupi will remain closed on Wednesday after heavy rainfall flooded several low-lying areas. Karnataka disaster management department asked stranded residents to tweet their location to ensure that officials reach them in time. At least two people were killed in the heavy rainfall.
summary: भारी बारिश के कारण मंगलुरु के स्कूल आज बंद रहे

text: Pakistan decreased the size of health warnings on cigarette packs upon the request of the maker of Marlboro cigarettes, Philip Morris International, and the British American Tobacco, according to Reuters. In 2015, Pakistan had ordered to cover 85% of the packs' surface area with warnings. Pakistan reduced the size of warnings to 50% upon the firms' request in 2017.
summary: मार्लबोरो निर्माता के अनुरोध पर पाक ने तंबाकू की चेतावनी को कम किया: रिपोर्ट

text: Hurricane Maria killed more than 4,600 people in the US territory of Puerto Rico last year, 70 times the official toll of 64, a study by the Harvard University claimed. The inaccurate count was a result of the devastation caused by the storm. One-third of deaths occurred due to inadequate medical care, caused by power outages and destruction of infrastructure.
summary: तूफान मारिया मौत टोल 70 बार आधिकारिक अमेरिकी संख्या: अध्ययन

text: Vedanta-run Sterlite Copper's CEO P Ramnath has said Tamil Nadu government's decision to shut its copper smelter in Tuticorin will affect around 30,000 direct and indirect jobs. He added that hundreds of firms dependent on the Tuticorin smelter for copper are also likely to be impacted due to supply disruptions while India's import bill may go up by $2 billion.
summary: तूतीकोरिन संयंत्र बंद होने से 30,000 रोजगार प्रभावित होंगे: स्टरलाइट

text: The newly reconstituted Fortis Healthcare board has initiated a fresh bidding process for the control of India's second-largest hospital chain. Three bidders who submitted binding offers in the last round, the Munjal-Burman duo, Manipal Health, and Malaysia's IHH Healthcare, have been asked to participate. The bidders in the new round should submit offers with a minimum investment of Ã¢ÂÂ¹1,500 crore.
summary: फोर्टिस ने नए सिरे से बोली प्रक्रिया शुरू की है

text: Lisa Mishra, a US-based YouTuber who did a cover of 'Tareefan' by mixing it with Justin Bieber's 'Let Me Love You' was invited to India to sing a version of 'Tareefan' by Veere Di Wedding's team. The 'Tareefan Reprise', which released on Tuesday, has been sung by Lisa and Qaran, who has also composed it.
summary: 'वीरे ..' टीम YouTuber को आमंत्रित करती है, जिसने भारत में ताइफान को कवर किया था

text: Janhvi Kapoor, in her first ever interview, has revealed her late mother Sridevi never wanted her to be an actress. Janhvi added, "She was more relaxed about [my younger sister] Khushi getting into films. She thought I was naive, that I wasn't thick-skinned enough." The 21-year-old actress further said Sridevi wanted her and Khushi to live a "more relaxed life".
summary: मेरी माँ कभी नहीं चाहती थी कि मैं एक अभिनेत्री बनूँ: जान्हवी

text: Filmmaker Meghna Gulzar said that for her, if a story has grit and immediately connects, the genre becomes irrelevant and what its commercial possibilities are also not considered. "Only then I know that I will be able to do a good job with it," added Meghna. She further said if stories are from within the society, the connection is better.
summary: अगर कहानी मेरे साथ जुड़ती है, तो शैली अप्रासंगिक हो जाती है: मेघना

text: Sonam Kapoor has said she has never gone for fame or stardom while adding, "I have always gone for good work." She added she does not think if it is a 'masala film' or some other genre. She further said, "I think it is just the kind of film that I want to do...the character I really enjoy doing."
summary: मैं कभी प्रसिद्धि के लिए नहीं गया, मैं हमेशा अच्छे काम के लिए जाता हूं: सोनम

text: ICC's Cricket Committee has decided not to scrap coin toss from Tests. The panel headed by ex-India captain Anil Kumble discussed whether the toss should be automatically awarded to the visiting team to reduce home ground advantage. The panel felt that coin toss is an integral part of Test cricket which forms part of narrative of the game, ICC said.
summary: ICC पैनल ने तय किया कि टेस्ट क्रिकेट से सिक्का नहीं उछाला जाएगा

text: Talking about AB de Villiers' retirement, former captain Graeme Smith said South Africa has lost an "X-factor player" who can "single-handedly win games". "He's irreplaceable...To lose someone like him is like taking Virat Kohli out of Team India," he further said. "I think SA cricket is going to find itself in a very interesting phase in next year," he added.
summary: SAD को हारना कोहली को टीम इंडिया से बाहर ले जाने जैसा है: स्मिथ

text: Cork City's 23-year-old winger Kieran Sadlier scored from a distance of 80 yards from inside his own penalty box against St Patrick's Athletic in League of Ireland Premier Division. St Patrick's Athletic goalkeeper Tyson Farago had joined his team's attack for a late corner. Cork City defended the corner, before Sadlier received the ball and cleared it, finding the net.
summary: फुटबॉलर अपने खुद के बॉक्स के अंदर से 80-यार्ड गोल करता है

text: After former President Pranab Mukherjee accepted RSS' invite to attend their event, the organisation on Tuesday said eminent personalities like Mahatma Gandhi and former PM Indira Gandhi also attended their events in the past. RSS member Ratan Sharda said that former PM Jawaharlal Nehru had invited Sangh volunteers to the 1963 Republic Day parade to "imbibe the spirit of nationalism".
summary: महात्मा गांधी, इंदिरा ने भी हमारे कार्यक्रमों में भाग लिया: आरएसएस

text: After former President Pranab Mukherjee agreed to attend an event organised by RSS, union minister Nitin Gadkari said RSS was a nationalist organisation and not Pakistan's ISI. Adding that Mukherjee's decision to accept the invite was a "good start", Gadkari said, "Political untouchability is not good." Over 700 RSS cadres will attend the event, which is scheduled for next month.
summary: RSS का राष्ट्रवादियों का संगठन, यह पाक ISI नहीं है: गडकरी

text: Gujarat MLA and Dalit leader Jignesh Mewani has said at least one lakh Dalits will take a pledge in the name of BR Ambedkar to not vote for BJP in the upcoming Rajasthan elections. He added that the campaign will be extended to Maharashtra. PM Narendra Modi should at least provide employment to unemployed ABVP and RSS workers, he added.
summary: 1L दलित अंबेडकर के नाम पर बीजेपी के खिलाफ करेंगे शपथ: गुजरा विधायक

text: Sikh peace activist Charanjeet Singh was shot dead on Tuesday by assailants on a bike in Pakistan's Peshawar. While the motive behind the attack hasn't been established, local political leaders reportedly suspect the involvement of the country's spy agency ISI. This was the first targeted killing of a Sikh man since the assassination of a Sikh Minorities Minister in 2016.
summary: सिख शांति कार्यकर्ता की पाकिस्तान में गोली मारकर हत्या

text: As many as 10 lakh bank employees across India will go on a two-day strike from tomorrow in protest against the nominal 2% wage hike, the National Organisation of Bank Workers said. "It's only because of provisions towards non-performing assets that banks have booked losses...bank employees aren't responsible," the United Forum of Bank Unions said.
summary: कल से 2 दिन की हड़ताल पर जाने वाले 10 लाख बैंक कर्मचारी

text: The IRCTC's new 'Wait List Prediction' tool, which was launched on Tuesday, will tell passengers the probability of their waitlist ticket being confirmed at the time of booking. The probability will be calculated based on historical data of the train and route in question, officials said. The IRCTC also allowed users to check ticket availability without having to log in.
summary: IRCTC का नया टूल टिकट कन्फर्मेशन का मौका कैसे देगा?

text: An Italian court has summoned the parents of a 1-year-old boy for naming him Benito Mussolini, report said. This comes as the child shares his name with Italian dictator Benito Mussolini who had allied with Adolf Hitler during World War II. As per reports, the child was named after one of his grandfathers, which is a common practice in Italy.
summary: बच्चे के नामकरण के लिए कोर्ट ने इतालवी दंपति को बुलाया 'मुसोलिनी'

text: Asserting that the Centre is not willing to release funds for Andhra Pradesh, Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu asked why the state should pay taxes to the government. Adding that the state's capital Amravati could earn a lot of revenue, Naidu said, "But the Centre is still not forthcoming in helping us build the capital city. Why?"
summary: अगर केंद्रीय सरकार फंड नहीं देती है तो केंद्रीय करों का भुगतान क्यों करें: आंध्र सीएम

text: A man disguised as a devotee attacked a priest of a temple in Rajasthan after WhatsApp messages falsely claimed President Ram Nath Kovind was not allowed to enter the sanctum sanctorum. Recently, the President had offered prayers at the temple's doorstep as his wife had a knee problem, and several false WhatsApp messages were circulated.
summary: प्रीस्ट ने मंदिर में अनुमति नहीं दिए जाने के फर्जी समाचारों पर हमला किया

text: At least 54 people were killed due to thunderstorms and lightning in Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand, and Madhya Pradesh in the past 24 hours, officials said on Tuesday. The death toll caused by adverse weather conditions this month has risen to around 290. Meteorological Department officials said the frequency of thunderstorms increased due to dry spells and high western disturbances.
summary: 24 घंटे में चार राज्यों में आंधी-तूफान से 54 की मौत

text: Speaking about the Centre's decision to halt anti-militancy operations in Jammu and Kashmir during Ramadan, Home Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday said the hands of the soldiers were not tied. He added that soldiers can retaliate if a terrorist attack takes place. Earlier, Jammu and Kashmir called for a unilateral ceasefire in the state during Ramadan.
summary: जम्मू-कश्मीर में रमजान के दौरान जवानों के हाथ नहीं बंधे: राजनाथ सिंह

text: The Director Generals of Military Operations (DGMO) of India and Pakistan on Tuesday agreed to fully implement the ceasefire understanding of 2003 in letter and in spirit. They further agreed to ensure that the agreement is not violated by either side from now on. "In case of any issue, restraint will be exercised," Indian Army said in a statement.
summary: भारत, पाक 2003 के युद्धविराम समझौते को पूरी तरह से लागू करने के लिए सहमत है

text: The government has decided to extend Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 lakh to retired Presidents and Ã¢ÂÂ¹90,000 to retired Vice Presidents towards actual charges incurred as office expenses annually, the Home Ministry said. Meanwhile, the thunderstorms also uprooted dozens of trees and electricity poles and tore apart several houses' rooftops.

text: Two girls were hit by a train in Delhi and declared brought dead after they were rushed to a hospital on Sunday, police said. Police also found a bag which had a note with "sorry father" written on it and claimed that one of the girls' mother had died a few years ago and she was depressed.
summary: दिल्ली में ट्रेन से टकराईं दो लड़कियां, 'सॉरी पिता' नहीं मिला

text: Former Uttar Pradesh Chief Ministers Mulayam Singh Yadav and his son Akhilesh have moved the Supreme Court seeking "appropriate" time to vacate their government bungalows in Lucknow. This comes after the Supreme Court ordered six former CMs to vacate their official accommodations and the state government served notices asking them to vacate the bungalows within 15 days.
summary: मुलायम ने SC से घर खाली करने के लिए SC से 'उचित' समय मांगा

text: Voting for Lok Sabha bypolls has been temporarily suspended at 35 booths in Maharashtra's Bhandara-Gondia due to faulty EVMs, district authorities said. The Samajwadi Party and a Rashtriya Lok Dal electoral candidate have written to the Election Commission over EVM glitches. Bypolls are being held for four Lok Sabha seats and ten Assembly seats across several states.
summary: ईवीएम में गड़बड़ी को लेकर महाराष्ट्र के 35 बूथों पर मतदान स्थगित

text: French President Emmanuel Macron on Monday announced honorary citizenship for a Malian migrant who climbed four floors of a building in Paris to save a four-year-old child hanging from a balcony. The 22-year-old Mamoudou Gassama, who was dubbed 'Spiderman', will be offered a place in the fire brigade. Gassama had said that he acted without thinking.
summary: प्रवासी के लिए फ्रांसीसी नागरिकता, जिसने बालकनी से लटकते हुए बच्चे को बचाया

text: Former Pakistan Chief Justice Nasirul Mulk was on Monday appointed as the interim Prime Minister of the country until the general elections are held on July 25. "We have chosen his name on the basis of merit," leader of the Opposition Khursheed Shah said. The decision comes ahead of the dissolution of the current government and parliament on Thursday.
summary: पाकिस्तान ने पूर्व मुख्य न्यायाधीश को कार्यवाहक प्रधानमंत्री के रूप में नामित किया

text: 'Raazi', which released on May 11, has become actress Alia Bhatt's third film to enter the Ã¢ÂÂ¹100 crore club. The film, which also stars Vicky Kaushal, earned Ã¢ÂÂ¹102.50 crore within 17 days of its release. Alia's other two films which have earned over Ã¢ÂÂ¹100 crore are '2 States' and 'Badrinath Ki Dulhania'.
summary: Raazi आलिया भट्ट की to club100 करोड़ क्लब में प्रवेश करने वाली तीसरी फिल्म बन गई

text: The International Cricket Council has stated that Al Jazeera, the Doha-based news broadcaster behind the recent sting operation into match-fixing in cricket, is not cooperating with them for an official investigation into the malpractice. The board had reportedly asked the TV channel to share all the information they have gathered in the case, unedited and unabridged.
summary: अल-जज़ीरा मैच फिक्सिंग जांच में सहयोग नहीं कर रहे: आईसीसी

text: Google has awarded over Ã¢ÂÂ¹24 lakh to a teenager from Uruguay for finding a security flaw that would have allowed hackers to make changes to internal company systems. Ezequiel Pereira found the bug earlier this year but revealed it only after Google confirmed that the issue was resolved. It marks Pereira's fifth accepted bug from Google's bug bounty program.
summary: सुरक्षा दोष खोजने के लिए किशोरी को Google पुरस्कार ager lakh24 लाख

text: While comparing Microsoft with other technology firms, the company's CEO Satya Nadella in a recent interview said, "If it was not for Microsoft's openness, the (World Wide Web) web wouldn't have happened." Nadella further highlighted "how closed and how walled gardened" the technology firms have rigged the current ecosystem as compared to how Microsoft used to be.
summary: एक खुले Microsoft के बिना, वेब नहीं होता: सीईओ

text: Homegrown cab-aggregator Ola is reportedly planning to set up a holding company to integrate its business units including food delivery app Foodpanda, businesses of electric vehicles and the international unit. The businesses are expected to have respective heads who will run them independently. The aim is to boost the company's valuation and improve business management, reports added.
summary: ओला अपनी व्यापारिक इकाइयों को एकीकृत करने के लिए होल्डिंग फर्म स्थापित कर सकती है

text: NITI Aayog is planning to launch an online portal for startups to access public data of various ministries to address sector-specific issues. "The government departments are generally hesitant in sharing data with private players... we are trying to change that," the government think-tank's CEO Amitabh Kant said. "Startups can leverage this data with the use of artificial intelligence," he added.
summary: स्टार्टअप्स के लिए सुलभ सार्वजनिक डेटा पोर्टल खोलने के लिए NITI Aayog

text: A surgeon in Maharashtra's Nashik removed 4,100 gallstones from a 43-year-old patient in a surgery which lasted almost four hours on Saturday. Dr Amit Sharad Kele, who operated on the patient, said that each of the stones ranged between 3 mm to 4 mm in diameter. It took two hospital staff members two hours to count all the stones.
summary: सर्जन ने 4hr सर्जरी में मरीज से 4,100 पित्त पथरी निकाल दी

text: BJP MP Amar Sable has said PM Narendra Modi never promised to deposit Ã¢ÂÂ¹15 lakh in every citizen's bank account, adding that it was not part of the BJP's election manifesto. During his 2014 election campaign, PM Modi had said that if the black money stashed abroad was brought to India, every poor person could get Ã¢ÂÂ¹15 lakh from it.
summary: पीएम मोदी ने हर नागरिक को Modi lakh never15 लाख का वादा नहीं किया: BJP सांसद

text: Donald Trump's lawyer Rudy Giuliani has said that efforts by the US President and his allies to discredit the Russia probe are part of a PR campaign aimed at limiting the risk of Trump's impeachment. "Of course we have to do it to defend the President," he added. Trump has repeatedly called the Russia probe a "witch hunt".
summary: रूस पर ट्रम्प के हमले एक पीआर रणनीति की जांच करते हैं, उनके वकील कहते हैं

text: Discussing the use of abusive words in the 2006 film 'Omkara', Kareena Kapoor Khan said, "Saif Ali Khan was the villain in Omkara...he was bad mouthing. He won lot of awards for the film." Talking about her upcoming film 'Veere Di Wedding', Kareena added that the film requires lines with cuss words and such words have not been used forcefully.
summary: सैफ ने 'ओमकारा' में कॉस शब्दों का इस्तेमाल किया और पुरस्कार जीते: करीना

text: After winning IPL 2018 on Sunday, CSK captain MS Dhoni said, "Lot of people talk about numbers...so tonight is 27th, my jersey number is seven and this is CSK's seventh final. Enough reasons to win." "But none of these reasons matter, what matters is that we've won...in the end," he added. Notably, Dhoni considers seven as his lucky number.
summary: दिनांक 27 वाँ, जर्सी नं। 7, CSK का 7 वां फाइनल: जीत के बाद धोनी

text: CSK captain MS Dhoni left his teammates posing with the IPL trophy to hold daughter Ziva in his arms. Dhoni, who was standing at the back while his team posed, saw Ziva running and picked her up before giving her a swing. Dhoni and Ziva were then seen enjoying the confetti shower around them after she pointed towards it.
summary: धोनी ने बेटी को गोद में लेने के लिए IPL का खिताब मनाया

text: IPL 2018 final's Man of the Match, Shane Watson, played with an injured leg to score a match-winning unbeaten 117, the highest-ever score in an IPL final. CSK pacer Dwayne Bravo said, "Watson batted on one leg and despite the hamstring, his experience helped him." Watson was the only player to score two tons in the IPL 2018.
summary: आईपीएल फाइनल में चोटिल वॉटसन ने सबसे ज्यादा रन बनाए

text: After winning his third IPL title, CSK captain MS Dhoni said, "We talked a lot about age, but what's more important is the fitness." "If you ask most captains, they want players who move well on the field. Doesn't matter if you're 19-20 years old. Age is just a number, but you have to be very fit," Dhoni added.
summary: उम्र सिर्फ एक संख्या है, फिटनेस मायने रखती है: आईपीएल खिताब के बाद धोनी

text: Talking about Microsoft's business model, CEO Satya Nadella in a recent interview said, "I do believe right now Microsoft is probably on the right side of history." Emphasising on Microsoft's business model, based on its customers being successful, Nadella also said, "If they are successful they will pay us." "We are not one of these transaction-driven... economies," he added.
summary: Microsoft इतिहास के दाईं ओर है: CEO सत्या नडेला

text: Researchers at St Polten University of Applied Sciences have developed an app which alerts the users of cookies which track smartphones using ultrasound. The app, which is allegedly the first ultrasound firewall for smartphones, will also allow users to block such cookies without affecting the device. Ultrasonic communication allows devices to be paired and information to be exchanged.
summary: ऐप स्मार्टफ़ोन की अल्ट्रासोनिक ट्रैकिंग को रोकने के लिए

text: Reacting to Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal congratulating children for their boards performance, CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "If you stop creating obstacles, wonders could be achieved in many sectors." Further questioning the removal of Atishi Marlena, working as an advisor to Education Minister Manish Sisodia, the CM said, "So you agree that Delhi government doing great work in education?"
summary: यदि आप बाधा नहीं बनाते हैं तो संभव है: केजरीवाल एल-जी के लिए

text: Punjab Minister Navjot Singh Sidhu has said his son and wife won't accept the government posts of assistant advocate general and Punjab Warehousing Corporation chief that they were offered respectively. This comes after the Shiromani Akali Dal accused the ruling Congress of "favouritism". The SAD said Congress was trying to turn its 'Ghar Ghar Naukri' promise into 'Ek Ghar Naukri'.
summary: आलोचना के बाद सिद्धू के बेटे, सरकार ने नहीं ली सरकार की पोस्ट

text: Odisha MP Jay Panda on Monday resigned from the Biju Janata Dal party and said he will formally convey his decision to the Lok Sabha Speaker. In a letter to Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik, Panda wrote, "It's with deep anguish, hurt and sorrow that I have decided to quit the politics into which our BJD has descended."
summary: बीजेडी के जय पांडा ने पार्टी का पक्ष लिया, ओडिशा के सीएम को नाराज़गी जताई

text: After at least 13 people died in protests against the Sterlite Copper plant in Tamil Nadu's Tuticorin, Deputy CM O Panneerselvam on Monday said the government will take necessary steps to permanently close the plant. Earlier, the state government had increased the compensation to families of those killed in anti-Sterlite protests from Ã¢ÂÂ¹10 lakh to Ã¢ÂÂ¹20 lakh.
summary: स्टरलाइट प्लांट बंद करेगा: विरोध प्रदर्शनों में 13 की मौत के बाद TN Dy CM

text: A jawan and a civilian were killed on Sunday in a militant attack on an Army camp in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district. Both were rushed to a hospital where they succumbed to their injuries. These are reportedly the first deaths in a militant attack on security installation since the Centre announced a ceasefire during Ramadan.
summary: J & K आर्मी कैंप पर आतंकी हमले में शहीद जवान, नागरिक

text: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has said no action will be taken against the policeman who was arrested when he entered court premises with a revolver, a week after he booked a Congress candidate for illegal sand mining. Stating ex-SHO Parminder Bajwa was suffering from bipolar disorder, Singh said he will be given help and will be kept in service.
summary: कोंग के खिलाफ कोई कार्रवाई नहीं जिसने कांग्ेस उम्मीदवार की बुकिंग की: पंजाब सी.एम.

text: Amid the US' increased scrutiny on H-1B visas, NASSCOM Chairman and Wipro's Chief Strategy Officer Rishad Premji has said that it's important to "separate the sentiment from fact". He asserted that Indian IT industry uses less than 10,000 of the 65,000 H-1B visas issued every year. He added that 70% of the visas go to Indians, not to Indian companies.
summary: एच -1 बी वीजा पर तथ्यों से अलग भावना: ऋषद प्रेमजी

text: South Korean police have summoned Korean Air Chairman Cho Yang-ho's wife over allegations she physically and verbally assaulted over 10 employees. Lee Myung-hee told reporters she felt "sorry for causing troubles". Notably, her older daughter was jailed after she threw a tantrum on a flight in 2014 while her younger daughter is under investigation for assaulting a colleague.
summary: कोरियन एयर चीफ की पत्नी को कर्मचारियों के साथ मारपीट के लिए बुलाया गया

text: Actor Arjun Rampal and his wife former supermodel Mehr Jesia have announced their separation after 20 years of marriage. "All journeys have different paths. We feel that it's time for us to move on to different destinations henceforth," the official statement read. It added, "We will continue to be solid for each other... Relationships can end, but love lives on."
summary: अर्जुन रामपाल, पत्नी मेहर ने शादी के 20 साल बाद शादी की

text: The record of most sixes in a single edition of IPL was set in this year's edition, with 872 sixes hit across 51 matches. As many as 167 more sixes were hit this season as compared to IPL 2017 and 250 more than the inaugural edition. The previous record of most sixes in an edition (731) was set in 2012.
summary: IPL 2018 में 2017 की तुलना में 167 अधिक 6, 1 सीजन से 250 अधिक देखा गया

text: Kings XI Punjab fast bowler Andrew Tye, who was bought for Ã¢ÂÂ¹7.2 crore, was awarded the Purple Cap for taking the most wickets in Indian Premier League 2018. The 31-year-old Australian took 24 wickets in 14 IPL 2018 matches, with his each wicket costing Ã¢ÂÂ¹30 lakh, Notably, Tye is the first-ever Australian cricketer to win the Purple Cap.
summary: IPL 2018 के पर्पल कैप विजेता की कीमत KXIP Ã per w30 लाख प्रति विकेट है

text: With around 71,700 pending cases, the Delhi High Court is presently functioning with 36 judges, which is nearly half of its sanctioned strength of 60 judges. The number will reduce to 33 as more judges are expected to retire by August-end. Further, the high court has been functioning with an Acting Chief Justice for over a year now.
summary: दिल्ली HC के पास न्यायाधीशों की स्वीकृत संख्या लगभग आधी है

text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday claimed that only 13 crore families had LPG connections till 2014, most of whom were rich people. "In the last four years 10 crore new connections have been added for the benefit of the poor," he added. PM Modi said this while interacting with beneficiaries of the Ujjwala Yojana through the NaMo app.
summary: 2014 तक केवल 13 करोड़ दिए गए एलपीजी, हमने 4 साल में 10 करोड़ दिए: पीएम

text: During the 44th edition of his Mann Ki Baat programme, PM Narendra Modi praised Odisha-based tea-seller D Prakash Rao for spending 50% of his earnings on education, food, and health for 70 slum children. Rao has opened a school named 'Asha Ashvaasan' for the children. PM Modi also posted a photo with Rao, whom he visited in Cuttack on Saturday.

text: Pakistan on Sunday said it was forced to conduct nuclear tests on May 28, 1998 in self-defence and as a result of "hostile posturing" by India. These developments effectively ended the possibility of keeping the South Asian region "nuclear-weapons free", it added. Pakistan had conducted its nuclear tests in Balochistan's Chagai days after India's Pokhran-II tests.

text: The Dionne quintuplets, the world's first quintuplets known to have survived infancy, were born on May 28, 1934 in Canada. They were born prematurely, together weighing 14 pounds. The government took over the girls' custody after their father signed a contract to exhibit them at a fair, citing exploitation. The parents won back the custody when the girls were nine.
summary: शैशवावस्था में जीवित रहने वाले पहले क्विंटुपलेट्स का जन्म 84 साल पहले हुआ था

text: A video of a Malian migrant scaling four floors of a building in Paris to save a child hanging from a balcony has gone viral. Mamoudou Gassama can be seen pulling himself up from balcony to balcony with his bare hands in the space of just a few seconds. The 22-year-old will now be honoured by French President Emmanuel Macron.
summary: बच्चे को बालकनी से लटकने से बचाने के लिए प्रवासी 4 मंजिलों पर चढ़ता है

text: Confirming that a team of US negotiators was in North Korea for talks ahead of his planned summit with Kim Jong-un, President Donald Trump said, "North Korea will be a great economic and financial nation one day." He further said that North Korea has brilliant potential. Trump's confirmation comes three days after he cancelled the summit.
summary: उत्तर कोरिया एक दिन एक महान आर्थिक राष्ट्र होगा: ट्रम्प

text: Twenty-one state-owned banks have incurred losses amounting to Ã¢ÂÂ¹25,775 crore due to banking frauds in 2017-18, an RTI reply has stated. PNB had incurred the highest loss of Ã¢ÂÂ¹6,461.13 crore during the fiscal, followed by SBI, which incurred losses of Ã¢ÂÂ¹2,390.75 crore. The RBI clarified that only those cases of fraud, involving a sum of over Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 lakh, were included.
summary: 21 सरकार बैंकों को वित्त वर्ष 18 में बैंक धोखाधड़ी में govt banks banks25,775 करोड़ का नुकसान हुआ: RTI

text: Packaged goods company Patanjali Ayurved's Managing Director (MD) Acharya Balkrishna has said that "others get scared" when Patanjali says it is entering an industry. "At times, people spread words (that we are entering a sector) as well," he added. He also said that the company has been approached by electric vehicles, steel, and mobile chip manufacturers for support.
summary: नए उद्योग में प्रवेश करने पर अन्य लोग डर जाते हैं: पतंजलि के एमडी

text: India on Sunday launched its second IT corridor in China in the southwestern city of Guiyang which will focus on Big Data. Agreements worth Ã¢ÂÂ¹38 crore were signed at the launch of the corridor by Guiyang Municipal Government and India's NASSCOM. India's first IT corridor in China was established in the port city of Dalian last December.
summary: भारत ने चीन में दूसरा आईटी गलियारा शुरू किया

text: Actor Salman Khan responded to commentator Irfan Pathan's question about CSK being called a team of 'old men'. Salman, who was present in the Hindi commentary box alongside Anil Kapoor, said, "What are you even saying!? No one retires at the age of 30". CSK had as many as nine players aged above 30 in their squad in IPL 2018.
summary: CSK की 'वृद्ध टीम' पर पठान के सवाल का सलमान ने किया जवाब

text: Aamir Khan has said that he does rehearsals for three to four months before a film's shoot. "I rehearse with the director, then I do rehearsals alone. That's when I memorise my lines so that when I am on the set, I'll be ready," he added. Aamir further said, "It should be your lines...not the writer's...I write lines as well."
summary: मैं एक फिल्म की शूटिंग से पहले 3-4 महीने तक रिहर्सल करता हूं: आमिर खान

text: In an Instagram post after winning the IPL title for the third time, CSK captain MS Dhoni wrote, "Ziva doesn't care about the trophy, wants to run on the lawn according to her wordings." Dhoni, whose post featured his wife Sakshi, daughter Ziva and the IPL trophy, also wrote, "Thanks everyone for the support and Mumbai for turning yellow."
summary: जिवा ट्रॉफी की परवाह नहीं करता, लॉन पर चलना चाहता है: धोनी

text: Australian Formula One racer Daniel Ricciardo handed Red Bull a victory in their 250th race in the Formula One at Sunday's Monaco GP. Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel, last year's winner at the Monaco GP, finished second while Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton was third. With Vettel finishing above Hamilton, Hamilton's lead at the top of drivers' championship table was cut to 14 points.
summary: डैनियल रिकियार्डो ने रेड बुल की 250 वीं दौड़ में मोनाको जीपी जीता

text: Talking about child rape cases in India, Indian cricketer and father to two girls, Gautam Gambhir said, "I am scared that my girls will soon ask me the meaning of the word rape." The Delhi cricketer added that his worst nightmare is a day when he hears his four-year-old daughter saying, "A for Abuse, B for Brutality, C for Cruelty".
summary: मुझे डर है कि मेरी बेटियां मुझसे बलात्कार का मतलब पूछेंगी: गंभीर

text: Search engines like Google and Microsoft's Bing may have to start paying for showing news on their platform, under the rules endorsed by the European Union. It would allow news publishers to ask for payment for up to one year after publication. Further, it would force websites like YouTube to seek a license from rightsholders for displaying their content.
summary: Google, बिंग को EU में समाचार प्रकाशकों को भुगतान करना शुरू करना पड़ सकता है

text: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu on Sunday said that PM Narendra Modi is a "campaign PM" who has failed to deliver on promises. Adding that Make in India, Digital India, and Startup India were just slogans that did not benefit anyone, the Chief Minister said, "The BJP forming government again is a distant dream."
summary: पीएम मोदी एक अभियान पीएम, वादों को पूरा करने में नाकाम रहे: आंध्र सीएम

text: US-based e-commerce giant Amazon has led a $12 million funding round in Mumbai-based online insurance startup Acko. New investor Ashish Dhawan and existing investor Catamaran Ventures, owned by NR Narayana Murthy, also participated in the funding round. Founded in 2017, Acko offers general insurance products and has raised $42 million to date including the latest funding.
summary: अमेजन ने मुंबई बीमा स्टार्टअप में $ 12 मिलियन निवेश का नेतृत्व किया

text: Newly-elected Karnataka Congress MLA Siddu Nyamagouda on Monday died in a car crash near Bengaluru while returning to Jamkhandi from Goa. The incident occurred after a tyre of the car he was travelling in burst and the car smashed into a wall. Nyamagouda was one of the 78 Congress MLAs elected to the Karnataka Assembly in the May 12 polls.
summary: कार दुर्घटना में नव निर्वाचित कर्नाटक कांग्रेस विधायक का निधन

text: A ten-year-old girl died and six people sustained serious injuries after a giant ferris wheel crashed at a fair in Andhra Pradesh's Anantapur district on Sunday. The giant wheel reportedly crashed after a loose screw in the wheel came off, reports said. Locals later caught the wheel operator and beat him up, claiming he was drunk at the time.
summary: आंध्र मेले में फेरिस व्हील के दुर्घटनाग्रस्त होने के बाद 10 वर्षीय की मौत हो गई

text: A 31-year-old auto-rickshaw driver in Delhi's Khadar Puliya on Saturday threw his six-year-old son into a canal after getting irritated by his constant crying and demand to eat momos. The accused, who was in an inebriated state, was caught by passersby before being arrested by the police. Rescue teams were deployed and the boy's body was recovered on Sunday afternoon.

text: Bharti Airtel Chairman Sunil Mittal is looking to invest $1 billion into a hotel chain founded by his son-in-law Sharan Pasricha in London, as per reports. The injection would come from a Bharti Group company that handles Mittal's family wealth.

text: Turkish President Recep Tayyip ErdoÃÂan has called on Turks to convert their dollar and euro savings into lira, in order to prop up the local currency. text: Allen Solly, India's pioneer brand in unconventional work-wear from Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd has launched 'Open Work Culture' campaign. text: IPL 2018 witnessed over 30 records being broken. KXIP opener KL Rahul smashed the fastest-ever fifty in IPL history off 14 balls in the second match of the edition. text: Playing in their seventh Indian Premier League final, Chennai Super Kings on Sunday defeated SunRisers Hyderabad to clinch their third Indian Premier League title. Notably, Chennai Super Kings defeated SunRisers Hyderabad in each of their four encounters this season.

text: After Volkswagen's Fallersleben plant was partially destroyed post World War II, the British offered Volkswagen to Ford, free of charge. text: Domino's Pizza Co-founder James Monaghan in 1961 traded his 50% stake in the company to his brother and Co-founder Tom Monaghan for his used Volkswagen Beetle car. text: German carmaker Volkswagen briefly became the world's most valuable company with over $370 billion market capitalisation in October 2008. Volkswagen's share price rocketed after Porsche revealed that it had effectively gained control of 74% of Volkswagen's voting shares. Volkswagen, which was founded on May 28, 1937,  had dethroned energy titan Exxon Mobil to become the most valuable company.

text: Chennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni set the record for the most stumpings in the Indian Premier League, effecting his 33rd stumping dismissal against SunRisers Hyderabad in the IPL 2018 final on Sunday. text: The government will not allow "fly-by-night" data mining firms to improperly harvest social media data of Indian citizens, Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad has said. text: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), effective from May 25, will require Indian firms dealing with EU to provide justification of the collected data. Non-compliance will cost companies $23.3 million or 4% of their annual turnover.

text: Denying the claims that it exaggerated its ability to mass produce Model 3 car, Tesla has asked a US court to dismiss a lawsuit filed by the shareholders. text: Inaugurating the country's first 14-lane expressway, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said, "My country is my family." Speaking of the Congress, he said, "We all know their predicament. text: For the first time in Test cricket, a team's top-four players scored tons in an innings, when Wasim Jaffer, Dinesh Karthik, Rahul Dravid and Sachin Tendulkar scored centuries against Bangladesh in a Test that ended on May 27, 2007. text: The UK's opposition, Labour Party, has called for the delisting of Anil Agarwal-led Vedanta Resources from London Stock Exchange after 13 people died during protests against its copper plant in Tuticorin. summary: बहुत सारी बाइक लें, लेकिन एक साथ सवारी न करें: भज्जी पर एमएसडी

text: Ahead of the IPL 2018 final, Chennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni has revealed that he was saddened for not having played more matches at his side's home ground Chepauk Stadium in Chennai. text: Accusing the Samajwadi Party of levelling false charges against him, Uttar Pradesh BJP MLA Roshan Lal Verma on Friday claimed that he felt like committing suicide due to "immense mental stress" and "frustration". While a woman has accused Verma and his son of raping her, another woman accused the MLA of grabbing her land.

text: China-based startup VeChain has created a tracking and authentication platform for wine using blockchain technology. It stores data on the wine at every step of the production process, which can be accessed by a consumer by scanning a QR code on the bottle. Its technology also allows customers to validate the authenticity of luxury products.

text: Over 40,000 people across several locations in Australia looked at the Moon at the same time this week to help Australian National University break its own stargazing world record. text: University of Illinois researchers led by IIT Delhi alumnus Rohit Bhargava have built a 3D printer that makes structures using sugar alcohol, used to make throat lozenges. The new printer creates a delicate network of thin ribbons, rather than making a layer-upon-layer solid shell like commercial printers. The water-soluble structures could be used as scaffolds for growing tissue, said Bhargava.

text: A mob in Bengaluru's Whitefield area on Friday attacked three women based on a fake viral WhatsApp message that warned citizens against gangs that kidnapped children. The women were later rescued by the police. This comes days after a 26-year-old man was lynched by a mob over similar suspicions when they saw him talking to children.

text: National Conference MLA Omar Abdullah has sanctioned Ã¢ÂÂ¹1.3 lakh for the family of the woman who was detained at a hotel with Army Major Nitin Leetul Gogoi. Earlier, Major Gogoi had used a Kashmiri man as a 'human shield' from stone-pelters. Officials said the family, which currently lives in a tin shed, will use the money to construct a house.

text: A man was arrested in Saudi Arabia for teaching his two-year-old daughter how to smoke. text: Authorities in Nebraska, US have seized 53.5 kilograms of the drug fentanyl, enough to kill an estimated 2.6 crore people. The drugs were found in a hidden compartment of a truck last month and are estimated to be worth over Ã¢ÂÂ¹135 crore. Fentanyl is 30 to 50 times more potent than heroin.

text: CBSE class 12 topper Meghna Srivastava scored 99 marks out of 100 only in English, scoring full marks in every other subject to get a total of 499 marks out of 500. text: Low-cost sanitary pads and condoms will be sold at toilet facilities both inside and outside railway stations for passengers as well as people living in its vicinity, according to a policy approved by Railway Board. text: Speaking on the NDA government's fourth anniversary, BJP President Amit Shah on Saturday said it had the most hardworking PM in Narendra Modi who works 15-18 hours a day. text: Delhi's Patiala House Court on Saturday convicted gangster Abu Salem in the 2002 extortion case. text: Girls outperformed boys with a pass percentage of 88.31% against 78.99% in the CBSE class 12 exams, the results of which were declared on Saturday. text: Former chief of Pakistan's intelligence agency ISI, Asad Durrani, has said that PM Narendra Modi's "drama and tamasha merely creates spectacular confusion". Durrani added he preferred former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee as his approach was "right".

text: Senior bureaucrat Sushil Chandra has been given one-year extension as Chairman of the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) till May 2019. text: Actress Geeta Kapoor, who starred in the 1972 film 'Pakeezah', passed away aged 57 in an old age home. text: Manchester United scored twice in injury time to register a 2-1 comeback victory in the Champions League final against Bayern Munich on May 26, 1999. text: Major US media outlets including the New York Daily News and LA Times were forced to close their websites in parts of Europe following the roll out of General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) on Friday. The party also requested a US-based portal creation company to block the website.

text: Floating post offices will be set up in the Ganga and Yamuna rivers during the Kumbh Mela in Allahabad next year that will allow people to turn their photos and selfies into postal stamps. text: The oldest known case of dandruff has been identified in a small meat-eating dinosaur that roamed the Earth about 125 million years ago. text: The Delhi High Court on Friday issued a notice to the Delhi government over a plea seeking to lower the legal drinking age of 25 years in the capital. text: Floating hotel 'Ark Deck Bar' capsized on Friday near Bandra-Worli sea link in Mumbai reportedly due to anchorage issues. text: Kerala's capital Trivandrum has registered the highest pass percentage of 97.32% in the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) Class 12 exams. text: Kolkata Knight Riders' owner Shah Rukh Khan said he will have to cancel his flight booked to attend the final of the IPL 2018 after his side's exit on Friday. "U did yourself proud...Love you & yes I am smiling. Thks for the entertainment & so many moments of glory. V r an awesome team!", part of SRK's tweet read.
summary: केकेआर के बाहर होने के बाद शाहरुख खान ने फाइनल के लिए उड़ान रद्द की

text: Real Madrid forward Cristiano Ronaldo accidentally hit a cameraman in the face with a strike during a training session ahead of the Champions League final in Kiev, Ukraine. The five-time Ballon d'Or winner was seen putting his hands on his head after seeing the cameraman being struck. Ronaldo later gave his warm-up jacket to the cameraman, who required stitches.
summary: रोनाल्डो ने कैमरामैन को गेंद से मारा, उसे एक उपहार दिया

text: Facebook-owned messaging service WhatsApp has confirmed the presence of a bug which lets its users receive messages from blocked contacts. This comes after users complained of the issue, adding that the blocked contacts could even read their WhatsApp statuses and see their display pictures. Adding that it is aware of the issue, WhatsApp said it will roll out a fix.
summary: व्हाट्सएप बग की पुष्टि करता है कि उपयोगकर्ताओं को अवरुद्ध उपयोगकर्ताओं से ग्रंथों को प्राप्त करने देता है

text: Technology major Apple has said that it is closing a retail store in Atlantic City, New Jersey, a move which will affect 52 employees. Apple said that it is shutting the store due to a "sharp decline in tourism and visitors to the area." The company said that all of the store's employees will be offered jobs within Apple.
summary: पर्यटन में गिरावट के कारण Apple ने अमेरिका में एक रिटेल स्टोर बंद कर दिया

text: YouTube has rolled out its mobile-only messaging feature, launched last August, to its web version also. Users can now share videos and chat on the video-hosting platform while conversations can be accessed from the chat bubble icon next to the notification bell. Further, users can post content into private or group conversations using the share button under any YouTube video.
summary: YouTube अपने मोबाइल-ओनली मैसेजिंग फीचर को वेब तक पहुंचाता है

text: Filmmaker Philip Bloom has claimed Google used 73 seconds of footage from seven of his videos in its internal video, leaked last week, without permission. Bloom added when he contacted Google, it said the video was only for internal use and offered no compensation. Google said the executive who made the video has been reminded of its "strict copyright rules."
summary: फिल्म निर्माता ने लीक क्लिप में Google पर अपने वीडियो का उपयोग करने का आरोप लगाया

text: Slamming Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath for not removing his chappals while garlanding Maratha warrior Chhatrapati Shivaji's photo, Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray said he felt like hitting him with the same chappals. Thackeray added he should have sat in a cave if he really was a yogi instead of becoming CM. "He's no yogi, he's a bhogi," Thackeray said.
summary: यूपी के सीएम योगी को चप्पलों से मारने जैसा लगा: शिवसेना प्रमुख

text: Micro sculpture artist Sachin Sanghe tweeted a video of himself making a chalk sculpture of Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the occasion of the completion of four years of BJP-led NDA government at the Centre. He wrote, "Miniature Chalk Sculpture of our beloved PM Sri [Narendra Modi] ji...Congratulations, Sir, on the successful completion of 4 years of government."
summary: कलाकार अपने सरकार के 4 साल पर पीएम मोदी की चाक की मूर्ति बनाते हैं

text: A man from Thane has been arrested for allegedly cyberstalking a Mumbai woman and sending her obscene messages and pornographic images using six different mobile phone numbers. Police said the accused had first called her saying that he is in love with her, but the woman rejected his advances. He later started sending her obscene content from different numbers.
summary: ठाणे के आदमी ने 6 नंबर से महिला को पोर्न भेजने के लिए रखा

text: London police have seized about Ã¢ÂÂ¹4.5 crore worth of Bitcoin from a computer hacker in a case described as the first of its kind for the 188-year-old department. Officers also recovered a memory card containing 7.8 crore usernames and passwords. The 26-year-old was sentenced to 10 years in prison for attacking 100 companies worldwide and selling their data for Bitcoin.
summary: हैकर ने बिटकॉइन के er caught4.5 करोड़, 8 करोड़ पासवर्ड के साथ पकड़ा

text: An Air India Delhi-Rajkot flight left two passengers behind at the Delhi Airport on Friday after the airline didn't let them onboard, claiming that the flight was overbooked. Calling it a "rare occurrence", an Air India spokesperson said, "2-3% extra booking was allowed and in this particular flight all the passengers reported for the journey, thus leading to this incident."
summary: ओवरबुक की गई एयर इंडिया की फ्लाइट में 2 यात्री पीछे रह गए

text: Ghaziabad's Meghna Srivastava has got an aggregate of 99.8%, scoring 499 marks out of 500 to become the all-India topper for Class 12 CBSE exam, the result of which was declared today. Nearly 12 lakh students registered for the exam which saw an overall pass percentage of 83.01%. A re-test was conducted for Economics after the question paper was leaked.
summary: CBSE कक्षा 12 की बोर्ड परीक्षा में मेघना श्रीवास्तव अव्वल रहीं

text: Afghanistan President Ashraf Ghani tweeted to PM Narendra Modi, jokingly saying that they are not giving away their 19-year-old spinner Rashid Khan, following his all-round Man of the Match performance on Friday. "Afghans take absolute pride in our hero, Rashid Khan. I am also thankful to our Indian friends for giving our players a platform," part of Ghani's tweet read.
summary: हम राशिद खान को भारत नहीं दे रहे हैं: पीएम मोदी को अफगान प्रेज़

text: Highlighting that its users' data is 100% secure, Paytm has said the video, which claims Prime Minister's Office (PMO) demanded data of its J&K users, holds "no truth". In the video of a sting operation, Paytm's Senior Vice President Ajay Shekhar Sharma was seen claiming that the PMO asked for the data, and acknowledging his political affiliations to the RSS.
summary: स्टिंग वीडियो में कोई सच्चाई नहीं है कि पीएमओ ने उपयोगकर्ता डेटा की मांग की: पेटीएम

text: Afghanistan's 19-year-old spinner Rashid Khan contributed with the bat, the ball and in the field to help SRH qualify for the IPL 2018 final and was adjudged the Man of the Match. Rashid hit an unbeaten 10-ball 34 with four sixes and two fours, he also picked up three wickets for 19 runs, effected a run-out and took two catches.
summary: MoM राशिद खान ने SRH को IPL फाइनल के लिए क्वालीफाई करने में कैसे मदद की?

text: Indian cricket captain Virat Kohli tweeted his best wishes to South Africa's AB de Villiers, who announced his retirement from international cricket recently. Part of Kohli's tweet read, "Wish you all the best in everything that you do my brother. You've changed the way batting was seen in the time you've played international cricket."
summary: आपने बल्लेबाजी का तरीका बदल दिया है: कोहली को एबीडी

text: Following a sting operation, Al Jazeera has claimed that two Test matches played at Sri Lanka's Galle International Stadium, including the Test between India and Sri Lanka last July, were fixed. The investigation reveals that curators doctored the pitch in the SL-India Test, while the same was done in 2016 SL-Australia Test, which SL won in three days.
summary: जुलाई 2017 में भारत-श्रीलंका टेस्ट मैच तय था: रिपोर्ट

text: On the first day of enforcement of Europe's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), Google and Facebook were hit with lawsuits accusing them of forcing users to share personal data. Filed by Max Schrems, it claims 'consent boxes' popped on their apps saying the service cannot be used if users don't consent. The lawsuits seek a fine of around $8.8 billion.
summary: Google, FB ने नए गोपनीयता कानून के 1 दिन में $ 9bn सूट के साथ बाजी मार ली

text: Protesting against the rising prices of fuel, Congress Uttar Pradesh MLC Deepak Singh wrote to the Principal Secretary of state Legislative Council, demanding a pass for his bullock cart to attend the proceedings. Adding that the BJP-led government did not take any measures to curb the hike, he said it had become impossible for him to afford driving his car.
summary: कांग एमएलसी ईंधन की कीमतों में बढ़ोतरी के लिए बैलगाड़ी के लिए पास की मांग करता है

text: In a first, US-based scientists mixed lab-grown human cells with chicken embryos, where human cells directed them to grow into nervous tissue. Scientists said the research could lead to new ways of preventing miscarriages and birth defects. Although the hybrids didn't last long, Twitter users slammed the experiment saying, "I don't care if you're trying to cure diseases, it's inappropriate."
summary: चिकन भ्रूण के साथ मिश्रित 'मानव' कोशिकाएं; प्रयोग पटक दिया

text: Speaking at an event on NDA government's 4 years in power, Home Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday said he cannot disclose anything on the government's plans to get underworld gangster Dawood Ibrahim back to India. Ibrahim, accused in the 1993 Mumbai bomb blasts that killed 257 people, is suspected to reside in Pakistan's Karachi.
summary: दाऊद इब्राहिम को वापस पाने की योजना का खुलासा नहीं कर सकता: राजनाथ

text: As the residents of Madhya Pradesh's Shahpura are facing acute water shortage, children have to climb down a well to collect water. People are unable to fetch water using buckets due to less quantity of water in the well. Moreover, locals claim that they have to travel 1 km to reach the well as other water bodies have dried up.
summary: मप्र में पानी की कमी के कारण बच्चे पानी इकट्ठा करने के लिए अच्छी तरह से नीचे उतरते हैं

text: Speaking on NDA government's fourth anniversary, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Saturday promised that 70% of Ganga river will be clean by March 2019. He told media houses to run a breaking news that he failed if he was unable to complete the challenge. Around Ã¢ÂÂ¹21,000 crore was allotted for Namami Gange, the government's flagship programme to clean the river.
summary: अगर 2019 तक 70% गंगा की सफाई नहीं, तो चलाएं खबर मैं विफल: गडकरी

text: The main runway of Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport will remain closed from 2 pm-5 pm on Saturday to upgrade Instrument Landing System (ILS) at the runway. The ILS helps in guiding aircraft to the runway in low visibility situations like dense fog or heavy rainfall. The flight schedule is likely to be interrupted until the upgrade is complete.
summary: मुंबई एयरपोर्ट 26 मई को 3 घंटे तक बंद रहेगा

text: Under Swacch Bharat Mission, Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur District Magistrate Sheetal Verma has ordered all government employees to submit a picture of them posing in front of the toilet at their home. The DM has also asked the employees to submit a certificate proof of their respective toilets, threatening to stall a month's salary if they failed to obey the order.
summary: सरकारी कर्मचारियों ने घर में शौचालय के सामने सेल्फी लेने को कहा

text: Japanese PM Shinzo Abe on Friday said the summit between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un "is indispensable to resolve the problems that have accumulated". Further citing his disappointment on the cancellation of the summit, he said the summit is necessary to make progress. Trump had cancelled the peace talks citing North Korea's "anger and hostility".
summary: संकट के समाधान के लिए ट्रम्प-किम शिखर सम्मेलन 'अपरिहार्य': जापान

text: The Caribbean island of Barbados has elected Mia Mottley as its first female PM since gaining independence from the UK in 1966. Mottley's Barbados Labour Party won all 30 seats in the country's Parliament, coming to power for the first time in a decade. Mottley had reportedly once told her school teacher she would become the country's first female PM.
summary: बारबाडोस पहली महिला प्रधान मंत्री के रूप में मिया मोटले का चुनाव करती है

text: Alerting its people travelling to Kerala, where a Nipah virus outbreak has claimed at least 12 lives, UAE's Ministry of Health and Prevention has asked people to put off unnecessary travel to the Indian state. The ministry said that it was closely monitoring the situation in Kerala in coordination with the WHO to implement the global recommendations.
summary: निप्पा वायरस के प्रकोप के बीच यूएई केरल यात्रा चेतावनी जारी करता है

text: John Abraham has said commercial success of films is important but he'll never compromise on the content, while adding, "I'm not going to compromise on my creativity to belt out some crap." "I will not make a film because I have got 'A' actress and 'B' actor in it," he further said. John added that he isn't afraid of failure.
summary: बकवास को बेल्ट करने के लिए मेरी रचनात्मकता पर समझौता नहीं करेंगे: जॉन

text: A new poster of the biopic of Sanjay Dutt titled 'Sanju', which features actor Paresh Rawal as Sanjay's father Sunil Dutt, has been released. "'Sanju' is a father-son story. Meet the father today, Paresh Rawal. Had fun working with him," wrote the film's director Rajkumar Hirani while sharing the poster. 'Sanju' is scheduled to release on June 29.
summary: 'संजू' के पोस्टर में परेश रावल को सुनील दत्त के रूप में दिखाया गया है

text: Delhi-based I-League second division club, Sudeva Football Club, became the first Indian club to acquire a European football club after it bought Spanish third division league team, CD Olimpic de Xativa. CD Olimpic de Xativa, founded in 1932, is situated around 25 minutes from Valencia. Notably, Xativa has a first team, a reserve team, three U-19 and two U-16 teams.
summary: यूरोपीय क्लब खरीदने के लिए दिल्ली स्थित फुटबॉल क्लब इंडिया फर्स्ट

text: Former Indian captain and current Cricket Association of Bengal's head Sourav Ganguly revealed that Kolkata Knight Riders' home ground Eden Gardens was named IPL 2018's best venue and ground. "The CAB takes this opportunity to thank all who have contributed to this success beginning with the ground staff, @bcci@icc", Ganguly later tweeted.
summary: ईडन गार्डन ने आईपीएल 2018 का सर्वश्रेष्ठ स्थल और मैदान नामित किया

text: Apple will soon start publicly disclosing foreign government requests to remove apps from the App Store, the company pledged in its biannual transparency reports. The requests will relate to "alleged violations of legal and/or policy provisions". In the second half of 2017, the company received 29,718 government requests to access 309,362 devices, while data was provided in 79% of cases.
summary: Apple ने सार्वजनिक रूप से गोवट्स से ऐप टेकडाउन अनुरोधों का खुलासा करने के लिए

text: Slamming the NDA government as it completed four years in power, BSP supremo Mayawati on Saturday said it has failed on all fronts. "PM Narendra Modi terms everything he does as historic, I think that is why fuel prices are at a historic high," she added. Recently, the BSP had allied with JD(S) to oppose the BJP in Karnataka elections.
summary: सभी मोर्चों पर विफल रही सरकार: NDA की सत्ता में 4 साल मायावती

text: Slamming the NDA government, Congress leader P Chidambaram said, "What they've done...to polarise people along religious lines and divide communities, completely wipes out whatever good work they may have done". Talking about NDA achieving 100% electrification of villages, Chidambaram claimed 97% villages were electrified before NDA came to power and they had just put "icing on the cake".
summary: एनडीए सरकार ने लोगों को विभाजित किया, विभाजित समुदाय: चिदंबरम

text: Tesla has agreed to settle a 2017 lawsuit with buyers of Model S and Model X cars who alleged its Autopilot system was "essentially unusable" and dangerous. The lawsuit claimed the customers paid an extra sum for the Autopilot software, however, Tesla delayed the rollout of features. Admitting the mistake, Tesla agreed to put $5 million to compensate the customers.
summary: टेस्ला $ 5 मिलियन के लिए 'अनुपयोगी' ऑटोपायलट पर मुकदमा दायर करता है

text: UK and US-based researchers have designed a finger-prick type blood test that can detect liver damage within an hour, before symptoms appear. Liver fibrosis, the first stage of liver scarring leads to fatal liver disease if left unchecked, noted researchers. With blood from 65 volunteers, the test could distinguish fibrotic samples from healthy samples 80% of the time, said researchers.
summary: लक्षणों के प्रकट होने से पहले जिगर की क्षति का पता लगाने के लिए नया रक्त परीक्षण

text: A group of boys were detained by the police after they were caught shooting a prank video dressed as ghosts to scare their friend on his birthday in Andhra Pradesh's Vijayawada. The boys hoped the video would go viral and earn them money. However, the police detained them as a precautionary measure in wake of fake rumours on social media.
summary: लड़कों ने पुलिस द्वारा पकड़े गए दोस्त पर शरारत करने के लिए भूत के रूप में कपड़े पहने

text: Talking about the sexual harassment allegations against him, Hollywood actor Morgan Freeman said he didn't assault women but tried to joke with and compliment them in a "light-hearted and humorous way". "Clearly I wasn't always coming across the way I intended," he added. Morgan further said, "I didn't create unsafe work environments...I didn't offer employment...in exchange for sex."
summary: मैंने महिलाओं पर हमला नहीं किया, बस उनकी तारीफ की: मॉर्गन फ्रीमैन

text: The Prime Minister's Office asked Paytm to share the personal data of its users in J&K, Paytm's Senior Vice President Ajay Shekhar Sharma has said in a video of a sting operation by Cobrapost. In the video, Ajay Shekhar Sharma, who is also the company's Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma's brother, is also seen acknowledging his political affiliations to the RSS.
summary: PMO ने J & K यूजर का डेटा मांगा: स्टिंग वीडियो में पेटीएम सीनियर वीपी

text: Pakistan's Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has issued a notification banning the screening of Bollywood and Hollywood movies during Eid. The movies will be banned from two days before Eid to until two weeks after the holiday season. The ban was imposed upon the request of Pakistani distributors and production houses in order to promote local movies during the holidays.
summary: ईद के दौरान बॉलीवुड फिल्मों की स्क्रीनिंग पर रोक

text: Talking about actress Priyanka Chopra's visit to Rohingya refugee camps in Bangladesh, BJP leader Vinay Katiyar on Thursday said that she shouldn't have gone to meet them. He added, "VIPs should not visit there. This sends out a wrong message...These people (VIPs) should avoid going there. Rohingya Muslims should not live here (in India)...nor should those who sympathise with them."
summary: प्रियंका चोपड़ा को रोहिंग्याओं से नहीं मिलना चाहिए था: भाजपा नेता

text: Sara Ali Khan, who will make her debut in Bollywood with 'Kedarnath', has been sued by the film's director Abhishek Kapoor. 'Kedarnath' makers alleged that Sara remains unavailable to shoot in June for her debut film as she will be shooting for 'Simmba'. The case was heard in the Bombay High Court on Friday but no settlement could be reached.
summary: सारा अली खान ने अपनी पहली फिल्म 'केदारनाथ' के निर्देशक के खिलाफ मुकदमा दायर किया

text: Indian Olympic medal-winning wrestlers Sushil Kumar and Sakshi Malik alongside Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia have reportedly been exempted from participating in the Asian Games 2018 trials. The wrestlers, who had requested to be exempted from the trials, will get direct entry to the Games. Notably, Delhi High Court had ordered sports federations to conduct trials before any major tournaments.
summary: सुशील, साक्षी को एशियाई खेलों के लिए परीक्षणों से छूट मिली: रिपोर्ट

text: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt has said that Elon Musk "is exactly wrong" about artificial intelligence (AI). Adding that AI is "fundamentally good for humanity", Schmidt said Musk doesn't understand the benefits AI will provide in making human beings smarter. Musk, who has been a critic of AI, earlier said the technology is far more dangerous than nukes.
summary: Elon Musk AI: Ex-Google CEO के बारे में बिल्कुल गलत है

text: BJP President Amit Shah has said an alliance between SP and BSP in Uttar Pradesh will pose a challenge for BJP in 2019 elections. The BJP will win either Amethi or Rae Bareli constituency, he added. Speaking about the Opposition's plan to create a united front against the BJP, he said the parties had failed to defeat BJP in 2014.
summary: 2019 के पोल में BJP के लिए SP-BSP गठबंधन होगा चुनौती: शाह

text: The National Institute of High Security Animal Diseases in Bhopal has revealed that the blood and serum samples of bats were not found to be the prime cause of the Nipah virus. "Along with bats, we also took samples of domesticated animals like cow, goat, rabbit, dog and cat, and that too are negative," a senior government official said.
summary: भोपाल लैब की रिपोर्ट में निप्पा के प्रमुख कारण के रूप में चमगादड़ों पर प्रतिबंध लगाया गया है

text: India's Arjun Vajpai has become the youngest person in the world to climb six of the 14 peaks that are over 8,000 metres after successfully scaling Mount Kanchenjunga. The 24-year-old Noida-based mountaineer had earlier climbed Mount Everest, Lhotse and Manaslu. Nepal's Chhang Dawa Sherpa presently holds the record for being the youngest to climb all 14 peaks aged 30.
summary: भारतीय आदमी 8,000 से अधिक चोटियों पर चढ़ने के लिए सबसे कम उम्र का हो जाता है

text: Professor Ganeshi Lal has been appointed as the new Governor of Odisha with effect from the date that he assumes charge of the office. He will be replacing Governor Satya Pal Malik, who had been given additional charge of the state in March this year. Professor Lal is currently the President of the BJP Disciplinary Committee.
summary: प्रोफेसर गणेशी लाल को ओडिशा का राज्यपाल नियुक्त किया

text: China has denied US President Donald Trump's remarks hinting that President Xi Jinping influenced North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's change of mind over Korean peace talks. Trump had said there was a "change in attitude from Jong-un after his meeting with Xi. President Xi is a world-class poker player". Trump had cancelled the talks citing North Korea's "anger and hostility".
summary: चीन ने ट्रम्प की इस टिप्पणी से इनकार किया कि इसने जोंग-उन को प्रभावित किया

text: Indian investors saw a wealth addition of Ã¢ÂÂ¹72 trillion in the first four years of the BJP government since May 2014, as the benchmark index BSE Sensex has gained 10,207.99 points or 41.29%. The total market capitalisation of all BSE-listed companies has soared to Ã¢ÂÂ¹147.28 trillion. Sensex on Friday ended the day with a gain of 261.76 points at 34,924.87.

text: Talking about her glamorous image and the kind of films she has done, Kareena Kapoor Khan said, "I'm always proud of my glamorous image...I do films that suit my personality, my time limit." She added one has to enjoy some commercial success. Kareena further said, "If I have done an Udta Punjab, then I have also done the Golmaal series."
summary: मुझे हमेशा अपनी ग्लैमरस छवि पर गर्व है: करीना कपूर खान

text: Amitabh Bachchan has said the true actor in his family is his daughter Shweta Bachchan. "I know she won't admit it but she is very good. She does fantastic mimicry. Anywhere we go, some incident happens, she will mimic everybody exactly to the point," he added. Shweta will be seen making her acting debut with Amitabh in an advertisement campaign.

text: While talking about the casting couch in the film industry, actor Ravi Kishan said, "By sleeping around, you will never be able to get ahead in life." text: A study on apes has found that seven muscles thought to have evolved only in humans are actually present in the same or similar form in bonobos, chimpanzees and gorillas. text: Producer Harvey Weinstein was granted bail for $1 million cash, hours after his arrest for the rape and sexual abuse of two women on Friday. text: The Alden Ehrenreich starrer 'Solo: A Star Wars Story', which released on Friday, is "absolutely delightful," wrote Hindustan Times. "Solo never quite blows you away," wrote The Indian Express. text: Apple was reportedly aware before launching the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6s that they were more prone to bending than the previous models. text: Markets regulator SEBI has served a notice to ICICI Bank MD Chanda Kochhar in connection with the Videocon loan row. text: The Congress-JD(S) alliance on Friday proved its majority with the support of 117 MLAs during the floor test in Karnataka Assembly. text: Apple has blocked Steam, the biggest distributor of PC-based video games, to extend its gaming services to iPhones. text: A new song titled 'Selfish', penned by Salman Khan and sung by his rumoured girlfriend Iulia Vantur and Atif Aslam, from the upcoming film 'Race 3' has been released. text: Six-time Congress MLA Ramesh Kumar has been unanimously elected as the Speaker of the Karnataka Assembly after the BJP withdrew nomination for its candidate Suresh Kumar. text: Ahead of the floor test on Friday, Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy said that his father HD Deve Gowda will not "micro-manage" the administration, stating he's the people's CM and he'll "hold the reins".
