text: Sri Lankan cricketer Dhananjaya de Silva's father Ranjan, a local politician, was killed by unidentified gunmen in Colombo on Thursday. text: Facebook has said that it will not compensate its users for the data scandal, as part of which their data was exploited by British firm Cambridge Analytica. text: Apple has filed for a patent for a digital assistant which will enable intelligent declining of an incoming call. When the assistant will detect an incoming call, it'll collect data about the user's situation such as location. After analysing who the call is from, it will produce smart responses as to why the call is being declined.

text: Karnataka's first woman DGP Neelamani N Raju, who was reprimanded by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee before her counterpart HD Kumaraswamy's swearing-in ceremony, has reportedly been transferred. text: All five people accused in the 2013 Bodhgaya blasts case were found guilty by a special court in Patna on Friday. On July 7, 2013, around ten bombs had exploded inside and outside the premises of Mahabodhi Temple, injuring five people including two monks. text: A CCTV footage of the two suspects who detonated an improvised explosive device inside an Indian restaurant, Bombay Bhel, in the Canadian city of Mississauga, has been released by the regional police. text: UK's Prince William, who is second-in-line to the British throne, will visit Israel and the Palestinian territories in June, becoming the first British royal to make an official visit there. summary: ब्रिटेन के राजकुमार विलियम इजरायल जाने वाले पहले शाही बन गए

text: Thailand's Kid Mai Death Cafe encourages its patrons to lay inside a coffin for a few minutes to avail discounts on beverages. The cafe, established on the idea of Dr Veeranut Rojanaprapa, aims to teach people the benefits of 'death awareness'. Speaking about the criticism faced from locals, Veeranut says that the complaints mean that people are aware of death.
summary: थाई कैफे उन ग्राहकों को छूट देता है जो ताबूत में लेट सकते हैं

text: A new poster of Sanjay Dutt's biopic titled 'Sanju' featuring Ranbir Kapoor and Sonam Kapoor has been released. Sharing the poster on Twitter, the film's director Rajkumar Hirani wrote, "A still from Sanju's crazy romantic love life!" Sonam will reportedly portray one of Dutt's love interests in the film, which is scheduled to release on June 29.
summary: रणबीर, सोनम के साथ 'संजू' का नया पोस्टर जारी

text: Boney Kapoor, whose wife Sridevi passed away in February, said, "I'm trying to be both mother and father to my children [Janhvi, Khushi, Arjun and Anshula]." "These past months have been difficult...There were many things left unsaid and undone," he added. Boney further said, "Now I'm...picking up the pieces again trying to put my life together for my children's sake."
summary: मैं अपने बच्चों के लिए माँ और पिता दोनों बनने की कोशिश कर रहा हूँ: बोनी

text: Sonam Kapoor took to Instagram to share a photo with filmmaker Karan Johar on the occasion of his 46th birthday today and wrote, "Happy happy birthday my darling brother from another mother." "May you always shine brighter than all the stars in the universe! Thank you always for your friendship, love, generosity and incredible humour," she added.
summary: एक और माँ से भाई: सोनम जोहर को उसके जन्मदिन पर

text: Former South African captain Graeme Smith and former Windies captain Darren Sammy have accused Australian coaches of favouring Australian players in the teams' playing XI in the IPL despite their poor form. The players questioned the selection of Australians including RR's D'Arcy Short, DD's Glenn Maxwell, KXIP's Aaron Finch. Notably, RR, SRH, DD, and KXIP have Australian coaches.
summary: स्मिथ, सैमी ने Aus IPL कोचों पर Aus खिलाड़ियों के पक्ष लेने का आरोप लगाया

text: The US National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) has revealed that emergency braking maneuvers in Uber's self-driving car, which killed a pedestrian in March, were not enabled. At 1.3 seconds before impact, it was determined that emergency braking was needed to mitigate a collision, NTSB said. While the human operator is relied on to intervene, the system didn't alert the driver.
summary: उबेर सेल्फ-ड्राइविंग कार क्रैश में आपातकालीन ब्रेकसेन bra Â € ™ t

text: Uber has announced that it will open a research centre in Paris, where its flying cars will be developed. It will be Uber's first research and development hub outside of North America. The company will invest around $23.5 million over the next five years in the facility for developing new technologies to support its flying-car initiative, Uber Elevate.
summary: नए अनुसंधान केंद्र के साथ पेरिस में फ्लाइंग टैक्सी बनाने के लिए उबर

text: A video showing a man proposing his girlfriend for marriage using the intercom on-board an IndiGo plane has gone viral. The girlfriend walks up to him, following which he goes down on one knee with a rose. Officials said he first made the proposal on the aerobridge leading to the plane and later obtained permission to use the intercom.
summary: वीडियो: विमान पर इंटरकॉम पर आदमी प्रेमिका को प्रपोज करता है

text: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi has said the cab-hailing startup is expecting to reinvest its profits back into its products, technology and "emerging markets like the Middle East and India". Earlier, Khosrowshahi claimed that India is already among the top three markets for Uber and accounts for 10% of its trips globally. India is "one of our healthiest markets," he said.
summary: हम भारतीय बाजार में मुनाफे को फिर से हासिल करेंगे: उबर के सीईओ

text: Scientists have proposed mysterious weather patterns could be explained by blockages in global flow of air currents called jet streams. On exceeding jet stream capacity, "blocking" occurs which could be modelled for weather forecasts, said researchers. The 2003 European heat wave, California's 2014 drought and Superstorm Sandy in 2012 were caused by the same weather phenomenon, noted researchers.
summary: वायु धाराओं में 'ट्रैफिक जाम' असामान्य मौसम का कारण बनता है: अध्ययन

text: Canada-based astronomers have successfully observed two intense regions of radiation, 20 kilometres apart, around a star 6500 light-years away from Earth. The observation is equivalent to using a telescope on Earth to see an insect on Pluto, said researchers. The rapidly spinning neutron star, a pulsar, is seen in the background engulfing gas from its companion star, a brown dwarf.
summary: खगोलविदों ने उच्च-आरएस में 6500 प्रकाश वर्ष दूर स्टार का अध्ययन किया

text: Researchers at Antarctica have identified a site which likely holds a 1-million-year-old continuous ice core and would help understand Earth's climate history. The oldest continuous ice core so far extends back 800,000 years, whereas ice fragments dating as far back as 2.7 million years have been found a few kilometres from the currently proposed drilling site.
summary: वैज्ञानिकों ने सबसे पुराने कभी-कभी बर्फ के कोर को खोदने के लिए

text: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu has made 77 domestic trips during his 10 months in office, which is more than former Vice President Hamid Ansari who made 74 trips in 5 years during his second term. While Naidu made the maximum number of visits to Telangana and Andhra Pradesh, Ansari made the most visits to Maharashtra and Uttar Pradesh.
summary: वीपी नायडू ने 5 साल में पूर्व वीपी की तुलना में 10 महीनों में अधिक यात्राएं कीं

text: One of India's most decorated Generals, Lieutenant General Zorawar Chand Bakshi, passed away aged 97 on Thursday. He was awarded the second-highest military decoration, Maha Vir Chakra, for his role in capturing the strategically important Haji Pir Pass during the 1965 war with Pakistan. Bakshi was also instrumental in capturing Akhnoor Dagger from Pakistan during 1971 war.
summary: भारत के सबसे सुशोभित जनरल में से एक का निधन 97 वर्ष की आयु है

text: PM Narendra Modi and his Bangladeshi counterpart Sheikh Hasina on Friday inaugurated the Bangladesh Bhavan in West Bengal's Santiniketan in the presence of West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. The bhavan, which is built at a cost of Ã¢ÂÂ¹25 crore, also has a museum that showcases Rabindranath Tagore's association with Bangladesh, the Liberation War of Bangladesh and Indo-Bangla relations.
summary: पीएम मोदी, B'desh PM WB में बांग्लादेश भवन का उद्घाटन करेंगे

text: Thai police raided four Buddhist temples on Thursday, arresting several prominent monks and worshippers in its biggest such operation of this year, in a bid to 'clean up' Buddhism. Thailand's military government is trying to crack down on illegal financial dealings and sex scandals involving monks. Buddhism is followed by more than 90% of Thailand's population of 6.9 crore.
summary: थाईलैंड ने मंदिरों पर छापा मारा, भिक्षुओं को बौद्ध धर्म की 'सफाई' करने के लिए गिरफ्तार किया

text: At least 15 people were injured after a bomb explosion took place in an Indian restaurant, Bombay Bhel, in the Canadian city of Mississauga. Two men in their mid 20s had detonated an improvised explosive device inside the restaurant and had fled the scene shortly after the incident, the regional police said. There was no immediate claim of responsibility.
summary: कनाडा में भारतीय भोजनालय में बम विस्फोट में 15 घायल

text: Talking about whether JD(S) leader and Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy will serve a full five-year term, Congress leader and Deputy CM G Parameshwara on Thursday said, "We have not yet discussed those modalities." "We are also yet to decide on what portfolios have to go to [JD(S)] and what should be with [Congress]," he added.
summary: CM कुमारस्वामी के लिए पूरा कार्यकाल अभी तक चर्चा में नहीं है: K'taka Dy CM

text: Former world number one Novak Djokovic's tactical adviser and ATP's strategy expert Craig O'Shannessy has suggested players to use the under-arm serve to counter Rafael Nadal in the clay court season. Explaining the reason behind such a tactic, O'Shannessy said "[Y]ou need to do things that make him uncomfortable, make him think twice, get inside his head."
summary: जोकोविच के सामरिक सलाहकार नडाल बनाम अंडर-आर्म सर्व की सलाह देते हैं

text: Apple has won $539 million from Samsung after a US jury ruled the latter should pay the amount for copying patented iPhone features. In the case, which has been ongoing since 2011, Samsung was found liable and previously paid  $399 million to Apple. Apple claims Samsung made $3.3 billion in revenue and $1 billion in profit on the patent-infringing phones.
summary: Apple ने पेटेंट उल्लंघन पर सैमसंग से $ 539 mn जीता

text: After 12 people died due to Nipah virus in Kerala, the state government has issued a health advisory for visitors stating that extra cautious people can avoid travelling to Kozhikode, Malappuram, Wayanad and Kannur districts. Adding that the infection remains highly localised as all cases are linked to one family, the government added that the situation is under control.
summary: केरल ने निप्पाह को डराने के लिए आगंतुकों को 4 जिलों से बचने के लिए कहा

text: The Congress on Thursday denied that the expansion of the Sterlite project in Tamil Nadu's Tuticorin was sanctioned by the UPA-led centre in 2013. Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi said the UPA government had framed the rules which mandated that such an expansion required environment clearance based on public consultation. He further blamed the NDA government for abolishing these rules.
summary: UPA के दौरान TN स्टरलाइट परियोजना को मंजूरी देने से कांग्रेस इनकार करती है

text: Android Co-founder Andy Rubin's startup Essential, which was launched last year, is considering selling itself and has cancelled development of a new smartphone, as per reports. The company only sold 88,000 phones in 2017, according to IDC, and also cut the price of its smartphone from $699 to $499 in the same year. It is backed by Amazon among others.
summary: बिक्री के लिए Android संस्थापक स्टार्टअप: रिपोर्ट

text: The Kozhikode district administration has banned all public meetings till May 31 post the outbreak of the Nipah virus in Kerala. A ban has also been placed on conducting training courses including tuitions to avoid assembly of people. This comes after at least 12 people lost their lives due to the virus which has limited treatment options.
summary: निफा वायरस के प्रकोप के बीच केरल में जनसभाओं पर प्रतिबंध लगा दिया गया

text: A PIL has been filed asking why the Supreme Court functions for only 193 days a year when the rules require a minimum of 225 working days. Pointing out there are nearly 60,000 pending cases, it said their vacations should be reduced. SC breaks for 45 days during summer and 15 days during winter, besides festive holidays.
summary: सुप्रीम कोर्ट साल में केवल 193 दिनों के लिए ही काम क्यों करता है, पीआईएल पूछता है

text: A near-miss incident occurred last week between an IndiGo aircraft and an Indian Air Force jet over Chennai, IndiGo has confirmed. The jets reportedly came within 300 feet of each other, following which an auto-generated Resolution Advisory warning was set off for the IndiGo pilot to steer the aircraft to a safer distance. Meanwhile, the DGCA is probing the matter.
summary: इंडिगो, IAF जेट एक दूसरे के 300 फीट के दायरे में आते हैं: रिपोर्ट

text: Three Indo-Tibetan Border Force constables have been arrested for allegedly molesting three minor national-level table tennis players in Chhattisgarh. The constables asked for the players' phone numbers and made derogatory remarks while they were returning from a training session. They then attempted to force the girls to go to a nearby camp but fled when they called a relative.
summary: राष्ट्रीय स्तर के नाबालिग खिलाड़ियों से छेड़छाड़ के लिए 3 कांस्टेबल

text: Petroleum and Natural Gas Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Thursday said that reduced value of Indian Rupee in comparison to US Dollar is mainly responsible for the surge in oil prices. "The Centre has taken this (fuel hike) under consideration. I'm confident that we can find a way, where common people will not be affected by such fuel hikes," Pradhan added.
summary: ईंधन की कीमतों में बढ़ोतरी के लिए जिम्मेदार कमजोर रुपया: तेल मंत्री

text: Justice BK Pasha of Kerala High Court on the eve of his retirement on Thursday said, "Appointment of judges is not a family property of someone to be partitioned." "I don't believe that judgeship should be allotted to each and every religion, caste...To pick and choose some persons who aren't at all competent...will point fingers towards the system," he added.
summary: न्यायाधीशों की नियुक्ति नहीं पारिवारिक संपत्ति: सेवानिवृत्त एचसी न्यायाधीश

text: UN Human Rights experts have asked Indian authorities to provide protection to journalist Rana Ayyub after a hate campaign over a fake tweet that said she sympathised with child rapists and claimed Muslims were unsafe in India. Although Rana clarified the tweet was false, a fake pornographic video purportedly showing her was circulated online and her contact details made viral.
summary: यूएन निकाय भारत से नफरत अभियान के बाद पत्रकार की रक्षा करने के लिए कहता है

text: Slamming the Uttar Pradesh government over the Y-level security provided to former MP Dhananjay Singh, the Allahabad High Court said, "It is shocking...that a person who is involved in murder cases...be given security." The court further pointed out that the former MP was misusing the security cover to commit crimes.
summary: हैरान कि यूपी ने हत्या के आरोपी नेता को सुरक्षा दी: एच.सी.

text: North Korea has said it is still open to holding talks between its leader Kim Jong-un and US President Donald Trump despite the cancellation of the summit by Trump. North Korea called the summit 'desperately necessary' to resolve potential hostilities between the two nations. "Our commitment to doing our best for peace...remains unchanged," the country's Foreign Ministry said.
summary: एन कोरिया शिखर सम्मेलन रद्द होने के बावजूद अमेरिका के साथ बातचीत के लिए खुला

text: Russia on Thursday rejected an international investigation that claimed Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 which crashed in Ukraine in 2014, was brought down by a Russian military missile. Blaming Ukraine for the tragedy, the country said no such weapon had ever crossed the Russian-Ukrainian border. The MH17 plane was shot down while flying over rebel-held territory in eastern Ukraine.
summary: रूस ने एमएच 17 को अपनी सैन्य मिसाइलों द्वारा नीचे लाया

text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has ordered a probe against Aditya Birla Group's Grasim Industries for alleged abuse of dominant position with regard to sale of Viscose Staple Fibre (VSF). The allegations pertained to Grasim imposing discriminatory conditions on sale of VSF and monitoring the customers by collecting details of their consumption, among others.
summary: नियामक आदित्य बिड़ला समूह के ग्रासिम के खिलाफ जांच का आदेश देता है

text: Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein will surrender to New York City police on Friday on charges that he raped one woman and forced another to perform oral sex on him, as per reports. Weinstein has been accused of sexual misconduct by over 70 women. He had earlier denied having non-consensual sex with anyone.
summary: यौन उत्पीड़न के आरोपों पर आत्मसमर्पण करने के लिए वीनस्टीन: रिपोर्ट

text: CSK's Pakistan-origin South African cricketer Imran Tahir's son Gibran recreated his father's trademark sprint-across-the-field celebration on being asked what his father does after taking a wicket. Gibran also showed his father's disappointed reaction on being asked to recreate his reaction on not picking a wicket. CSK also posted a picture of Gibran playing with toy cars with Deepak Chahar.
summary: CSK खिलाड़ी का बेटा होटल में अपने घूमने के जश्न की नकल करता है

text: US President Donald Trump granted posthumous pardon to boxing's first black heavyweight champion Jack Johnson, who had been convicted by an all-white jury for transporting a woman across state lines for "immoral purposes". Trump, who was accompanied by Sylvester Stallone during the official pardoning, said, "I am taking this very righteous step... It's about time."
summary: ट्रम्प 1 काले हैवीवेट शैंपू को मरणोपरांत क्षमा देता है

text: Pakistani cricketers were warned by ICC's Anti-Corruption Unit to stop wearing smartwatches after a few players showed up wearing them on the field in the on-going first Test against England. Two Pakistan players were reportedly wearing smartwatches, which ICC states must have connectivity disabled as communication devices are not permitted during play.
summary: स्मार्टवॉच पहनने के लिए ICC की भ्रष्टाचार इकाई ने दी चेतावनी

text: The Congress has asked the public for donations a day after reports claimed the party was facing a financial crisis and had not sent funds to several offices for months. Senior leader Shashi Tharoor said there is no need to be embarrassed about acknowledging that the party is facing cash crunch. Congress reportedly failed to get funding via electoral bonds.
summary: कांग्रेस ने नकदी की किल्लत के बीच जनता से चंदा मांगा

text: US-based startup Rover has raised $125 million in equity funding from funds and accounts advised by T. Rowe Price Associates, along with $30 million of debt from Silicon Valley Bank. The round has valued the startup around $970 million, as per reports. Founded in 2011, Rover provides pet sitters, dog walkers, and in-home dog boarding services to its customers.
summary: रोवर ने पालतू बैठे, कुत्ते के चलने की सेवा के लिए $ 155 मिलियन की राशि जुटाई

text: The asteroid strike that triggered the extinction of dinosaurs 66 million years ago also destroyed forests across the globe, killing all the tree-dwelling bird species, as per a research published in Cell Press. The only birds that survived were the ones that lived on the ground, said researchers, which implies all modern-day birds evolved from their flightless ancestors.
summary: केवल उड़ान रहित पक्षी डिनो-हत्या क्षुद्रग्रह बच गए: अध्ययन

text: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Betul has been booked for allegedly issuing death threats to the District Collector Shashank Mishra on Facebook. The man said that he would kill Mishra as well as himself if the Collector failed to take action against a legislator for abusing caste status. The accused had also posted objectionable comments against Home Minister Rajnath Singh.
summary: सांसद ने एफबी पर कलेक्टर को मौत की धमकी जारी करने के लिए बुक किया

text: The Chandigarh Police arrested a 34-year-old female teacher for alleged sexual abuse of a 14-year-old boy after his parents filed a police complaint using a helpline service for children. The accused and the victim are neighbours and the boy and his sister used to take tuitions from the woman. She requested the parents to send their son for tuition separately.
summary: 14 साल के लड़के का यौन शोषण करने के आरोप में महिला टीचर गिरफ्तार

text: Vodafone's FANtastic Breaks Contest now provides a chance to win a trip to "the Mecca of cricket - Lord's" this match season. Participate in the contest during match ad breaks and stand a chance to win a trip to Lord's and iPhones in every match and other exciting prizes in every ad break. T&C apply.
summary: लॉर्ड्स के लिए एक यात्रा जीतने के लिए वोडाफोन फैंटास्टिक ब्रेक प्रतियोगिता खेलें

text: Hollywood actor Morgan Freeman has apologised after being accused of sexual harassment and inappropriate behaviour by eight women. "Anyone who knows me or has worked with me knows I'm not someone who'd intentionally offend or knowingly make anyone feel uneasy," said Morgan. "I apologise to anyone who felt uncomfortable or disrespected. That was never my intent," the 80-year-old actor added.
summary: मॉर्गन फ्रीमैन यौन उत्पीड़न के दावों पर माफी मांगता है

text: Sweden has adopted a law under which sex without consent is considered rape. Previous laws required proof of violence, a threat of violence or the exploitation of  victim to establish rape. The new law also introduced two new offences, negligent rape and negligent sexual abuse, with each carrying a maximum prison sentence of four years.
summary: स्वीडन में बलात्कार माना जाने के लिए स्पष्ट सहमति के बिना सेक्स

text: Actor Abhishek Bachchan has slammed a troll for comparing him to cricketer Stuart Binny, who plays for the IPL team Rajasthan Royals (RR), and calling them both useless. Abhishek wrote, "Walk a mile in my shoes, brother. If you even manage 10 steps I'll be impressed. Judging by your tweets don't think you'll make it too far!"
summary: आरआर के स्टुअर्ट बिन्नी की तुलना में अभिषेक ने ट्रोल किया

text: John Abraham's 'Parmanu: The Story of Pokhran', which released today, "is...well handled and the patriotic fervor comes out beautifully," wrote Bollywood Hungama. "The film holds its ground towards the climax," said Hindustan Times (HT). The Times of India (TOI) wrote, "The narrative isn't explosive but it does have...dramatic moments." It was rated 3.5/5 (Bollywood Hungama, TOI) and 3/5 (HT).
summary: जॉन अब्राहम की 'परमानु: द स्टोरी ऑफ पोखरण' ने सिनेमाघरों को हिट किया

text: The Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee has written to the Superintendent of Police of Anti-Corruption Bureau, Bengaluru Urban Wing, seeking to register a complaint again BS Yeddyurappa and several other BJP leaders. The party's lawyer has alleged that BJP leaders indulged in criminal conspiracy and corruption in their attempt to win the May 19 floor test in the Karnataka Assembly.
summary: कांग्रेस येदियुरप्पा के खिलाफ भ्रष्टाचार विरोधी निकाय लिखती है

text: The MLAs of Congress and JD(S) are being held in hotels in Bengaluru, a day before the JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy-led alliance is scheduled to face a floor test in the Karnataka Assembly. The parties have been holding their MLAs in hotels since the election results were announced on May 15, to prevent the BJP from poaching their MLAs.
summary: कर्नाटक फ्लोर टेस्ट तक होटलों में कांग्रेस-जद (एस) के विधायक

text: Dwarf planet Pluto was formed by agglomeration of roughly a billion comets, researchers have suggested based on similarities in data from NASA's Pluto probe New Horizons and ESA's Rosetta, the first-ever mission to land on a comet. Researchers found "intriguing consistency" between Pluto's nitrogen-rich ice and chemical composition of Comet 67P, leading them to propose Pluto as a "giant comet".
summary: प्लूटो अरबों धूमकेतुओं से बना हो सकता है, अध्ययन से पता चलता है

text: The Election Commission, in its response to the Law Commission, has reportedly suggested that all elections scheduled for one year should be held together. The Law Commission had sought EC's opinion on holding general and state elections simultaneously. Presently, simultaneous elections are held for states where assembly terms are scheduled to end within a few months of each other.
summary: चुनाव आयोग ने Year एक साल एक चुनाव ’का प्रस्ताव रखा: रिपोर्ट

text: The Odisha health department has issued an alert over Nipah virus to 30 district headquarters hospitals and five medical colleges. In a letter to the medical authorities, the department emphasised the need to take precautionary measures against the virus as options to treat it are limited. This comes amid the outbreak of the virus in Kerala, killing at least 12.
summary: ओडिशा स्वास्थ्य विभाग निप्पा वायरस को लेकर अलर्ट जारी करता है

text: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) recovered stolen items like chained toilet mugs, ceiling fans, blankets, bed linens, iron window grills, washroom showers, and railway track materials from railway passengers in 2017-18. According to an RPF officer, thieves prefer stealing engineering items like railway tracks and fish plates, which is a cause of major concern as it can lead to accidents.

text: Talking about rising fuel prices, Petroleum Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "GST is one way to ease the situation, other ways also being thought of." text: In 2015, Hurricane Patricia, the most intense tropical cyclone ever recorded in the Western Hemisphere blasted a beam of positrons, the antimatter counterpart of electrons, towards the Earth, a US-based study has confirmed. Flying an aircraft in the storm with wind speeds over 250 kmph, researchers made the first-ever detection of bright flash of gamma-rays and X-rays coming towards Earth.

text: Indian-American aerospace engineer Anita Sengupta led the development of space station-bound Cold Atom Laboratory, where temperatures 10 billion times colder than the vacuum of space would be created. Sengupta earlier developed landing gear for Curiosity rover on Mars. She is currently the Senior Vice-President of Virgin Hyperloop One, which aims to create the fastest means of land transportation.
summary: भारतीय मूल के वैज्ञानिक ने नासा परियोजना का नेतृत्व किया, अब हाइपरलूप के साथ

text: Internet services have been temporarily suspended in Tamil Nadu's Tuticorin amid the ongoing anti-Sterlite protests in the area. The services were suspended on Wednesday 9 pm onwards and will remain suspended for five days until May 27. At least 12 people have died during protests after the police opened fire on protestors.

text: The Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board (TNPCB) has ordered the closure of the Sterlite Copper plant in Tuticorin amid ongoing protests by locals. Sterlite reportedly failed to comply with certain conditions imposed in the previous renewal of consent order issued to the unit. The power supply to the copper plant was also cut on Thursday after TNPCB's order.

text: The BJP-led Gujarat government has decided to perform 41 'parjanya yagnas' across the state on May 31 to pray for a good monsoon. I along with CM Vijay Rupani, state ministers and senior officers will take part in the yagna," Deputy CM Nitin Patel said.

text: Former Russian spy Sergei Skripal's daughter Yulia has said the fact that her father and she were attacked using a nerve agent turned her "world upside down", both "physically and emotionally". She added, "We are so lucky to have both survived this attempted assassination." "In the longer term, I hope to return home to my country (Russia)," Yulia further said.

text: The US State Department on Wednesday expelled two Venezuelan diplomats and asked them to leave the country within 48 hours. This comes in retaliation to Venezuela's move of expelling two top US diplomats a day earlier. Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro had charged the US envoys of being involved in "a military conspiracy" which the US had called "false allegations".

text: Filmmaker Indra Kumar, while confirming that Akshay Kumar, Suniel Shetty and Paresh Rawal will star in 'Hera Pheri 3', tweeted, "This is going to be a fun project with a stellar star cast." text: After being sworn-in as the Karnataka Chief Minister on Wednesday, HD Kumaraswamy said, "Even though it is a coalition government, it will be a model for the country." text: To improve account security, Facebook has enabled the two-factor authentication feature without requiring to register a phone number. Users will be able to use third-party authentication apps like Google Authenticator and Duo Security for the same. The two-factor authentication requires using a second step, like a single-use key or password, along with the account password for verification.

text: US-based AI startup Hugging Face, which is working on developing chatbots focussed on emotions, has raised $4 million led by Ronny Conway from A.Capital Ventures. Founded in 2016, Hugging Face chatbot app accepts text messages, photos, and emojis and can detect emotions based on what users share.

text: A yacht built for former Iraqi dictator Saddam Hussein will be turned into a hotel and recreation facility for sailors. 'Basrah Breeze' went unsold after it was put up for sale for $30 million. text: Clashes broke out between some Rajput and Dalit groups in Gujarat's Dholka on Tuesday after a Dalit man added the 'Sinh' suffix to his name, the police said. text: Pakistan's Bahria University has reportedly issued a notification directing its male and female students to maintain a distance of six inches when they are together. text: The US embassy in China has issued a health alert for its citizens after a consulate worker reported a mild traumatic brain injury caused by "abnormal" sounds and pressure. text: Palestine has become the 193rd nation to join the Chemical Weapons Convention and the move will take effect on June 16. South Sudan, Egypt and North Korea are not part of the organisation.

text: Two-time champions Kolkata Knight Riders on Wednesday eliminated Rajasthan Royals from the IPL 2018 after defeating them for the third time this season. None of your business."

text: The amount of cash seized during the Karnataka election campaigning this year was over six times the amount seized in the 2013 assembly polls and over thrice the amount seized during 2014 general elections. text: Software firm IBM has developed a device called Crypto Anchor Verifier which uses artificial intelligence (AI) and optical imaging to detect counterfeit (fake) goods. text: Congress has cut down on its travel, allowance, and tea expenses as it is facing a financial crisis, according to reports. text: Drinking too much water can cause excess fluid accumulation, leading to low sodium levels in the blood or hyponatremia, which results in brain swelling, Canada-based scientists have warned. The study showed overhydration can turn off the hydration sensing neurons, causing hyponatremia. The condition is more common in elderly patients and can cause cognitive problems and seizures, scientists said.

Teachers have been informed about the virus and preventive measures, District Chief Medical Officer Dr Sanjay Sharma said.

text: Speaking about her upcoming film 'Veere Di Wedding', Sonam Kapoor said, "Young, urban, working women...do curse, drink and are sexually active." text: Team India captain Virat Kohli accepted Sports Minister Rajyavardhan Rathore's fitness challenge and shared a video of himself doing his "favourite core workout" on Twitter. text: French doctors led by surgeon Emmanuel Martinod have been creating trachea (windpipe) using aortas, the largest artery in the human body. text: After marrying UK's Prince Harry, former actress Meghan Markle must follow several royal protocols like not clicking selfies with fans. text: Ex-South Africa cricketer AB de Villiers holds the records for scoring the fastest fifty, hundred and 150 in ODIs. text: A video has surfaced online showing a policeman in Tamil Nadu's Tuticorin telling an anti-Sterlite protester to "stop acting" after the police force shot him on Wednesday. text: Elon Musk-led SpaceX launched twin NASA satellites on Tuesday that would track the Earth's water movement and ice melt. The GRACE-FO satellites are at an 490-km altitude in a near-polar orbit, circling the Earth once every 90 minutes. The two satellites track movement of mass by measuring deviations caused in their 220-km separation with a hair-width accuracy by gravitational changes.

text: After the JD(S)-Congress announced the cabinet positions in Karnataka on Tuesday, five-time Congress MLA G Parameshwara was selected as the Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister. Congress MLA KR Ramesh Kumar has been selected as the Assembly Speaker.

text: Punjab has the lowest consumption of meat in India, with 10% of the men and 4% of the women in the state eating meat weekly, the IndiaSpend analysis of national health data has revealed. text: The US city of Lake Worth accidentally issued a "zombie activity" and power outage alert. The alert warned that nearly 8,000 customers lost power "due to extreme zombie activity." City officials later clarified that "Lake Worth does not have any zombie activity currently" and added that the false alert was being investigated.

text: As many as 39.36 lakh new jobs were created during 7-month period ending March this year, according to payroll data by Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO). text: China on Tuesday announced that it will slash the import duty on passenger cars to 15% starting July 1 from the current 25% which has been in place for over a decade. Following the news, shares of Jaguar Land Rover owner Tata Motors jumped as much as 5%. Further, the import duty on car parts will be reduced to 6%.

text: Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) officials shot 42 men, believed to be from Muslim community, in Meerut's Hashimpura on 22 May, 1987. National Human Rights Commission termed it as 'India's worst custodial killing case'. Confirming that victims were killed after being abducted in a PAC truck, a court in 2015 acquitted all accused officials citing lack of evidence against them.

text: At least 16 people were killed and 38 others were injured on Tuesday in Afghanistan's Kandahar after explosives in a minivan accidentally detonated while security forces were trying to defuse them, officials said. A container of explosives, rocket-propelled grenades, suicide vests, and ammunition was also found near the site. No group has yet claimed responsibility for the attack.

text: Civil Aviation Secretary RN Choubey has said the government won't sell Air India stake if the bid price is inadequate. "We are confident that this move will be successful. text: The Delhi Excise Department has clarified that playing of recorded music is not banned in the city's restro-bars and pubs. text: Two videos have emerged online which reportedly show police forcing an offender to walk naked through a Delhi locality. text: The Syrian military on Monday declared that it has taken full control of the capital, Damascus, and all the areas around it, for the first time in nearly seven years. text: Using techniques similar to those used to search for missing Malaysia Airlines plane MH370, researchers have proposed that a founding population of 100-200 people reached Australia by boat over 50,000 years ago. text: A group of former chief election commissioners asked the Election Commission to control hateful and defamatory speeches during election campaigns in larger public interest. text: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation on Monday announced that the remaining part of the Magenta line will open to public on May 29. The whole line will now connect Janakpuri West in Delhi to Botanical Garden in Noida, covering a total of 25 stations. Initially, 24 trains would ply on the route with a frequency of 5 minutes 15 seconds.

The team called the finding a 'surprise' as they were exploring methods to create quantum dots in an inexpensive and non-toxic way. The quantum dots measure around 10 nanometres in size.

text: PM Narendra Modi on Monday reached Russia's Sochi for an informal summit with President Vladimir Putin, a month after holding talks in a similar format with Chinese President Xi Jinping in Wuhan. The day-long summit comes weeks after National Security Advisor Ajit Doval and Foreign Secretary Vijay Gokhale visited Moscow reportedly to discuss US sanctions on Russian firms.
summary: प्रीज पुतिन के साथ अनौपचारिक बातचीत के लिए पीएम मोदी रूस पहुंचे

text: Over 50 people fell sick after eating paani puri served by a roadside vendor in Rajasthan's Sirohi district on Saturday. Health officials said that the victims, who complained of vomiting and abdominal pain, have been admitted to hospitals for treatment. Samples of the contaminated paani puri have been collected for examination.
summary: राजस्थान में पान की पुरी होने से 50 लोग बीमार

text: Minister of State (MoS) in the Prime Minister's Office Jitendra Singh on Monday slammed Pakistan over ceasefire violations during Ramadan. Adding that a country that calls itself Pakistan is indulging in 'napaak' activity, he said, "Those who are indulging in firing from across the border has proved...they have the least of faith in Ramadan, Islam and Holy Quran."
summary: भारत ने रमजान के दौरान संघर्ष विराम उल्लंघन को लेकर पाकिस्तान की खिंचाई की

text: Replying to a Twitter user who wished her a "happy Sunday", External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj said, "Geeta - There is no Sunday for me dear. It's a happy working day." Responding to her tweet, a user wrote, "Mam I'm a great fan of your dedication towards work", while another wrote, "we need more Ministers like u. Proud of u."
summary: मेरे लिए कोई रविवार नहीं, यह एक खुशहाल कार्य दिवस है: सुषमा स्वराज

text: A 36-year-old Japanese man died on Monday during his eighth attempt to climb the Mount Everest, becoming the second casualty this climbing season. Nobukazu Kuriki was found dead while sleeping in a camp tent at 24,278 feet on the 29,035-feet mountain. Kuriki had lost nine fingertips to frostbite during one of his previous failed expeditions.
summary: माउंट एवरेस्ट पर चढ़ने के 8 वें प्रयास में जापानी व्यक्ति की मौत हो गई

text: Finland's HMD Global, which holds a licence to sell Nokia-branded phones, has raised $100 million of funding. The company said it is planning to expand its Nokia smartphone range and to double sales channels in key markets this year. HMD sold around 70 million Nokia phones and generated sales of $2.1 billion in its first year 2017.
summary: नोकिया फोन बनाने वाली कंपनी HMD ग्लोबल ने 100 मिलियन डॉलर जुटाए हैं

text: Over 200 working professionals have switched career paths to data science with an average 36% hike, after taking the PG Diploma Program in Data Science by IIIT B and UpGrad. Students have been placed in companies like Adobe, Dell and Microsoft. Notably, Moulik Srivastava transitioned from American Express to Bain & company with 200% hike after taking the program.
summary: UpGrad डेटा विज्ञान में 200 से अधिक छात्रों को संक्रमण में मदद करता है

text: Some symptoms of the Nipah virus that killed 11 in Kerala are fever, headache, drowsiness, disorientation, and mental confusion. The symptoms can progress to coma within 24-48 hours and the patients may develop respiratory illness during early part of the infection. Identified in Malaysia in 1998, the virus was first reported in India in 2001 in West Bengal's Siliguri.
summary: केरल में 11 मारे गए निप्पा वायरस के लक्षण क्या हैं?

text: In an Instagram post on winning Miss Universe, Sushmita Sen wrote, "I was 18...when India won Miss Universe for the...first time on 21st May 1994....I am 42 now, still a 'Miss' with a 'Universe' inside of me!" Sushmita added she celebrates this day with India and Philippines, which she considers her second home as the country hosted Miss Universe 1994.
summary: फिर भी 'मिस' विद 'यूनिवर्स' मुझमें: जीत के 24 साल बाद सुष्मिता

text: Congress MLA Shivaram Hebbar on Monday claimed that the audio tape released by his party allegedly showing BJP offering bribes to Congress legislators before the Karnataka floor test was fake. Congress had alleged BJP was offering a Ã¢ÂÂ¹15-crore bribe to Hebbar's wife for his support. However, Hebbar has said the voice on the tape is not his wife's voice.
summary: कांग्रेस विधायक ने बीजेपी को फर्जी बताते हुए पार्टी के रिश्वत टेप को बुलाया

text: Barcelona legend AndrÃÂ©s Iniesta sat alone barefoot on the Camp Nou pitch reportedly until 1 am when the 99,354-seater stadium was empty after his last-ever match for the club on Sunday. The 34-year-old had joined Barcelona as a 12-year-old in 1996 and played 674 matches for the senior team, scoring 57 goals and winning 32 major trophies.
summary: आखिरी मैच के बाद बाराती दिग्गज घंटों तक अकेले पिच पर बैठे रहे

text: Defence Production Secretary Ajay Kumar has said India will integrate Artificial Intelligence (AI) in defence forces to improve preparation for "next-generation warfare". The initiative, which will be undertaken in partnership with private sector, is aimed at producing unmanned vehicles and weaponry. A task force led by Tata Sons chairman N Chandrasekaran has been formed to oversee the project.
summary: भारत तैयारियों को बढ़ावा देने के लिए एआई को रक्षा में एकीकृत करने के लिए

text: A Dalit man was tied up and beaten to death allegedly on the orders of a factory owner in Gujarat's Rajkot. An FIR has been lodged in the case and five people have been detained in connection with the incident, which was captured on camera. The man's wife was also beaten up, according to reports.
summary: गुजरात कारखाना मालिक के आदेश पर दलित व्यक्ति की पीट-पीटकर हत्या

text: A 24-year-old Indian soldier who spent four months in Pakistan's captivity after mistakenly crossing over the border in September 2016, has sought premature discharge from duties. Referring to his capture, Chandu Chavan said it has now become "very taxing" for him. Citing "behavioural issues", Chavan was sent to a military hospital's psychiatric ward for observation three weeks ago.
summary: पाक कैद में 4 महीने बिताने वाले जवान ने सेना छोड़ना चाहता है

text: The government has proposed that those clearing the All India Civil Services Examination be allotted the service as well as the cadre or state only after the three-month foundation course. Under the existing rules, qualifying candidates are immediately allocated the service and cadre based on the ranks they secure in the examination, which is conducted for 24 all-India services.
summary: सिविल सेवा संवर्ग को केवल 3 महीने के पाठ्यक्रम के बाद आवंटित किया जा सकता है

text: Reacting to Pakistan Army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa calling for peace talks with India, Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "Any comment on wanting peace will definitely be taken seriously." Earlier this month, Bajwa had advocated for the peaceful resolution of India-Pakistan disputes and said the solution of any core issues can be found through comprehensive dialogue.
summary: पाक की किसी भी शांति टिप्पणी को गंभीरता से लिया जाएगा: सीतारमण

text: A fire broke out in four coaches of Andhra Pradesh Express near Birlanagar station in Gwalior on Monday. The train was stopped immediately and all passengers were evacuated to safety. Although the cause of the fire is yet to be known, reports quoting Railway sources said that an electrical short circuit could be behind the fire.
summary: आंध्र प्रदेश एक्सप्रेस के 4 डिब्बों में लगी आग

text: The administration at Dharam Samaj Degree College in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh has installed CCTVs in boys' toilets in an attempt to "reduce cheating". Adding that the cameras were not an invasion of privacy, college Principal Dr Hem Prakash said, "Students used to hide chits in their clothes". He also said that there was no need to protest.
summary: अलीगढ़ कॉलेज धोखाधड़ी रोकने के लिए लड़कों के शौचालयों में सीसीटीवी लगाता है

text: The Bombay Lawyers Association (BLA) has filed a petition in the Supreme Court seeking a review of its judgment in the case calling for an investigation into the death of Judge Loya. In April this year, the apex court had dismissed a plea for an independent probe into the case. The court had slammed the petitioners for "maligning" the judiciary.
summary: SC में जज लोया केस पर वकील की बॉडी फाइल्स रिव्यू पिटीशन

text: US President Donald Trump on Sunday tweeted he will officially demand that the Department of Justice probe whether the FBI had "infiltrated" or "surveilled" his presidential campaign for "political purposes". Earlier, media reports claimed the FBI sent an "informant" to talk to Trump campaign advisers after finding evidence that they had "suspicious contacts" linked with Russia.
summary: जांच अगर एफबीआई मेरे चुनाव अभियान पर जासूसी करता है: अमेरिकी राष्ट्रपति ट्रम्प

text: Aditya Birla Group's UltraTech Cement has said it would acquire the cement business of BK Birla Group's Century Textiles for an enterprise value of Ã¢ÂÂ¹8,621 crore. The deal will help UltraTech become the world's third-largest cement maker outside China. The transaction is part of the Birla familyÃ¢ÂÂs plan to consolidate cement businesses within one company, UltraTech MD KK Maheshwari said.
summary: अल्ट्राटेक ने ech Â‚Â¹8,600 करोड़ के सौदे में सेंचुरी का सीमेंट कारोबार खरीदा

text: The UAE has approved steps to allow 100% foreign ownership in companies by year-end. At present, foreigners cannot own more than 49% of any UAE firm unless it is incorporated in a special "free zone". The new rules will also offer residency visas of up to 10 years to investors and specialists in medical, scientific, research, and technical fields.
summary: यूएई विदेशी निवेशकों को 100% व्यापार स्वामित्व की अनुमति देता है

text: Three directors of Fortis Healthcare, Harpal Singh, Sabina Vaisoha and Tejinder Singh Shergill, have resigned ahead of a shareholders' meeting on Tuesday. The meeting was called by two institutional investors to seek the removal of four directors over their handling of Fortis' proposed sale. Former Ranbaxy Laboratories CEO Brian Tempest is the fourth director who still faces a vote.
summary: 3 फोर्टिस के निदेशकों ने शेयरधारकों की बैठक से आगे निकल गए

text: Chinese electronics firm Anker Innovations Technology, which was started by Steven Yang using his mother's savings from her pharmaceutical career, is now valued at about $1.1 billion. The 36-year-old started Anker with less than $1 million in seed capital after he left Google in 2011. Anker sells products ranging from smartphone chargers to portable power banks.
summary: चीनी आदमी माँ की बचत को $ 1 bn इलेक्ट्रॉनिक्स फर्म में बदल देता है

text: Global rating agency Moody's has downgraded Punjab National Bank to 'junk' by reducing its rating to Ba1 from Baa3 after the $2-billion Nirav Modi fraud. Moody's estimates that the bank will need between Ã¢ÂÂ¹12,000-13,000 crore in capital infusion this fiscal to strengthen its capital ratios. Given PNB's "very high" systemic importance, the government may provide "extraordinary support", it added.
summary: $ 2-bn धोखाधड़ी के बाद मूडी ने पीएनबी की रेटिंग को 'कबाड़' में बदल दिया

text: Patanjali Ayurved MD Acharya Balkrishna has said that farmers can make 10 times of what they earn now if food wastage is reduced through food processing. The government should encourage food processing so companies can buy directly from the farmers, he added. Just about 6% of food is processed in India compared to 40% in China, Balkrishna further said.
summary: किसान अब जो भी प्राप्त करते हैं उससे 10 गुना कमा सकते हैं: पतंजलि के एमडी

text: Alia Bhatt, who recently turned 25, said, "I don't know if it's just because I've turned 25, but of late, I've started thinking of baby names." Revealing that baby names now seem attractive to her, she added, "Suddenly, I come across something nice and think yeh naam hona chahiye. I liked two-three names and have kept them in mind!"
summary: मैंने बच्चे के नाम सोचना शुरू कर दिया है: आलिया भट्ट

text: Microsoft on Sunday announced the technology major has acquired the US-based conversational artificial intelligence (AI) startup Semantic Machines. In a blog post, Microsoft said the purchase was designed to boost its digital assistant Cortana along with the social chatbots like XiaoIce. Founded in 2014, the startup is working on technology to allow humans to interact naturally with computers.
summary: Microsoft संवादी एआई स्टार्टअप सिमेंटिक मशीन खरीदता है

text: Facebook is reportedly testing a new feature that will allow its mobile app users to directly share posts on WhatsApp. The feature which is in beta can be accessed by clicking on Facebook's 'Share' button and clicking on 'Send in WhatsApp'. Selecting this option will generate a link which could be directly shared with WhatsApp contacts.
summary: फेसबुक ने व्हाट्सएप पर देशी पोस्ट साझा करने का परीक्षण किया: रिपोर्ट

text: Google is reportedly still considering its decision to acquire a minority stake in Flipkart after Walmart invested $16 billion in the homegrown e-commerce firm. Both Walmart and Tiger Global have had at least five rounds of discussions with Google's parent Alphabet to convince the company to invest, reports added. Earlier, reports claimed Alphabet was investing around $2 billion in Flipkart.
summary: फ्लिपकार्ट की हिस्सेदारी खरीदने के बारे में फैसला करना अभी बाकी है: रिपोर्ट

text: Mumbai-based juice startup RAW Pressery has raised $10 million from existing investors Sequoia Capital, Saama Capital, and DSG Consumer Partners. The startup also raised $6 million from the same group of investors, last year in October. Founded in 2014, RAW Pressery manufactures organic cold-pressed juices and other beverages including smoothies, soups, and nut milk.
summary: जूस स्टार्टअप RAW प्रेसरी, सिकोया, Saama से $ 10 मिलियन उठाता है

text: A woman was allegedly gangraped by four people in a moving car in Uttar Pradesh's Etah after being offered a lift. The victim had been waiting for a bus when one of the accused, a distant relative, stopped his car and offered to drop her home, reports said. While a case has been registered, all four accused are absconding.
summary: लिफ्ट देने के बाद यूपी में चलती कार में महिला से गैंगरेप

text: A 16-year-old girl, whose body parts were found in a drain in Delhi earlier this month, was murdered for demanding her monthly salary, the police said on Sunday. She had been brought to Delhi by some people who would pocket the salary she received as a domestic worker. The accused killed her when she became persistent about her demand.
summary: 16-वृद्ध दिल्ली में वेतन की मांग के लिए टुकड़ों में कटा हुआ

text: SunRisers Hyderabad and Chennai Super Kings finished as top two teams on the IPL 2018 points table and will play the Qualifier 1. The winner will reach the final while the loser will play the winner of the Eliminator, to be played between Kolkata Knight Riders and Rajasthan Royals. The winner of the Qualifier 2 will qualify for the final.
summary: IPL 2018 प्लेऑफ़ के लिए मैचअप क्या हैं?

text: According to Citi Research, Amazon India is currently worth $16 billion, which is the same amount that Walmart is investing in Flipkart in exchange for a 77% stake in the company. The report further claims that Amazon has 30% market share, same as local competitor Flipkart, and is also expected to reach $11 billion in revenue by 2027.
summary: फ्लिपकार्ट में वॉलमार्ट के $ 16 bn निवेश के लायक अमेज़न इंडिया

text: The Kerala Health Department has been put on high alert after the Nipah virus led to the death of around ten people in the state. There is no vaccine or medicine for the disease and the only form of treatment is intensive supportive care. The health department has decided to set up isolation wards to contain the virus.
summary: दुर्लभ बीमारी के बाद केरल हाई अलर्ट पर 10

text: CSK captain MS Dhoni finished off the chase with a six to hand KXIP their fifth straight loss in the IPL 2018 on Sunday. As a result, KXIP failed to qualify for the playoffs as Rajasthan Royals became the fourth team to advance to the next round. The Qualifier 1 between CSK and SRH will take place on May 22.
summary: IPL 2018 के प्लेऑफ में RR को KXIP के रूप में 5 वीं हार मिली

text: Kareena Kapoor Khan has said that her attitude towards movies has changed while adding, "I may say no to big-budget films." Talking about her first film after child birth 'Veere Di Wedding', Kareena said, "I could have come back...playing a titular character... I chose not to. I just had a baby, and I wanted to do something that's young."
summary: मेरा रुख बदल गया, शायद बड़े बजट की फिल्में ना कहें: करीना

text: Barcelona forward Lionel Messi was crowned Europe's top-goalscorer for the fifth time after scoring on 34 occasions in the La Liga for the Catalan side. Messi's rival Cristiano Ronaldo, who has won the award four times in the past, ended up with 26 goals in the La Liga. Liverpool's Mohamed Salah was second in the list with 32 goals.
summary: लियोनेल मेस्सी ने 5 वीं बार यूरोपीय गोल्डन शू जीता

text: The Delhi Police has arrested an NRI man after a woman complained that he was masturbating while sitting next to her on a flight from Istanbul to Delhi. The man, who holds a Russian passport, was shifted to another seat when she alerted the cabin crew. After reaching Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport, he was handed over to the police.
summary: NRI को फ्लाइट में महिला के सामने हस्तमैथुन करते गिरफ्तार

text: On the day of his father and former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi's death anniversary, Congress President Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "My father taught me that hate is a prison for those who carry it." Thanking him for teaching him to "love and respect all beings", Rahul said, "Rajiv Gandhi, those of us that love you hold you forever in our hearts."
summary: पिताजी ने सिखाया नफ़रत जेल: राजीव की पुण्यतिथि पर राहुल

text: During a 2004 interview, then Congress President Sonia Gandhi said, "I came to India as I was madly in love with my husband (late PM Rajiv) as he was with me. Nothing else mattered." Talking about his assassination on May 21, 1991 at an election rally in Tamil Nadu, Sonia revealed she blanked out when she heard the news.
summary: भारत आया क्योंकि मुझे राजीव से प्यार था: सोनिया ने 2004 में कहा था

text: Flash floods in Tripura triggered by heavy rainfall forced at least 670 families to seek shelter at relief camps, West Tripura District Magistrate Sandip Mahate said. Adding that the water of Haora River is flowing at 10.3 metre, which is .3 metre above danger level, Mahate said, "The administration has arranged for ample food supply and drinking water."
summary: त्रिपुरा में बाढ़ से 670 परिवार विस्थापित हुए

text: A woman from J&K's Kishtwar died of sepsis after doctors allegedly left a medical sponge inside her body during a surgery last month. The woman complained of complications after the surgery and was taken to a government medical college, where a CT scan revealed the sponge inside her body. Hospital authorities said an inquiry will be done and action taken.
summary: सर्जरी के दौरान डॉक्टरों के शरीर में स्पंज छोड़ने से महिला की मौत हो जाती है

text: The Delhi Excise Department has banned 900 establishments that serve alcohol from playing recorded music, citing a rule that permits only live bands. This comes after residents complained of noise from establishments at places like Khan Market and Rajouri Garden. Replying to how live bands were less noisy than recorded music, Excise Commissioner Amjad Tak said live performances were "controlled".
summary: दिल्ली में पब में संगीत पर प्रतिबंध है, केवल लाइव बैंड की अनुमति है

text: Nicolas Maduro was on Sunday elected as the President of Venezuela for a second term with over 67% votes. The election saw around 46% voter turnout, against the 80% registered in the last presidential election in 2013. The opposition leaders have called the elections "illegitimate", claiming that there were widespread irregularities including "voter-buying" and "vote-rigging".
summary: निकोलस मादुरो 2 वें कार्यकाल के लिए वेनेजुएला के राष्ट्रपति के रूप में चुने गए

text: A video has emerged that shows a naked man in Poland jumping from the first floor of a house and landing right behind the heavily-armed police squad that is raiding the house. The man, who was trying to avoid the raid, sustained minor leg and hand injuries. Police recovered luxury watches and cell phones during their raid from 34 houses.
summary: नंगे आदमी पहली मंजिल से कूदता है, पुलिस टीम के पीछे भूमि

text: Patanjali Ayurved's Managing Director Acharya Balkrishna has said that the company accounts for around 3% of India's total food processing. "In three years, we want to take this to 10-15%," he added. He further said that Patanjali invested around Ã¢ÂÂ¹4,500 crore last fiscal, which is about 10% of the total investments in food processing industry in India.
summary: पतंजलि का भारत के खाद्य प्रसंस्करण का 3% हिस्सा है: एमडी

text: The CBI will approach the Interpol for a Red Corner Notice against jewellers Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi aimed at bringing them back for facing trial in the PNB fraud cases. The notice will allow enforcement agencies of Interpol's member countries to find and arrest them. Notably, the CBI recently chargesheeted both of them separately in the scam.
summary: नीरव मोदी, मेहुल चोकसी को गिरफ्तार करने के लिए इंटरपोल से संपर्क करने के लिए सी.बी.आई.

text: India has told the World Trade Organisation that it proposes to raise duties on 20 products by up to 100% if the US doesn't roll back high tariffs on certain steel and aluminium items. The items include almonds, walnuts, soybean oil, apples and specific motorcycles imported from the US. India said its tariffs would come into effect by June 21.
summary: भारत ने 20 अमेरिकी उत्पादों पर शुल्क बढ़ाने की धमकी दी

text: As per reports, actor-producer Suniel Shetty and director Priyadarshan are set to make a sequel to their 2006 film 'Bhagam Bhag'. Suniel, who did not act in 'Bhagam Bhag', will reportedly be acting in the sequel and the shooting is scheduled to start later this year. Akshay Kumar, Govinda, Paresh Rawal and Rajpal Yadav had starred in the original film.
summary: सुनील, प्रियदर्शन को 'भागम भाग' का सीक्वल: रिपोर्ट

text: 'Rustom' writer Vipul Rawal has filed a copyright infringement case against director Shree Narayan Singh and writer duo Siddharth-Garima of the upcoming Shahid Kapoor starrer film 'Batti Gul Meter Chalu'. The writer said that he had already registered a story named 'Roshini' in 2009 and its final draft in 2016. Shahid's film earlier faced monetary issues and delay in schedule.
summary: 'रूस्तम' लेखक ने 'बत्ती गुल मीटर चालु' के खिलाफ दायर किया केस

text: Reacting to a question about quitting as the Delhi Daredevils captain, Gautam Gambhir said that he took the decision as it was a moral responsibility and that he would have quit the sport if he had self-doubt. "It was not about we were out of the competition and then giving it to someone to do damage control," Gambhir added.
summary: कप्तानी छोड़ने की जिम्मेदारी आत्म-संदेह नहीं: गंभीर

text: Twitter users caught a moment from IPL's live feed that showed Kings XI Punjab owner Preity Zinta apparently saying that she is just happy that Mumbai Indians did not qualify for the playoffs. text: Swedish professional boxer Badou Jack accidentally punched referee Ian John-Lewis during the WBC light heavyweight championship bout against Adonis Stevenson of Canada. The incident happened after the 11th round when John-Lewis tried to split the boxers. Jack launched a left hook intended for Stevenson but ended up clocking the referee instead.

text: Team India captain Virat Kohli will play under the captaincy of Rory Burns during his one-month county stint at Surrey. Burns, a 27-year-old uncapped left-handed batsman, has scored 6,548 and 1,271 runs in 96 first-class and 42 List A matches respectively. The Epsom-born cricketer replaced Gareth Batty as club captain in December last year.
summary: रोरी बर्न्स कौन है जिसके तहत कोहली सरे में खेलेंगे?

text: The signature of a Kathua rape accused, who claimed he was giving an exam in Meerut during the time of the crime, doesn't match the signature on the attendance sheet, a forensic report has confirmed. It was suspected someone else made the signature as the accused's train was late and he reached Meerut after the examination was over, officials said.

text: An air hostess working with a private airline has accused Bihar BJP MLC Awadhesh Narain Singh's two sons of holding her captive at their father's government bungalow and attempting to sexually assault her. In her police complaint, she claimed that the two men thrashed her and tried to murder her. Singh denied the charges, saying the matter was being "exaggerated".

text: Four persons were killed and 22 others injured when a bus skidded off the road and overturned in Bihar's Darbhanga district on Sunday. The bus skidded off the road in order to save a motorcycle-borne person, police said. The incident occurred near Shankar Lohar village when the bus was on its way to Darbhanga from Biraul, the police added.
summary: बिहार में बस दुर्घटना में 4 की मौत, 22 घायल

text: US President Donald Trump on Saturday misspelt his wife Melania's name as "Melanie" in a tweet welcoming her back home from the hospital. Trump later deleted the tweet and posted another with the correct spelling. The 48-year-old First Lady has undergone a surgery at a military hospital for what the White House called a "benign kidney condition".
summary: ट्रंप ने 'वेलकम होम' ट्वीट में पत्नी मेलानिया का नाम लिया

text: Japanese director Hirokazu Kore-eda's 'Shoplifters' has won the Palme d'Or, the top prize at this year's Cannes Film Festival. 'Shoplifters' is about a family who relies on shoplifting as they cope with a life of poverty. The runner-up prize, the Grand Prix, went to American director Spike Lee for 'BlacKkKlansman' while Lebanese director Nadine Labaki's 'Capernaum' won the Jury Prize.

text: During the closing ceremony at this year's Cannes Film Festival, Italian actress Asia Argento said, "In 1997, I was raped by Harvey Weinstein here at Cannes. I was 21 years old." She added that the film festival was Weinstein's hunting ground. However, Weinstein's attorney denied the allegations and said Argento had a consensual relationship with the producer.
summary: मैं 21 साल का था जब वेनस्टेन ने कान्स में मेरे साथ बलात्कार किया: इतालवी अभिनेत्री

text: Priyanka Chopra who attended Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's royal wedding on Saturday, wrote in a post on Instagram, "Seeing your union and love blessed in front of my eyes made me so happy...and tear up!" She added, "Wish you both love, happiness and togetherness always." Priyanka further wrote, "You my friend (Meghan)...were the epitome of grace, love and beauty."

text: India's Olympic silver-winning shuttler PV Sindhu said that former captain MS Dhoni and current captain Virat Kohli would make for great doubles partners. text: After Karnataka CM BS Yeddyurappa resigned before the floor test, actor-turned-politician Rajinikanth said, "What happened in Karnataka yesterday was a win for democracy." text: Electric carmaker Tesla's CEO Elon Musk has revealed that the company's Model 3 car can go from 0-100 kmph in 3.5 seconds. Musk also claimed that the model has a top speed of 249 kmph and 498 km range. Musk further said that the company is working on two separate versions of the car, and called its driving feel "amazing".

text: A 4,000-year-old intact clay urn containing a human's remains has been discovered in a field in the United Kingdom. Researchers claim that the remains will help figure out the gender of the body, the possible age and possibly the eating habits.

text: A 37-year-old man was arrested on Friday for allegedly raping his 12-year-old daughter at a factory in Gurugram for the last six months. text: Six jawans were martyred and one was injured on Sunday in an IED blast in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada. text: The Tripura government has decided to introduce 10% reservation for women at all levels in the police department. "Initially, we will start with 10% reservation to fight crime against women. text: Around 20 villages in Madhya Pradesh's Satna faced a 12-hour power cut on Saturday as two high-voltage wires pass through the area where Home Minister Rajnath Singh's helicopter was scheduled to land. A notice published in a newspaper had warned of a 26-hour power cut. Singh cancelled his second chopper ride following villagers' protests and directed officials to restore power supply.

text: The 15th Finance Commission has ruled out injustice to any state in the allocation from the pool of central revenue. The southern states had argued that commission's decision to use 2011 population census will not reward states that did well in population control.

text: India's Border Security Force has said Pakistan Rangers called them and "pleaded" with them to stop firing along the International Border in J&K. text: The Income Tax Department has warned entities deducting tax at source to adhere to the quarterly filing deadline of May 31. text: JD(S) leader and Karnataka CM-designate HD Kumaraswamy has clarified there is no rotational chief ministership arrangement with alliance partner Congress. text: Real Madrid failed to win the final match of their La Liga campaign as they gave away a two-goal lead to finish with a 2-2 draw against Villarreal and finish third in the league. text: Technology giant Google along with Taiwanese manufacturer Quanta is reportedly working on a standalone augmented reality (AR) headset, codenamed "Google A65". text: In light of Tesla Model 3 production delays, proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services has proposed to split the company's Chairman and CEO roles, currently occupied by Elon Musk. text: Elon Musk's musician girlfriend Grimes, real name Claire Boucher, is legally changing her name "from Claire to 'c', as in the speed of light". text: BJP General Secretary Ram Madhav has said the NDA government will go to any extent to punish those guilty in the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. text: Markets regulator SEBI will consider penal action against PNB and Mehul Choksi's Gitanjali Gems after the completion of its investigation into suspected disclosure and trading related issues, officials said. text: A Mumbai man, who created a hijack scare on a Jet Airways flight last year, has become the first to be put on India's No-Fly List for disruptive passengers. The airline has banned him for five years for forcing a Mumbai-Delhi flight to divert to Ahmedabad by leaving a hijack message in the business class lavatory.

text: In an interview earlier this year, JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy said, "In the Indian democratic set-up, they (Congress) are more dangerous than BJP." JD(S) has entered into a post-poll alliance with Congress, and Kumaraswamy will be sworn-in as CM on Wednesday.

text: Around 33,000 people have signed a petition to the change the word 'No' in the English language to 'Yesn't'. The term reportedly appeared for the first time online in 2008, meaning "maybe yes and maybe no". Meanwhile, another online dictionary defines the term as a "negative used to express dissent or an unwillingness to do something."

text: After BJP failed to form the government in Karnataka, Goa Congress spokesperson Yatish Naik said that BJP should resign from Goa and other states where it had "stolen" a majority if it had any "shame". On Saturday, BJP's BS Yeddyurappa announced his resignation ahead of the scheduled floor test to prove a majority in the state Assembly.

text: Following BJP's failure to form the government in Karnataka, Congress leader Sanjay Nirupam said that people would name their dogs after state Governor Vajubhai Vala after he established "a new record of loyalty". Nirupam was referring to the Governor's decision to invite BJP to form the government in the state. The Congress leader later apologised for the remark.

text: JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy, who would be taking oath as Karnataka CM on Wednesday, is also a film producer and distributor. He earlier served as CM between February 2006-October 2007 in a coalition government with the BJP.

text: Users have reported that their Facebook Android apps were requesting "superuser access" which would grant the platform full access to their device. text: Google has reportedly confirmed that its "Duplex" system which mimics a human voice will tell users that the call is being recorded while booking appointments online. text: A government-run ayurveda hospital in Punjab's Ludhiana will inject goat blood in Thalassaemia patients to ensure that their haemoglobin levels do not drop, medical officers have said. text: A man hailing from Punjab's Kapurthala travelled over 10,000 km across 11 nations, including Mexico, Brazil, and Peru, in over a month to illegally enter the US in 2016. The man named Harpreet Singh had wanted US citizenship and worked 15 months at a department store in Louisiana. He was caught by the US authorities and deported back to India.

text: BSF Assistant Commandant Loveraj Singh Dharmshaktu has set a national record by scaling Mount Everest for the seventh time. Dharmshaktu led an expedition team of 25 people and had left the second base camp of the peak on Thursday for the climb. The team will be bringing back garbage from the peak as part of 'Clean and Save Glaciers' campaign.

text: China and the US will not engage in a trade war and will stop imposing tariffs on each other, Chinese Vice Premier Liu He was quoted by the state-run media. The US sparked possibility of the trade war by imposing tariffs on $60-billion worth Chinese imports. China retaliated by announcing tariffs up to 25% on $50-billion worth US imports.

text: The government is planning to open up restricted areas of Arunachal Pradesh and Sikkim for foreign tourists, Tourism Minister KJ Alphons has said. Currently, foreign tourists have access to these areas through Protected Areas Permit and Restricted Areas Permit.

text: BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar, accused of raping a girl in Unnao last year, has been booked by the CBI for allegedly framing the rape victim's father in a false case of possessing illegal firearms. Earlier, the MLA's brother was booked over the murder of the victim's father, who died after he was allegedly beaten up in police custody.
summary: बीजेपी विधायक पर रेप पीड़िता के पिता को झूठे केस में फंसाने का केस दर्ज

text: US President Donald Trump has said that his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping could be "influencing" North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, who recently visited China. Trump's remarks came after North Korea threatened to cancel talks with the US over military drills with South Korea. The US has repeatedly accused China of helping North Korea by means of trade and evading sanctions.

text: China has agreed to "significantly increase" its purchase of goods from the US in an attempt to reduce the latter's $375-billion trade deficit, a joint statement issued by the two countries said. This comes after US President Donald Trump threatened stringent tariffs on Chinese imports if the trade surplus was not reduced by $200 billion by 2020.
summary: चीन 'ट्रेड वॉर' को रोकने के लिए अमेरिकी आयात बढ़ाने पर सहमत

text: South Korea's fourth-largest conglomerate LG Group has said its Chairman Koo Bon-moo passed away at the age of 73 on Sunday due to illness. He became the third chairman of LG at the age of 50 in 1995. The group's holding company LG Corp on Thursday nominated his son Koo Kwang-mo to the board in preparation for a leadership succession.

text: After losing his mother Vijay Laxmi Khandelwal to cancer, Rajeev Khandelwal tweeted, "She now lives within me...We fought together, we hoped together but we couldn't come out of it together." He added, "'Gratitude'...to all those who touched our lives during this fight." His mother passed away on May 16 after a year and a half long fight with cancer.

text: Kolkata Knight Riders' owner Shah Rukh Khan tweeted that he stayed awake for 24 hours in anticipation of his side's critical match against SRH, which decided their qualification for the playoffs. Following his side's win, SRK thanked his side's match-winners including Dinesh Karthik, Robin Uthappa, Chris Lynn and Sunil Narine. "Very happy cant sleep now!!", part of SRK's tweet read.
summary: केकेआर के करो या मरो मैच के लिए चिंताजनक SRK 24 घंटे जागता रहा

text: Talking about her struggle with bipolar disorder, Shama Sikander said, "I don't even know how I survived! I still wonder how strong I must be!" She added, "I have always been unashamed of my life and not very afraid of sharing it to the world." She said her aim is to help others who are going through the same struggles.

text: Israel has built a "missile net" along its border with Jordan to defend a new airport from strikes, military officials said. text: Shivangi Pathak, a 16-year-old girl from Haryana, has become the youngest Indian woman to climb the world's highest mountain, Mount Everest, from Nepal side. text: UK's Prince Harry married actress Meghan Markle on May 19, the same date his ancestor King Henry VIII had his wife Anne Boleyn executed on the charges of adultery, incest and plotting his murder. text: The UN Human Rights Council on Friday voted to probe allegations of war crimes committed by Israeli forces after 60 Palestinians were killed in clashes near the Gaza border on Monday. text: French researchers have claimed that German dictator Adolf Hitler definitely died in 1945 in Berlin, refuting conspiracy theories behind his death. The researchers, who studied Hitler's teeth and dentures, said that he died from taking cyanide and a bullet. A hole on left side of Hitler's skull fragment was probably caused by the passage of a bullet, they added.

text: With 188 billionaires, Harvard University has produced more billionaires than Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), Stanford University and Yale University combined, according to a report by Wealth-X. Stanford produced 74 billionaires, MIT has 38 billionaire alumni and Yale has produced 31 billionaires. The average net worth of Stanford's billionaire alumni is the highest, the report added.

text: John Abraham, who is portraying a junior bureaucrat in the Prime Minister's Office in his upcoming film 'Parmanu: The Story of Pokhran', said, "Abhishek (Sharma) told me...(to) look like...regular human being...I couldn't have a chiselled body." text: Slamming people for trolling Aishwarya Rai over a picture which shows her kissing daughter Aaradhya, Pooja Bhatt questioned, "Since when does a mother need permission from the world to kiss her child?" Dia Mirza said, "Since when was a mother's display of affection a reason for trolling?" Aishwarya had posted the picture on Instagram with the caption, "Love you unconditionally."
summary: कब से चुंबन बच्चे को मां की जरूरत अनुमति करता है: पूजा भट्ट

text: Bottom-placed Delhi Daredevils, who are already out of contention for a place in the IPL 2018 playoffs, defeated second-placed CSK on Friday to end their three-match losing streak. The match witnessed CSK captain MS Dhoni, who scored 17(23), become the fifth Indian batsman to reach 6,000 runs in T20 cricket. Only CSK and SRH have qualified for the playoffs yet.

text: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has been elected as the Congress Legislature Party leader at a meeting in Hyderabad. "Karnataka Congress Legislature Party...unanimously elected Shri @siddaramaiah as the leader of the CLP as per the directions of Congress President Shri @RahulGandhi," the party tweeted. This comes ahead of the Supreme Court-directed floor test in the state assembly on Saturday.
summary: सिद्धारमैया कांग्रेस विधायक दल के नेता के रूप में चुने गए

text: Elon Musk-led electric automaker Tesla may need over $10 billion by 2020 to fund its operations and expected expansion into China, according to Goldman Sachs. Earlier, Musk had responded to a report that claimed Tesla is heading to a "cash crunch", saying the company doesn't need to raise money. He also claimed Tesla will be profitable in Q3 and Q4.
summary: मस्क की टेस्ला को 2020 तक $ 10 बिलियन की आवश्यकता हो सकती है: गोल्डमैन सैक्स

text: India is among the regions where overuse of water resources has caused a decline in freshwater availability, as per a NASA study. Earth's wetland areas are getting wetter and dry areas going drier due to human water management, climate change and natural cycles. Researchers used 14 years of satellite observations from the US/German GRACE mission to study 34 regions worldwide.

text: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will introduce washing machines and mechanised dryers in Mumbai's 19th-century Dhobi Ghat in the next three years. The BMC has removed over 150 illegal ground-plus-one structures so far to ensure fire safety in the Ghat. However, the BMC is receiving flak from activists for starting the demolition drive without giving time to the residing families.

text: Passengers aboard a Lucknow-Mumbai IndiGo flight had to spend three hours without AC on the stationary aircraft after one of its engines developed a technical snag on Friday. Many passengers tweeted about the situation, questioning why the plane couldn't have been checked before boarding. The airline clarified that the snag developed just as the plane was about to take off.
summary: यात्री रोड़ा के कारण IndiGo विमान पर AC के बिना 3hrs खर्च करते हैं

text: Six cases of alleged rape of minors were recorded in Odisha within 24 hours. While a class 8 student was raped by two youths when she went to relieve herself in Nabarangpur, a 15-year-old girl in Balasore alleged she was raped by a man for a year. In Balasore, a mentally-challenged 10-year-old was raped by her 56-year-old neighbour.

text: The Centre has approved Ã¢ÂÂ¹685-crore relief funds for ensuring that Punjab farmers do not resort to burning stubble, state Health and Family Welfare Minister Brahm Mohindra has said. He further lauded CM Amarinder Singh for his "valiant efforts" in persuading the Centre for releasing funds. Punjab, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh collectively burn 23 million tonne stubble between October and November.

text: The currency situation is completely normal and ATMs are working well across India, Economic Affairs Secretary SC Garg has said. He said that adequate amount of currency is available and there are no reports of shortage now. "For last few days...we're seeing net increase in the currency. In last 3-4 days there is surplus deposit of Ã¢ÂÂ¹4,000 crore," he added.

text: Speaker of the UK's House of Commons, John Bercow, reportedly called House Leader and Cabinet Minister Andrea Leadsom a "stupid woman" and "f**king useless" during a session. Bercow made the alleged remarks while criticising the government's conduct. Bercow has been previously accused of bullying former members of staff.
