text: A newborn baby boy was saved by strangers after being found abandoned in a garbage bin on a street in the eastern China city of Mingguang. The baby was taken to a local hospital for checkup where doctors said the baby was healthy with no signs of defects. The baby was sent to a community centre for temporary care.
summary: बिन बुलाए मिले नवजात को चीन में अजनबियों ने बचा लिया

text: As many as 30 Congress workers were detained on Friday for protesting outside the Rajkot residence of Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala, the Gujarat Police has said. Protesting against Vajubhai's decision of inviting BJP to prove majority instead of inviting the Congress-JD(S) alliance to form the government in Karnataka, the protestors called his act a "blot on democracy".

text: After the Supreme Court ordered a floor test for Karnataka Assembly, CM Yeddyurappa said, "Of course they are with us, if the MLAs from Congress and JD(S) don't support us, how can we prove majority?" He added that BJP "will win the floor test 101%". Meanwhile, Congress has shifted its MLAs to a Hyderabad resort to avoid poaching by BJP.
summary: बेशक कांग्रेस, जद (एस) के विधायक भाजपा का समर्थन करते हैं: कर्नाटक के सीएम

text: At least eight people were reported to be killed and several others injured on Friday in a mass shooting at a school in Texas, US. The school district said that the situation is "active but contained", while a suspect, said to be a male student, has been taken into custody. This is the 22nd school shooting in US this year.
summary: इस साल अमेरिका में 22 वें स्कूल की शूटिंग में 8 की मौत की आशंका

text: Prernaa Arora of KriArj Entertainment, who had earlier lost a legal battle against John Abraham over 'Parmanu', has been made to step down as the producer of the films 'Batti Gul Meter Chalu' and 'Fanne Khan'. The shooting of 'Batti Gul...' had been halted over issues including non-payment of dues. Producer Bhushan Kumar has taken over both the films.
summary: प्रेरणा ने 'बत्ती गुल ...', 'फन्ने खान' के निर्माता के रूप में जगह बनाई।

text: Talking about the controversy regarding casting couch in the film industry, Madhuri Dixit said, "I wouldn't know about the casting couch practice because I never heard of or experienced it." "But I suppose today...people are willing to listen to a woman speaking...they back her up instead of targetting her," she added. Madhuri further said, "Women were probably more scared then."
summary: कास्टिंग काउच के बारे में नहीं जानते, कभी इसका अनुभव नहीं किया: माधुरी

text: 'Heeriye', the first song from the Salman Khan starrer 'Race 3', shows actress Jacqueline Fernandez pole dancing. summary: सलमान की रेस 3 के पहले गाने में जैकलीन पोल डांस करती दिख रही हैं

text: Talking about the lack of pay gap on the show 'Game of Thrones' (GoT), Emilia Clarke said, "I have always been paid the same amount as my male co-stars." She added, "It was my first job, and I was not discriminated against because I was a woman, in my paycheck." Emilia portrays the character Daenerys Targaryen in the show.
summary: मुझे हमेशा GoT: Emilia में पुरुष सह-कलाकारों के समान भुगतान किया गया है

text: Chennai Super Kings' Suresh Raina has said Delhi Daredevils' Rishabh Pant is his favorite batsman "right now". "He is doing so well...The way he plays, he reminds me of myself, of my early days," he added. "He...will play for a long time for India," Raina further said about Pant, who has scored 620 runs in the IPL 2018 so far.

text: After BJP appointed KG Bopaiah as the Protem Speaker ahead of the Karnataka Assembly floor test on Saturday, Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala termed the legislator as "dented and tainted". Stating that BJP broke the convention of appointing the senior-most MLA as Protem Speaker, Surjewala alleged Bopaiah had violated norms and disqualified 11 rebel MLAs to save BJP government in 2011.

text: The Supreme Court on Friday barred Karnataka CM BS Yeddyurappa from taking policy decisions till Assembly floor test. While Governor Vajubhai Vala had earlier provided 15 days to BJP for proving majority, the SC denied BJP's request for "reasonable time" and ordered that floor test should be conducted on Saturday. "We don't give any time to anybody," the SC said.
summary: फर्श परीक्षण तक नीतिगत निर्णय नहीं ले सकते हैं: एससी

text: On being asked about current Indian captain Virat Kohli's captaincy, former Indian captain MS Dhoni simply responded with, "He's very good". "I always felt a good captain is the one who understands individuals. Because if you don't know a player's strength or weakness, you cannot give him the proper advice," Dhoni said about being a good captain.
summary: वह बहुत अच्छा है: कोहली की कप्तानी के बारे में पूछे जाने पर धोनी

text: The partially-decomposed, naked body of a 28-year-old woman was found by police at a one-room house in Bhopal after locals complained of foul smell. The post-mortem report revealed that the woman was raped and assaulted with a beer bottle and a soft drink bottle, which were found in her private parts. The man she lived with has been arrested.
summary: भोपाल महिला की हत्या, प्राइवेट पार्ट में मिली बीयर की बोतल

text: Pakistan's Punjab province has restored the security of 26/11 Mumbai terror attack mastermind Hafiz Saeed, a month after the Supreme Court ordered to withdraw it. Officials said Saeed's security was restored over threats to his life. Saeed has repeatedly slammed the Pakistani government for succumbing to US pressure amid crackdown on his organisations and charities.

text: A Texas-based physician has been charged for his role in a $240-million healthcare fraud and international money laundering scheme. The doctor allegedly administered costly chemotherapy and medications to patients based on false diagnosis. The co-conspirators purchased private jets, luxury cars including a Maserati, branded clothing such as Louis Vuitton, and real estates in the US and Mexico.

text: All of Chile's 34 Roman Catholic bishops on Friday offered their resignations to Pope Francis over a child sex abuse scandal and its cover-up. They asked forgiveness from victims and the Church for their "grave errors and omissions". Condemning the charges, the Pope had slammed the bishops for failing to protect the children from the accused.

text: Talking about joining social media, Kareena Kapoor Khan said, "I think that'll never be possible because I'm very private about my life." She added, "Despite not being on social media, I think my life is on social media, so I like it that way." Kareena further said, "I don't want to be the one posting pictures and videos."

text: RCB's AB de Villiers has revealed Virat Kohli told him he "raised the bar way too high for them" after proposing to wife Danielle at Taj Mahal in 2012. text: Referring to the audio clip released by the Congress on Friday, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar said, "This audio CD is one of the handiworks of Congress' dirty tricks department. text: Indian women's cricket team opener Smriti Mandhana has revealed that she did not know what opening, middle order and lower order were when she was filling a form to get into U-19 cricket. The 21-year-old said she called her father to ask what to fill. "My father said 'Bhar de bindass opening' and that's how I became opener," she added.

text: Talking about not getting to open for Brisbane Heat in the women's Big Bash League, Indian women's cricket team opener Smriti Mandhana said Australians were not as hospitable as Indians. "It's not like out here, they don't extend courtesies to foreigners," she added. "I'd never played one down, two down...I had to play at these positions there," she further said.

text: The first Indian woman to score a one-day double hundred, Smriti Mandhana, revealed she achieved the record in 2013 with Rahul Dravid's bat. Smriti added she wanted to keep the bat as a showpiece after her brother got it from Dravid. She further said she got it repaired four times before her father told her to stop playing with it.

text: Concerned at the job losses in telecom sector, Telecom secretary Aruna Sundararajan said the government has begun helping the affected employees get alternative employment. She said objective "is to see how people can be, if not retrained, how they can try and be redeployed gainfully." "We're trying to open up new opportunities for people at the lower levels," she added.

text: A man from Amritsar was arrested for allegedly trying to sell his newborn baby girl after a doctor alerted the police. The accused, who carried the baby in a polythene bag for six hours, claimed that he needed money for his wife's treatment. He added his wife had asked him to sell the baby as they couldn't afford her expenses.

text: Brazilian authorities arrested 251 people on Thursday in the country's largest crackdown on child pornography. More than 1 million picture files from 284 cities were seized under Operation "Light in Childhood 2". Brazil's Public Security Minister Raul Jungmann claimed that the country-wide crackdown was "the biggest in the world to be carried out in a single day".

text: A homeless man is suing Burger King for nearly $1 million after he was wrongfully accused of using counterfeit cash. Emory Ellis was jailed for nearly three months after he tried to pay at Burger King franchisee in Boston in 2015 using a $10 bill that cashier thought was fake. Ellis said he was discriminated against based on his appearance.

text: The Bombay High Court has directed Mumbai Police to form a "special team" of officials to probe into allegations of defamatory emails received by Tata Motors' subsidiary, Tata Motors Insurance Broking & Advisory Services. The company alleged that it has been receiving emails from many 'fictitious' email addresses containing "slanderous" allegations against the firm, its CEO and other officials.

text: Talking about Air India's privatisation, Jet Airways Chairman Naresh Goyal said, "Not saying that we won't look at Air India, I have never said that." He added, "Ultimately we will always see what is the best approach ahead of us, and for the country." Goyal further said that plan to privatise Air India is "a brave and very good decision".

text: Congress has released a purported audio clip of BJP MLA Janardhana Reddy offering money and posts to Congress MLA from Raichur Rural in order to poach him. The man can be heard saying, "Whatever post you want, let's speak about it...Whatever wealth you have earned, you will make 100 times more." The Congress MLA can be heard declining his offer.
summary: भाजपा के रेड्डी को हमारे विधायक को पैसा देने का ऑडियो मिला: कांग्रेस

text: Nuclear Suppliers Group was founded after India conducted its first nuclear test on May 18, 1974. NSG's website says the explosion by a non-nuclear-weapon state "demonstrated that nuclear technology transferred for peaceful purposes could be misused." The 48-nation group which controls trade of nuclear material has blocked India's membership citing it is non-signatory to Non-Proliferation Treaty.
summary: भारत अभी भी एनएसजी का हिस्सा नहीं है, जिसका गठन 1974 के परमाणु परीक्षण के बाद किया गया था

text: Actor Jim Sarbh, while responding to the criticism he has received for making a joke on rape, said, "I didn't intend to hurt anybody, and I certainly don't consider actual sexual or physical violence funny." "Sexual violence is a serious issue and I treat it as such. It is unfortunate that my comments were taken out of context," he added.
summary: मैं यौन हिंसा को मज़ेदार नहीं मानता: जिम ऑन रेप जोक पंक्ति

text: Former Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy's wife, Radhika Kumaraswamy, a Kannada actress-producer, was trending on Google today. This comes amid controversy over formation of government in Karnataka due to hung assembly. Radhika, who made her acting debut in 2002 aged 14, reportedly married Kumaraswamy in 2006, the year he was elected CM. Radhika's first husband died of a heart attack.
summary: कर्नाटक पंक्ति के बीच लोग एचडी कुमारस्वामी की पत्नी को गुगला रहे हैं

text: After the Congress questioned the appointment of BJP MLA KG Bopaiah as the Protem Speaker in Karnataka Assembly by Governor Vajubhai Vala, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar said, "Congress is raising hoax objection." "Bopaiah was appointed as Protem Speaker even in 2008 by the then Governor. That time Bopaiah was 10 years younger than what he is today," he added.
summary: प्रोटेम स्पीकर को कांग्रेस की आपत्ति है झूठा: केंद्रीय मंत्री

text: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad on Friday alleged that the Centre has abducted Karnataka Congress MLA Anand Singh and is holding him captive in Delhi. Adding that the Centre was using Enforcement Directorate to harass Congress MLAs, Azad said that he knew which central minister had abducted him. Singh had quit BJP in January to join Congress ahead of elections.
summary: केंद्र ने कर्नाटक कांग्रेस विधायक का अपहरण किया: गुलाम नबी आजाद

text: Talking about his one-handed leaping catch against SunRisers Hyderabad, Royal Challengers Bangalore's AB de Villiers said he "made it look better than it actually was". "I got into a bad position...minute I took the jump I realised it was a little outside of my body and I just had to put my right arm out. Luckily, it stuck," he added.
summary: मैंने इसे वास्तव में बेहतर होने से बेहतर बना दिया: पकड़ में एबीडी

text: The Supreme Court has ordered a floor test for Karnataka Assembly on Saturday, wherein CM Yeddyurappa will have to prove BJP enjoys majority support of at least 112 MLAs. While MLAs can orally cast votes in 'voice vote' method, votes are cast using machines or ballots in the 'division vote' method. SC said voting can't take place through 'secret ballots'.
summary: कर्नाटक में बीजेपी के लिए 'फ्लोर टेस्ट' क्या है?

text: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates has said that US President Donald Trump asked him the difference between HIV and and Human papillomavirus (HPV) on two occasions. "I was able to explain that those were rarely confused with each other," Gates added. Trump had also asked about the negative effects of vaccines at both the meetings, Gates further said.
summary: ट्रम्प ने मुझसे दो बार एचआईवी और एचपीवी के बीच अंतर पूछा: गेट्स

text: The US Senate on Thursday voted in favour of appointing US President Donald Trump's nominee Gina Haspel as intelligence agency CIA's Director. With her appointment, Haspel became the first woman to lead the spy agency. Haspel's appointment had faced opposition amid her role in the torture of terror suspects after 9/11.
summary: सीनेट द्वारा सीआईए की पहली महिला निदेशक की नियुक्ति की पुष्टि

text: Talking about the viral 'Yanny vs Laurel' audio clip, US President Donald Trump joked that instead of the two words, he heard the word "covfefe" in the clip. The US President was trolled last year after he had mistakenly tweeted the word 'covfefe'. Meanwhile, Trump's daughter Ivanka said that she heard the word 'Laurel'.
summary: मैंने 'कोवफेफ' सुना: ट्रम्प ने 'यान्नी बनाम लॉरेल' बहस पर

text: Citizens of Netherlands' Leeuwarden have crowdfunded a 25-foot tall fountain featuring over 220 wooden penises as rebellion, after international artists were commissioned to install fountains in the city. The fountain houses a public toilet and begins squirting water when the toilet is flushed. The fountains were commissioned after Leeuwarden was declared the 'European capital of culture 2018'.
summary: डच नागरिक इंटल कलाकारों के खिलाफ लिंग फव्वारा स्थापित करते हैं

text: Fox News has named Suzanne Scott as its first-ever female CEO after Roger Ailes was ousted as CEO in 2016 amid sexual harassment allegations. Scott will lead Fox News and Fox Business Network. text: US drug regulator has approved the sale of the first-ever medicine that prevents migraine, a debilitating headache which can last from hours to days, affecting nearly 15% people worldwide. text: An international study by 33 scientists has claimed the sudden emergence of octopus on Earth 270 million years ago could be hypothetically explained with their cryopreserved eggs brought by comets. Pointing out micro-organism fossil evidence within meteorites, researchers said, "Life may have been seeded here on Earth by life-bearing comets as soon as conditions on Earth allowed it to flourish."
summary: ऑक्टोपस बर्फीले उल्काओं में बाहरी स्थान से आया था, अध्ययन का दावा है

text: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has said out-patient departments at government health centres witnessed a 126% rise in the number of drug addicts seeking treatment. While 1.82 lakh addicts reported for treatment in 2016, the number rose to 4.12 lakh last year. However, BJP claimed that drug abuse is still rampant and government initiatives have failed to yield any results.
summary: नशीली दवाओं के उपचार में 126% वृद्धि की मांग: पंजाब के मुख्यमंत्री

text: Ecuadorean President LenÃÂ­n Moreno has ordered the immediate removal of extra security assigned to WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange at the country's embassy in London. The move comes after the Guardian revealed Ecuador spent nearly Ã¢ÂÂ¹34 crore on a surveillance operation to "protect" Assange in the embassy. Assange has been seeking political asylum in the Ecuadorian Embassy in London since 2012.

text: While talking about his first meeting with US President Donald Trump, Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said, "It was kind of scary how much Trump knew about my daughter's appearance." He added how Trump had encountered his daughter Jennifer at a horse show and then made a grand entrance in a helicopter to the same place about 20 minutes later.

text: US President Donald Trump on Thursday defended his use of the word 'animals' to describe undocumented immigrants who enter the country illegally. He clarified that the term referred to the international criminal gang MS-13 and that he will continue using the term. Mexico had filed a diplomatic note of complaint to the US State Department over Trump's 'animals' remark.
summary: ट्रंप ने 'जानवरों की टिप्पणी' का बचाव करते हुए कहा कि वह हमेशा इसका इस्तेमाल करेंगे

text: Starbucks has been slammed after a Latino man, Pedro, received his order with a racial slur written on it. An employee at the California outlet of Starbucks wrote 'beaner' on the customer's coffee cup instead of his name. The outlet offered free coffee and a $50 gift card to Pedro as an apology but he did not accept it.
summary: लातीनी आदमी के कप पर नस्लीय घोल का उपयोग करने के लिए स्टारबक्स पटक दिया

text: Kangana Ranaut and Jim Sarbh have been slammed by Twitter users over a video from an after-party at Cannes Film Festival, which shows Jim making a rape joke and Kangana laughing at it. A user commented, "Have some sense before cracking [rape] jokes!!" "If you tell or laugh at jokes about rape you're part of the problem," wrote another user.

text: As the BJP and Congress-JD(S) alliance stake claim to form the Karnataka government, PM Narendra Modi on Friday tweeted birthday wishes to JD(S) supremo HD Deve Gowda. With a combined total of 115 seats, the JD(S) and Congress entered into a post-poll alliance against the BJP which secured 104 seats. The JD(S)-Congress alliance backed Gowda's son HD Kumaraswamy as CM.

text: JD(S) leader Mathew Thomas on Friday alleged that the Civil Aviation Ministry did not give permission for a charter plane to shift Congress and JD(S) MLAs from Karnataka to Kerala. Kerala Tourism Minister Kadakampally Surendran had earlier invited the MLAs to the state to avoid horse-trading and poaching by BJP. The MLAs have reportedly been shifted to Hyderabad.

text: RCB captain Virat Kohli appeared surprised and angry after a dismissal off a catch was overruled by the third umpire during his side's match against SunRisers Hyderabad on Thursday. summary: ओवर डिसाइड करते ही कोहली को थर्ड अंपायर पर गुस्सा आता है

text: Directing BJP to prove majority in Karnataka Assembly at 4 pm on Saturday, the Supreme Court said, "It's just a number game. One who enjoys majority should be invited to form the government." Even as BJP's counsel Mukul Rohatgi opposed the floor test arguing that they "need time", the court observed that floor test seemed to be "the best option".

text: The Supreme Court has stayed the nomination of an Anglo-Indian MLA to Karnataka Assembly until the floor test on Saturday. The decision came based on Congress-JD(U)'s petition arguing that the MLA's nomination would help BJP prove majority in the Assembly. The court also directed that incumbent CM BS Yeddyurappa cannot take any major policy decision until the floor test.

text: After the Supreme Court's order to hold the floor test in Karnataka Assembly on Saturday, Congress leader Ashwani Kumar said, "The Supreme Court's verdict has upheld constitutional morality and democracy." "Faith of people in wisdom of the Supreme Court is vindicated once again. It's set back for a party that wanted to usurp power," Kumar added.

text: Instagram has announced a new feature that allows users to share feed posts to their Stories. To share a post, users can tap on the paper airplane button below a post, following which an option to create a story will be visible. After clicking on it, posts will appear as stickers and users will be allowed to customise the background.

text: US-based payments platform PayPal has said that it is buying Sweden-based payments startup iZettle for $2.2 billion in an all-cash deal. As part of the deal, which is expected to close in the third quarter of 2018, iZettle's CEO Jacob de Geer will stay to lead the business. Founded in 2010, iZettle offers payments solutions including mobile card readers.

text: Germany's Federal Supreme Court has ruled beer cannot be marketed as beneficial after a consumer rights group sued a brewery for falsely advertising its health benefits. text: Edwise India's Leading Overseas Education Consultant is hosting over 80 international institutions from 12 countries. Students can meet delegates on one on one basis and get information on course identification, course fees, scholarships, visas, loan, etc. Personal attention will be given to applications. Spot offers, admissions and application fee waivers will be given for meritorious and complete applications.

text: Ryan Reynolds starrer 'Deadpool 2', which released today, "features some crazy action, wicked humour... and well-timed humour," wrote Bollywood Hungama. 'Deadpool 2' is "audaciously crafted and cleverly written", said The Times of India (TOI). The Indian Express wrote the film hits the right spots effortlessly. It has been rated 3.5/5 (Bollywood Hungama), 4.5/5 (TOI) and 3/5 (The Indian Express).

text: Late actress Sridevi was honoured posthumously for her contribution to Indian cinema at the Titan Reginald F Lewis Film Honours, held as part of Cannes Film Festival. Filmmaker Subhash Ghai received the award on behalf of her family. "Janhvi, Khushi and I are overwhelmed...She'll live forever, thanks to her body of work," said Sridevi's husband Boney Kapoor in a statement.

text: Sixteen black actresses, led by Aissa Maiga, staged a protest against racism at the Cannes Film Festival red carpet. They recently collaborated on the book 'Black Is Not My Job', in which they provide anecdotes of the racism they've faced in their careers. "It's a historic moment. It was beyond my wildest dreams," said Maiga.

text: Television actor Amit Tandon's estranged wife Ruby, who is a dermatologist, has reportedly been released from Dubai jail after 10 months. text: The Congress has sought to meet Manipur Governor Najma Heptulla on Friday to stake claim to form the state government as it was voted the single largest party in 2017. "We were single largest party and had immediately met Governor after results were announced but we weren't invited to form government," former CM OI Singh said.

text: Ahead of the hearing on its petition against Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala's invite to BJP to form the government, Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad has said, "We have full faith in the Supreme Court." The apex court will not repeat the same mistake the Governor did, he added. The Governor gave BJP 15 days to prove majority in the Assembly.

text: Former Indian cricketer Lalchand Rajput, who was the manager of the winning Indian cricket team for the 2007 ICC World Twenty20 in South Africa, has been named the interim coach of the Zimbabwe cricket team. Lalchand also coached Afghanistan from June 2016 to August 2017, helping the Afghanistan side gain ICC's Test cricket status under his tenure.

text: In a recently leaked video named 'The Selfish Ledger' by Google's research unit 'X', the company detailed how total data collection can shape decisions. The 'Ledger' would ask users to create a life goal and prompt them to engage in activities to help achieve it. With increasing data, it's possible to develop understanding of issues like depression, the video explained.

text: More than 100 Congress leaders and workers have been arrested in Tripura for holding 'Akrosh' rally to protest against BJP for allegedly demolishing many party offices in the state. Congress has claimed that BJP-IPFT coalition government in the state has been demolishing party offices without prior legal notice. "BJP has destroyed the fabric of democracy," Congress leader Birajit Sinha said.

text: Elon Musk has shared a picture of a real 'Boring Candy', days after saying he will start a candy company. Adding that the company would be "amazing", Musk had tweeted that American investor Warren Buffett won't be able to "resist investing!" text: NASA astronaut Ricky Arnold has shared a selfie taken during a spacewalk outside the International Space Station, which orbits the Earth at a 400-km altitude. Arnold and fellow spacewalker Drew Feustel worked for over six hours to swap a malfunctioning cooling box nicknamed 'Leaky', the source of an ammonia leak five years ago, with another relatively colder box called 'Frosty'.

text: Indonesia has agreed to give India strategic and military access to its Sabang seaport, Indonesia minister Luhut Pandjaitan has said. In turn, India will invest in the port's development and build a hospital on the island, the minister added.

text: Hearing petitions seeking to decriminalise begging, Delhi High Court said, "How is begging an offence in a country where you (government) are not able to provide food or jobs?" "It is out of sheer necessity that someone puts out a hand to beg for food," the court observed. The petitioners also sought human and fundamental rights for beggars in Delhi.

text: US President Donald Trump has warned North Korean leader Kim Jong-un he'll suffer Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi's fate if he "doesn't make a deal" on his nuclear program. text: The US Air Force has apologised over a tweet that linked the killing of Taliban militants in Afghanistan by US-backed forces with the viral Internet debate on whether a sound strip says 'Laurel' or 'Yanny'. text: The US State Department said the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks' mastermind Hafiz Saeed is a tremendous concern to the US. Nauert added the US has a reward on Saeed for his arrest.

text: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala on Thursday said, "[Karnataka Governor] Vajubhai Vala had sacrificed his seat for [PM] Narendra Modi earlier, yesterday he sacrificed Constitution and democracy for him." text: Royal Challengers Bangalore's South African batsman AB de Villiers repeated his shuffling outside the off stump shot, that landed over the roof of the Chinnaswamy Stadium while playing against the SunRisers Hyderabad on Thursday. text: Congress leader Ramalinga Reddy on Thursday said, "After the police was withdrawn (from outside Eagleton Resort), they (BJP) came inside & offered money. This comes after the party claimed the security cover from outside the resort where the party MLAs are staying was withdrawn hours after BJP's BS Yeddyurappa became the CM.

text: SRH lost to RCB in the IPL 2018 on Thursday despite registering their highest-ever total of 204/3 while chasing. With their third straight victory, RCB have now moved to the fifth spot on the tournament points table, with 12 points from 13 matches. text: Astronomers have discovered the earliest stars started forming just 250 million years after the Big Bang, nearly 2% of the present age of the 13.6-billion-year-old Universe. The discovery also represents the most distant oxygen ever detected in the Universe and the most distant galaxy ever observed by the Chile-based telescopes ALMA and VLT, noted researchers.

text: Dabbawalas in Mumbai will gift traditional Maharashtrian wedding outfits to UK's Prince Harry and actress Meghan Markle ahead of the royal wedding on May 19. The dabbawalas will also distribute sweets on the wedding day in Mumbai. Two members of the dabbawalas' organisation were invited to the wedding of Prince Charles in 2005.

text: Slamming the Centre's announcement of a unilateral ceasefire in Jammu and Kashmir for the month of Ramadan, Kashmiri separatist leaders described it as a "cosmetic measure". Accusing the government of playing a "cruel joke" on Kashmiri people, the Joint Resistance Leadership said it is "highly illogical" to offer "relaxations in killings for one month and then restart it."

text: Carlo Palombo, a former Barclays trader accused of rigging a benchmark interest rate, has told a London court that "being a vice president at Barclays was equivalent to the guy that serves you in McDonald's." Palombo allegedly conspired to rig Brussels-based Euribor rates between 2005 and 2009. Palombo said that vice president is not what everyone thinks and "it's junior".

text: RCB's AB de Villiers pulled off a one-handed catch with his body 1.13m above the ground to dismiss SRH's Alex Hales in the IPL 2018 on Thursday. Hales advanced down the wicket and hit a Moeen Ali delivery towards the deep midwicket, where De Villiers reacted in no time and leapt to pluck the catch with his right hand.

text: Hours after taking oath, Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yeddyurappa said that a waiver of crop loans up to Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 lakh will be announced within two days. BJP's manifesto for the elections had promised to waive all farmers' loans up to Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 lakh from nationalised and cooperative banks.

text: SunRisers Hyderabad fast bowler Basil Thampi has become the first-ever bowler to concede 70 runs in an IPL match. The 24-year-old pacer, who was named the IPL Emerging Player of the Season in 2017, registered figures of 4-0-70-0 against Royal Challengers Bangalore on Thursday. Ishant Sharma had conceded the previous most runs (66) in an IPL innings.

text: The security forces posted outside the Eagleton Resort near Bengaluru, where Congress MLAs are staying, were withdrawn on Thursday hours after BJP's Yeddyurappa took oath as the state CM. "This is not the system. Irrespective of whose government it is, it is their duty to provide protection...to the elected representatives," a Congress leader said.
summary: जहां से कांग्रेसी विधायक ठहरे हैं, वहां से सुरक्षा वापस ले ली गई

text: The Congress-JD(S) alliance has filed a plea in the Supreme Court against Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala for nominating an Anglo-Indian MLA to the state assembly before BJP's floor test. Claiming that the move was aimed at helping the BJP prove they have the support of the majority in the assembly, the petition appealed that the nomination should be set aside.
summary: कांग-जद (एस) एंग्लो-इंडियन एमएलए के अमरूद नामांकन को चुनौती देता है

text: JD(S) chief HD Deve Gowda had dismissed the Gujarat government of current Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala in 1996. Vajubhai was the Gujarat BJP chief when then-PM Gowda dismissed the state government within 24 hours of it winning floor test in the assembly. Interestingly, Vajubhai on Wednesday invited BJP to prove majority, instead of inviting Congress-JD(S) alliance to form Karnataka government.

text: The US accused India of not following the protocols of international parental child abduction, which refers to wrongful removal or retention of a child to another country by their parents. Claiming 90% of such cases were unresolved in India for a year, the US said India takes an average of one year and 10 months to solve these cases.
summary: भारत माता-पिता के बच्चे के अपहरण प्रोटोकॉल का पालन नहीं कर रहा है: यू.एस.

text: The security personnel on Thursday detained a man who breached security cover and threw ink on the face of Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar. Reports claimed that the man was an activist belonging to the rival INLD party. Notably, CM Khattar has a "rigid" security cover under which even journalists are asked to maintain 'appropriate distance' from the CM.

He is in the clutches of (Prime Minister) Narendra Modi." The statement comes after several Congress and JD(S) leaders accused the BJP of encouraging horse-trading to bring the party to power in Karnataka.
summary: कांग्रेस सांसद का कहना है कि हमारा विधायक पीएम मोदी के चंगुल में है

text: Olympic medalist wrestler Sakshi Malik's husband Satyawart Kadian is among the 15 wrestlers axed by the Wrestling Federation of India from the ongoing national camp for breach of discipline. All the four Phogat sisters have also been axed. Sakshi and three-time CWG gold medalist Sushil Kumar are also not participating in the camp, but had reportedly taken prior permission.
summary: साक्षी मलिक के पति पहलवानों के बीच शिविर से बाहर चले गए

text: Pictures of golfers continue to play with ash plumes from Kilauea volcanic eruption in Hawaii rising behind them have emerged online. The volcano has been erupting for almost two weeks and over 2,000 residents have been evacuated from the area so far. The plume of ash is estimated to have reached nearly 12,000 feet into the air.
summary: पास में ज्वालामुखी फटने के बावजूद गोल्फर्स खेलना जारी रखते हैं

text: The Supreme Court today directed the Jammu and Kashmir Police to interrogate witnesses in the Kathua rape case from a visible distance and in the presence of their family members. The decision was taken by the apex court after three witnesses alleged torture by the police during interrogation. It had earlier refused to provide protection to the witnesses.
summary: SC ने पुलिस से कहा कि वह कठुआ के गवाहों की जांच परिवार के सामने करे

text: Thousands of Uighur Muslims in China's Xinjiang province have been detained at "re-education" camps where they are subject to torture and abuse, reports said. A former detainee claimed that inmates were made to eat pork, which is forbidden in Islam, as punishment. China has intensified its crackdown on Uighur Muslims in an effort to curb "Islamic extremism".
summary: पोर्क खाने के लिए बने चीन के कैंप में मुस्लिम बंदी: रिपोर्ट

text: Interim Finance Minister Piyush Goyal has said the priority is to quickly "get entire banking system on its feet and shed the legacy that was inherited by this government in 2014." "Indiscriminate lending of the past has caused this distress that the banking sector is facing," he added. The RBI is ensuring proper banking supervision and taking action, Goyal claimed.
summary: प्राथमिकता अपने पैरों पर बैंकिंग प्रणाली प्राप्त करना है: अंतरिम एफएम

text: American singer John Legend and his wife, model Chrissy Teigen announced on Wednesday that they have welcomed a baby boy. Chrissy took to Twitter to reveal the news and wrote, "Somebody's herrrrrrre!" The couple, who already has a 2-year-old daughter named Luna, did not share any more details about their newborn son.
summary: जॉन लीजेंड, पत्नी Chrissy Teigen दूसरे बच्चे का स्वागत करते हैं

text: Anil Kapoor, while speaking about the clash between his daughter Sonam's film 'Veere Di Wedding' and son Harshvardhan's film 'Bhavesh Joshi Superhero', said, "As a father, I'll be anxious about my children. We've to wish for the best." "These calls are made by...studios and distributors, and I respect that," he added. Both films are scheduled to release on June 1.
summary: मैं बेफिक्र रहूंगा: अनिल सोनम और हर्ष की फिल्मों के बीच टकराव पर

text: According to reports, Akshay Kumar, Suniel Shetty, and Paresh Rawal are set to reunite for the third film in the 'Hera Pheri' franchise. The film will reportedly be directed by Indra Kumar, who previously directed the 'Masti' and 'Dhamaal' film series. The shooting of the film is expected to begin early next year.
summary: हेरा फेरी 3 के लिए अक्षय, सुनील, परेश फिर से: रिपोर्ट

text: According to reports, Ryan Reynolds starrer superhero film 'Deadpool 2' will feature the song 'Yun Hi Chala Chal' from Shah Rukh Khan starrer 'Swades'. The song will reportedly feature in a scene which shows the character Dopinder, an Indian cabbie, driving his cab. 'Deadpool 2' is scheduled to release on May 18.
summary: डेडपूल 2 को SRK की 'स्वदेस' के गाने की सुविधा: रिपोर्ट

text: KKR players including captain Dinesh Karthik enacted some popular movie dialogues of team owner Shah Rukh Khan. Australia's Chris Lynn also performed a dialogue from Raees, "Battery Nahi bolne ka." Shah Rukh tweeted in response, "As much as I love my team, here's the deal. I leave the cricket to u & u leave the acting to me!! Ha ha."
summary: केकेआर के खिलाड़ी कार्तिक, क्रिस लिन एसआरके के फिल्म संवादों को लागू करते हैं

text: Actress Disha Patani, while talking about being signed for the film 'Bharat', said, "It is like a dream come true to get an opportunity to work with Salman Sir." "I cannot wait to begin my journey with the entire Bharat team," she added. Disha will play a trapeze artiste in the film, which is scheduled for an Eid 2019 release.
summary: सलमान सर के साथ काम करने का सपना सच

text: Kings XI Punjab opener KL Rahul and Mumbai Indians all-rounder Hardik Pandya exchanged their jerseys following their match on Wednesday. "We've seen this happening a lot in football. Hardik and me are good friends and I felt like it would be nice to collect some jerseys and to bring that tradition in cricket as well," Rahul said about the gesture.
summary: केएल राहुल, हार्दिक पंड्या फुटबॉल की तरह जर्सी एक्सचेंज करते हैं

text: As many as 724 sixes have been hit in first 50 matches of the IPL 2018, which is the most at this stage in any season. The inaugural season witnessed 526 sixes and the lowest number of sixes (411) at this stage were hit in 2011. Notably, KXIP's Chris Gayle has hit the most IPL sixes (292) among batsmen.
summary: इस साल आईपीएल के 50 मैचों में 724 छक्के लगे, जो इस समय सबसे ज्यादा हैं

text: Bengaluru-based online healthcare startup mfine has raised $4.2 million in a Series A funding round led by Prime Venture Partners. Existing investors Stellaris Venture Partners and healthcare entrepreneur Mayur Abhaya also participated in the round. Founded in 2017, the startup offers app-based service for patients to access online consultations and care programs from different hospitals.
summary: ऑनलाइन हेल्थकेयर स्टार्टअप mfine 4.2 मिलियन डॉलर जुटाता है

text: Sandeep Aggarwal-led automobile marketplace Droom has raised $30 million in Series D round of funding led by Toyota's subsidiary Toyota Tsusho Corp and Digital Garage. Several institutional investors and family offices from China, Hong Kong, and South East Asia also participated in the funding round. Founded in 2014, Droom provides an online marketplace for sale of new and used automobiles.
summary: गुरुग्राम ऑटोमोबाइल्स पोर्टल Droom ने $ 30 मिलियन जुटाए

text: A case has been registered against former Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Virbhadra Singh and his son for allegedly breaking into a historical structure belonging to a relative over a family dispute. The complainant, his nephew Rajkumar Rajeshwar Singh, has alleged that a portion of the Padam Palace was forcibly captured by the former Himachal Pradesh CM and several others.
summary: पूर्व हिमाचल के सीएम ने परिजनों की संपत्ति में सेंध लगाने के लिए मामला दर्ज किया

text: The security guard of a housing society in Thane has been arrested for allegedly abducting and raping a 15-year-old girl. The incident occurred when the girl left her home to get medicines as she was suffering from a stomach ache. Following this, three people including the security guard abducted her and she was threatened with dire consequences if she complained.
summary: 15 साल की लड़की का अपहरण, हाउसिंग सोसायटी के गार्ड ने किया बलात्कार

text: Pakistan has made a test run of its first metro train service in the city of Lahore, under the $50 billion China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) project. The test run of the Orange Line Metro Train (OLMT) was inaugurated by Punjab province CM Shehbaz Sharif. "The project will transform people's lives...[and create] a sense of equality and ownership," CM Sharif said.
summary: CPEC के तहत पाकिस्तान अपनी पहली मेट्रो ट्रेन सेवा का परीक्षण करता है

text: Malaysia's Ministry of Finance on Wednesday said the Goods and Services Tax (GST) will be reduced to 0% effective June 1. New Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad had promised to abolish the 6% levy before his electoral victory. The GST was introduced in April 2015 by ousted leader Najib Razak to offset a fall in oil revenue.
summary: मलेशिया 1 जून से GST एकत्र करना बंद करे

text: Dabur Group Chairman Anand Burman has said that his joint bid with Munjal family for Fortis Healthcare is the best in the present circumstances. The Munjal-Burman combine had offered to invest Ã¢ÂÂ¹1,800 crore without any due diligence, while Manipal offered to invest Ã¢ÂÂ¹2,100 crore at a higher valuation. Our offer is clean, simple and easy to implement, Burman added.
summary: हमें पता है कि हमारे पास सबसे अच्छा प्रस्ताव है: फोर्टिस पर डाबर के बर्मन

text: The launch event of OnePlus' much-awaited flagship smartphone OnePlus 6 for the Indian market will begin at 3:00 PM in Mumbai today, a day after its global launch. For fans who couldn't snap up tickets to attend the launch, OnePlus is live-streaming the event in its entirety. OnePlus 6 will be available for purchase in India exclusively via Amazon India on May 21 and May 22.
summary: वनप्लस 6 को मुंबई में एक इवेंट में भारतीय बाजार के लिए लॉन्च किया गया

text: Former High Court judge CS Karnan, who was sentenced to six months in jail for contempt of court last year, has announced the launch of his political party 'Anti-Corruption Dynamic Party'. He announced his party would take part in the 2019 General Elections with women candidates only. Notably, he was the first High Court judge to retire as a fugitive.
summary: उच्च न्यायालय के पूर्व न्यायाधीश सीएस कर्णन राजनीतिक दल बनाते हैं

text: The Uttarakhand Cabinet on Wednesday organised a meeting in a boat named Marina on the Tehri Reservoir. Uttarakhand Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat was present for the cabinet meeting. Notably, a cabinet meeting was held outside the capital of the state for the first time ever.
summary: उत्तराखंड मंत्रिमंडल की बैठक एक नाव में हुई

text: Senior lawyer Ram Jethmalani has moved the Supreme Court in his personal capacity against Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala's decision to invite BJP to form the government in the state. The Governor's order is a "gross abuse" of constitutional power, Jethmalani told the court. BJP had fallen short of the majority by a few seats.
summary: जेठमलानी ने SC को BJP के लिए आमंत्रित किया

text: On being asked about proving majority in the state Assembly, Karnataka CM BS Yeddyurappa said, "Wait till tomorrow or day after tomorrow." The BJP, which fell short of majority in the elections, has been given 15 days to prove majority. "I am sure of winning vote of confidence and will serve 5 year term," the CM added.
summary: फ्लोर टेस्ट कल या परसों: कट्टक सीएम येदियुरप्पा

text: The Union Cabinet has approved the setting up of a central university in the Anantapur district of Andhra Pradesh, Human Resource Development Minister Prakash Javadekar said. A provision of Ã¢ÂÂ¹450 crore has been approved for the first phase of establishing the university. Andhra Pradesh had been left with no central university following its division into two states in 2014.
summary: आंध्र में केंद्रीय विश्वविद्यालय के लिए कैबिनेट ने दी मंजूरी

text: Jaipur-based millionaire Rrahul Tanejaa spent Ã¢ÂÂ¹16 lakh for the license plate 'RJ 45 CG 0001', which was the highest anyone had ever bid for a premium number, officials said. Tanejaa, who said he comes from a poor background, has previously spent Ã¢ÂÂ¹10 lakh on another license plate featuring the digit one. He added, "I believe in being number one."
summary: जयपुर करोड़पति नंबर प्लेट पर ¢ aire16 लाख खर्च करता है

text: US President Donald Trump's lawyer Rudy Giuliani has claimed that Special Counsel Robert Mueller had told him that a sitting President can't be indicted under current rules. "The Justice Department memos...say that you cannot indict a sitting President, you have to impeach him," Giuliani said. Mueller is investigating possible collusion between Russia and the Trump campaign.
summary: विशेष वकील ने बताया कि वह अमेरिका के राष्ट्रपति को नहीं बता सकते: ट्रम्प के वकील

text: The US has told North Korea to ship some nuclear warheads, an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) and other nuclear material overseas within six months, according to Japanese newspaper Asahi Shimbun. The report follows a threat by North Korea to cancel the June 12 summit between its leader Kim Jong-un and US President Donald Trump.
summary: अमेरिका ने एन कोरिया को 6 महीने के भीतर कुछ नक्स को जहाज करने के लिए कहा: रिपोर्ट

text: A 38-year-old man in Florida, US, was killed when his vape pen exploded, sending projectiles into his skull. The man also suffered burns over 80% of his body in a fire caused by the exploding e-cigarette. It is the first casualty in the US to be caused by a vape pen explosion, according to the Federal Emergency Management Agency.
summary: Vape पेन विस्फोट अमेरिका में आदमी को मारता है

text: A Canadian woman pooped at a coffee shop and threw it at an employee who denied her access to the outlet's restroom. A video of the incident showed the woman arguing with the employee before pooping. Police officials said they were reviewing the incident and will determine if the woman, who was briefly detained following the incident, will be charged.
summary: महिला कैफ़े के कर्मचारियों पर धावा बोलती है, जिन्होंने लू की पहुँच से इनकार किया था

text: The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) created a fake cryptocurrency called "HoweyCoins" to warn investors against possible scams. When users click the "Buy Coins Now!" button, it redirects them to an SEC website warning them of the strategies used by scammers. The page highlights red flags including a promise of high returns and celebrity endorsements among others.
summary: अमेरिकी सरकार निवेशकों को शिक्षित करने के लिए फर्जी क्रिप्टोकरेंसी बनाती है

text: The Bombay High Court on Wednesday declared the arrest of PNB scam accused Kavita Mankikar by CBI as illegal as she was taken into custody after sunset. The law says that no woman shall be arrested after sunset and before sunrise. Mankikar was Nirav ModiÃ¢ÂÂs executive assistant and an authorised signatory of three of his group firms.
summary: पीएनबी घोटाले के आरोपी की गिरफ्तारी के बाद सूर्यास्त अवैध: बॉम्बे एच.सी.

text: Irrfan Khan, who's currently out of India undergoing treatment for Neuroendocrine Tumour, took to Twitter to wish luck to his 'Karwaan' co-stars Dulquer Salmaan and Mithila Palkar for the film. "Beginnings have the innocence that experience can't buy...Two karwaans... Mine and the movie," the actor tweeted. Both Dulquer and Mithila will make their Bollywood debut with the film.
summary: इरफान कैंसर के इलाज के लिए अपने 'करवाण' के सह-कलाकारों को शुभकामनाएं देते हैं

text: Amitabh Bachchan took to Twitter to share a survey by Score Trends India which has named him the most engaging Bollywood actor on Facebook. The actor, while sharing the report, also took a dig at Twitter and wrote, "Yessssss... now Twitter can you please oblige." Bachchan had earlier threatened to leave Twitter, accusing it of reducing his number of followers.
summary: बिग बी ने FB पर सबसे आकर्षक B'wood अभिनेता का नाम लिया, ट्विटर पर खुदाई की

text: Amruta Khanvilkar, Alia Bhatt's co-star in 'Raazi', said, "Alia is...extremely secure...and an extremely receiving and giving actor." "This girl..in just 25 years of age has achieved so much...and has seen stardom like no one else her age, but despite this, she's so grounded," added Amruta. She further said Alia has "no airs" and makes all her co-stars feel comfortable.
summary: आलिया एक सुरक्षित अभिनेता हैं, उनकी कोई हवा नहीं है: Raazi सह-अभिनेता अमृता

text: Vir Das, who has been signed for American series 'Whiskey Cavalier', tweeted, "Priyanka Chopra is...a star, who has opened the doors for small fish like me." "If you feel the need to write an article about both of us, write one that gives her credit and appreciation, because I do," he added. Priyanka plays the lead in ABC series 'Quantico'.
summary: प्रियंका चोपड़ा ने मुझ जैसी छोटी मछली के लिए दरवाजे खोल दिए हैं: वीर

text: BJP President Amit Shah has said that murder of democracy happened the minute a "desperate" Congress made an "opportunist" offer to JD(S). Shah was reacting to Congress President Rahul Gandhi calling BJP's BS Yeddyurappa being sworn-in as "defeat of democracy". Congress' legacy is the horrific Emergency, blatant misuse of Article 356, subverting the courts, media, and civil society, Shah added.
summary: लोकतंत्र की हत्या तब हुई जब कांग्रेस ने जेडी (एस) को प्रस्ताव दिया: अमित शाह

text: Congress members on Thursday held a protest near the Mahatma Gandhi statue in Vidhan Soudha in Bengaluru against BJP's BS Yeddyurappa being sworn-in as Karnataka Chief Minister. Those present included party leaders GN Azad, Ashok Gehlot, Mallikarjun Kharge, KC Venugopal, as well as former CM Siddaramaiah. Earlier, party President Rahul Gandhi said BJP was making a mockery of the Constitution.
summary: बीएस येदियुरप्पा के शपथ ग्रहण के विरोध में कांग्रेस ने किया प्रदर्शन

text: JD(S) CM candidate HD Kumaraswamy has alleged that Anand Singh, the Congress MLA who has gone 'missing', told him BJP threatened him with an ED case against him. Kumaraswamy added that the PM Narendra Modi-led government was "misusing constitutional institutions by using their power in Delhi". "I'm sorry I have to protect my interest," Singh reportedly told another Congress MLA.
summary: बीजेपी ने ED केस के साथ 'लापता' कांग्रेसी विधायक को दी धमकी: कुमारस्वामी

text: World number five Karolina Pliskova bashed the umpire's chair and broke her racket after suffering a second-round loss in the Italian Open on Wednesday. The Czech player had a heated argument with the umpire after her smash was incorrectly ruled out when serving at 30-30 and 5-5 in the final set. Greece's Maria Sakkari won the match 3-6 6-3 7-5.
summary: खिलाड़ी ने नुकसान के बाद अंपायर की कुर्सी पर रैकेट तोड़ दिया

text: Video sharing platform YouTube is testing an incognito mode in its Android app. The users can access the option by tapping on their account picture in the top right corner of the app, where a "Turn on Incognito" toggle will be available. When the mode is switched on, users' activity is not recorded and their subscriptions also remain invisible.
summary: YouTube एंड्रॉइड ऐप में गुप्त मोड का परीक्षण करता है

text: Facebook has introduced a feature called 'Voice Posts' in India which allows users to share voice messages on its platform. While users will be able to share 20-second long voice posts in Facebook Stories, no such limit has been set on posts in the News Feed. The company will also roll out an archive feature to let users save Stories.
summary: FB उपयोगकर्ताओं को भारत में अपने मंच पर आवाज पोस्ट साझा करने देता है

text: Amazon's board of 10 members consists of only three women, according to executive research firm Equilar. It is similar to the makeup of the boards of other technology firms including, Microsoft and Apple. Earlier this week, Amazon announced the company would adopt a policy to include women and minorities in its candidate pool for all open board seats.
summary: अमेजन के 10-व्यक्ति बोर्ड में केवल तीन महिलाएं हैं: रिपोर्ट

text: China launched its first privately developed rocket 'Chongqing Liangjiang Star' on Thursday, state media reported. The launch of the rocket developed by 'OneSpace Technology' marks the first time a non-state Chinese rocket has successfully entered the orbit. The rocket can place a 100-kilogram load into orbit 800 kilometres from the earth, according to state media.
summary: चीन ने निजी कंपनी द्वारा डिजाइन किया गया पहला रॉकेट लॉन्च किया

text: The CBI on Wednesday arrested two sub-inspectors of the Uttar Pradesh Police in connection with the death of the Unnao rape victim's father. They have been arrested over allegations of criminal conspiracy and destruction of evidence. The rape victim's father had died after he was allegedly beaten up in custody by the brother of rape-accused BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar.
summary: उन्नाव रेप पीड़िता के पिता की मौत के मामले में CBI ने 2 आरोपियों को किया गिरफ्तार

text: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has said that Chinese President Xi Jinping had assured to protect him from moves that could result in his removal from office. "We will be there if you need us...We will not allow the Philippines to go to the dogs," Duterte added quoting Jinping. He further called the Chinese President's assurance very encouraging.
summary: चीनी राष्ट्रपति शी मेरे सीप की अनुमति नहीं देंगे: फिलीपीन प्रेज़

text: Wrestling Federation of India has thrown out four Phogat sisters, Geeta, Babita, Ritu and Sangeeta, from an ongoing national camp over alleged "tantrums and indiscipline". The sisters skipped the camp without informing the federation, following which they were issued notices. Babita said she missed the camp due to injury, but added she had no information on Geeta.
summary: 4 फोगट बहनें 'नखरे' को लेकर राष्ट्रीय खेमे से बाहर

text: Kami Rita, a 48-year-old Nepalese Sherpa scaled Mount Everest on Wednesday for the 22nd time, setting a record for the most successful climbs of the world's highest mountain. Kami, who had first scaled the 29,029-foot peak at the age of 24, beat the previous record of 21 ascents jointly held by himself, and Sherpas 58-year-old Apa and 47-year-old Phurba Tashi.
summary: 48 साल के नेपाली ने रिकॉर्ड 22 वीं बार माउंट एवरेस्ट पर चढ़ाई की

text: RCB and England all-rounder Moeen Ali has said Virat Kohli is "so humble" it's "almost weird how nice he is". "You see him on the field and people might think he's arrogant but it is the complete opposite," he said. Ali added Kohli rings him to check if "he's OK" or "fancies lunch" despite being the biggest name in India.
summary: विराट कोहली कितने अच्छे हैं यह लगभग अजीब है: आरसीबी के मोइन अली

text: In a move to encourage the electric vehicles adoption, the government has proposed setting up charging stations at every 3 km in cities. The facility will be available at every 50 km on national highways, according to an official. The government is likely to offer fiscal incentives and facilitate land from municipal authorities for companies interested in constructing the infrastructure.
summary: सरकार हर 3 किमी पर ई-वाहनों के लिए चार्जिंग स्टेशन प्रस्तावित करती है

text: Apple is seeking $1 billion in damages from Samsung in a case that involves infringement of five patents by the South Korea-based technology giant. Apple claims Samsung reportedly made $3.3 billion in revenue and $1 billion in profit on the patent-infringing phones. Meanwhile, Samsung wants to limit damages to $28 million, calculated only on the value of the infringed parts.
summary: एप्पल पेटेंट उल्लंघन के लिए सैमसंग से $ 1 बिलियन की मांग करता है

text: Nepalese mountaineer Lhakpa Sherpa on Wednesday climbed the Mount Everest for the ninth time, breaking her own record of the most summits by a woman. The 44-year-old has already been recognised by the Guinness Book of World Records for climbing the Everest eight times. She joined her first Everest expedition in 2000.

text: While it is known industrial sewage can cause low oxygen conditions and kill fish, a Kenya-based study has found hippo waste can have a similar effect. text: Lasting 103 minutes, the July 27 Full Moon would present the longest total lunar eclipse of the 21st century. The event would be primarily visible in India, Africa, the Middle East, Australia, and Europe. The reason behind the long duration is that the Moon would pass directly through centre of Earth's shadow while Earth-Moon and Earth-Sun would be farthest apart.

text: Scientists with NASA's NICER mission have discovered two stars that revolve around each other every 38 minutes, the shortest-known orbital period for a X-ray pulsar binary system. summary: भाजपा को सत्ता से बाहर रखने के लिए सभी कर रहे हैं: कांग्रेस गठबंधन पर जद (एस)

text: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Tuesday submitted his resignation to state Governor Vajubhai Vala after the Congress' poor performance in the state assembly elections. Current trends show BJP leading in 104 out of 222 seats in the state. Meanwhile, Congress and JD(S) announced a post-poll alliance and staked claim to form the government.

text: Former BCCI President Shashank Manohar has been re-elected as the independent Chairman of International Cricket Council after he was the sole nominee put forward by the ICC Board. Manohar had become the first independent ICC Chairman in 2016. He had resigned from the post in March 2017 but deferred it days later on the request of the ICC Board.
summary: पूर्व BCCI प्रीज़ मनोहर को ICC के अध्यक्ष के रूप में निर्विरोध चुना गया

text: A nude portrait by Italian painter Amedeo Modigliani has fetched $157.2 million (over Ã¢ÂÂ¹1,000 crore), the fourth highest price for any work of art at an auction. The 1917 oil painting carried a pre-sale estimate of about $150 million, making it the highest-estimated work of art in auction history. The artwork's owner bought it for over Ã¢ÂÂ¹182 crore in 2003.
summary: इतालवी चित्रकार द्वारा नग्न चित्र portrait .1,000 करोड़ में नीलाम हुआ

text: After Congress announced a post-poll alliance with JD(S) in Karnataka, BJP CM candidate BS Yeddyurappa accused Congress of trying to "come to power through the back door". Thanking the people of Karnataka for granting their mandate to BJP, he claimed that people will not tolerate Congress forming the government. The BJP leadership will decide further course of action, he added.

text: After announcing a post-poll alliance with JD(S) in the Karnataka Assembly elections, Congress announced support to JD(S) supremo Deve Gowda's son HD Kumaraswamy for the Chief Minister post, according to reports. Congress reportedly plans to appoint a Dalit candidate for the post of Deputy CM. Congress and JD(S) have collectively won 61 seats, while the BJP has won 75 constituencies.
summary: कांग्रेस जद (एस) प्रमुख के बेटे को सीएम के रूप में समर्थन करती है, कांग्रेस अध्यक्ष को डीएम बनना है

text: Talking about the Karnataka election results, BJP General Secretary Ram Madhav on Tuesday said, "The Sangh parivaar cadres have helped us enormously." Adding that Prime Minister Narendra Modi's hard work had paid off, he said, "I would give credit to Karnataka's leadership and cadres right from BS Yeddyurappa down to party cadres especially to the parivaar."

text: Karnataka CM and Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Tuesday won the Assembly election from the Badami seat, defeating BJP's B Sreeramulu by a margin of 1,696 votes. Siddaramaiah, who was contesting from two seats, lost the Chamundeshwari seat to JD(S) candidate GT Devegowda by a margin of over 36,000 votes. Vote-counting trends showed no party winning a clear majority.
summary: राज्य चुनाव में बादामी सीएम सिद्धारमैया ने बादामी सीट जीती

text: To comply with new European Union privacy regulations, Google updated 1.2 crore contracts with companies that use its services, Google's global privacy counsel Peter Fleischer said. Google invested over 500 human years to overcome thousands of bugs in its products, Fleischer added. He further said it will take a full week to send out notices of updated privacy policy worldwide.
summary: नए यूरोपीय संघ के नियमों का पालन करने के लिए Google ने 1.2 करोड़ अनुबंधों को अपडेट किया

text: The government on Tuesday clarified that Aadhaar has not been made mandatory for getting pension for government employees. The government said that Aadhaar is an additional facility to enable the use of technology for submission of life certificate without visiting banks. There are about 48.41 lakh central government employees and 61.17 lakh pensioners.

text: Accusing Indian media of distorting remarks made by former Pakistan Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif on 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, Prime Minister Shahid Khaqan Abbasi said, "It is unacceptable that Sharif is being termed a traitor." "It is unfortunate that we followed their (Indian media's) lead," he added. Sharif had said that Pakistan-based militant organisations were responsible for 26/11 attacks.
summary: भारतीय मीडिया ने शरीफ की 26/11 की टिप्पणी को गलत बताया: पाक पीएम अब्बासी

text: China's Litang county has banned monks "wrongly" educated in India from teaching Buddhism, the Chinese state media said. The move is aimed at preventing the spread of "separatist" activities as monks received education from groups associated with the Dalai Lama, whom China considers a separatist. It came in response to "severe separatist situation" in China, the state media added.

text: US' National Security Advisor John Bolton has said North Korea should send its dismantled nuclear weapons to a US lab for sanctions to be eased against the regime. The sanctions had been imposed in response to North Korea's nuclear and ballistic missiles programme. North Korea has said it will dismantle its nuclear test site in a ceremony between May 23-25.
summary: प्रतिबंधों में ढील के लिए अमेरिका को विघटित nukes भेजें: US to N कोरिया

text: Actor-politician Shatrughan Sinha, while praising Amitabh Bachchan and Rishi Kapoor starrer '102 Not Out', tweeted, "Hindi cinema's landscape has once again been redefined by the legendary, most popular and [wonderful] actors." "102 Not Out is a well done and a spotless hit film being seen and enjoyed by every section of society," he added.
summary: हिंदी सिनेमा को फिर से परिभाषित किया गया है: '102 नॉट आउट' पर शत्रुघ्न

text: Actor Arjun Kapoor took to Twitter to share a collage of himself with his father Boney Kapoor and his cousins Harshvardhan Kapoor and Jahaan Kapoor with their fathers Anil Kapoor and Sanjay Kapoor respectively. "Kapoor and sons -The Sequel," Arjun wrote in the photo's caption. The film 'Kapoor & Sons', which released in 2016, starred Alia Bhatt and Sidharth Malhotra.

text: Richa Chadha has said that she regretted choosing the film 'Sarbjit' as she felt misused. Richa portrayed Sarbjit's wife in the biopic based on Sarabjit Singh, an Indian who was accused of being a spy and sentenced to death by a Pakistan court. text: Tinder is reportedly testing a feature called 'Places' that will match its users based on common locations that they have visited in the recent past. The opt-in feature will not reveal the users' real-time location and will wait for a while after they leave to show the same. It'll only show social spots, leaving out places like workplace and banks.

text: In a major security lapse, the chopper carrying Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath was forced to land on a field instead of a makeshift helipad at a Kasganj school today. text: Fresh data analysis from NASA's Galileo spacecraft has confirmed the probe flew through a giant plume of water vapour that erupted from Jupiter's icy moon Europa in 1997. text: A group of Chinese volunteers have come out from 110 days of isolation in a virtual "lunar lab" as the country pursues its ambition to put people on the Moon. text: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly raped by three men at a hotel in Vrindavan and subsequently abandoned on a Delhi-bound train, the police said on Monday. text: PM Narendra Modi will travel to Russia on May 21 for an informal summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin, the External Affairs Ministry announced on Monday. The two leaders will exchange their views on international matters, it added.

text: During an inspection at Mumbai's Kamala Mills, a judicial committee looking into last year's fire noticed that a toilet of 1Above pub, where 14 people died, has been razed. text: The BJP's Chief Ministerial candidate BS Yeddyurappa has won by a margin of over 35,000 votes from the Shikaripura seat in the Karnataka Assembly elections. text: After Congress trailed in the Karnataka Assembly elections, the party announced its support to JD(S) and added the party has accepted its offer. "We bow our heads to the verdict. text: Born on May 15, 1859, French scientist Pierre Curie had initially rejected the 1903 Nobel Prize in Physics. Pierre, who discovered radium and polonium with wife Marie Curie, accepted the award on the condition that her contribution was also recognised, making Marie the first-ever female Nobel Laureate. Marie later won a solo Chemistry Nobel in 1911 following Pierre's death.

text: Talking about Congress trailing in Karnataka Assembly elections, Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu said, "I'll stand with Rahul Gandhi till the time I have blood in my body." text: With BJP leading in the Karnataka Assembly elections, party leader Ram Madhav said, "BJP's southward march has begun." "I'd like to thank the people of Karnataka for this mandate. text: IIM Ahmedabad's Centre for Innovation Incubation and Entrepreneurship has launched the 'Bharat Inclusion Initiative', with a commitment of $25 million from The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, Omidyar Network, and Michael and Susan Dell Foundation. text: Foxconn's investment subsidiary FIH Mobile has written off $40 million of its $200 million investment in Snapdeal. text: The East Delhi Municipal Corporation has imposed a Ã¢ÂÂ¹6-crore fine on the AAP-led Delhi government for shifting around 3,000 Tihar Jail inmates to the newly constructed Mandoli prisons without obtaining a completion certificate. The prisoners were shifted to decongest Tihar Jail, which housed 10,500 inmates against its capacity of 7,000. Mandoli jail can accommodate around 3,700 inmates.

text: A Kerala State Road Transport Corporation bus changed its route and rushed a pregnant passenger to the hospital after she developed uneasiness while travelling. text: A Lamborghini HuracÃÂ¡n presented by the Italian carmaker to Pope Francis has been auctioned for four times its price, raising over $800,000 for charity. text: A 69-year-old Chinese double amputee on Monday reached the summit of Mount Everest, four decades after his first attempt. The only other double amputee to summit Everest is New Zealander Mark Inglis, who achieved the feat in 2006.

text: Reversing a three-month declining trend, India's retail inflation accelerated to 4.58% in April compared to 4.28% in March, government data showed. April was the sixth straight month in which inflation was higher than the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) medium-term target of 4%. Meanwhile, India's wholesale inflation climbed to a four-month high of 3.18% in April.

text: Mallika Sherawat locked herself in a cage at Cannes Film Festival as part of a campaign to raise awareness about human trafficking and sexual exploitation of children. "I wanted to drive home the imagery of how young girls who're being trafficked are trapped in a small 12x8 foot room," said Mallika. She's the ambassador of international NGO 'Free A Girl'.

text: Hollywood actress Kristen Stewart took off her heels and walked barefoot at the Cannes Film Festival red carpet. Her move was seen as a protest against the 'unspoken rule' that women must wear heels on the Cannes red carpet. Talking about the rule, Kristen had previously said, "People get very upset at you if you don't wear heels or whatever."

text: As the BJP took lead in 114 seats in Karnataka elections, BJP leader and Chhattisgarh CM Raman Singh said, "Now there will be a Congress khojo abhiyan in the country. No one knows where they will be." If the BJP forms the government in Karnataka post the elections, the Congress' power will be reduced to only Punjab, Mizoram and Puducherry.

text: After BJP took a lead in the Karnataka Assembly elections, the party's Karnataka handle tweeted, "Hope you have learned humility now." Referring to Congress' CM candidate Siddaramaiah trailing in the Chamundeshwari seat while leading from the Badami seat, the BJP added, "Badami was chosen as a safe option as Chamundeshwari was bound to go."

text: BJP leader Rajyavardhan Rathore on Tuesday said it is good if all the Opposition wants to unite so that all of the country's dirt could be removed together. Speaking about the results of the Karnataka Assembly elections in which BJP is leading, Rathore added, "This is the third straight defeat of Rahul Gandhi since he became President."

text: With trends in the counting of votes showing Congress trailing behind BJP in Karnataka, party leader DK Shivakumar said, "Rahul Gandhi did his best, but it is we who have lost the elections." "We, the local leadership, should have en-cashed it in a proper way and because of which we lost it," Shivakumar added.

text: BJP MP Subramanian Swamy on Tuesday laughed in reaction to a question on Congress' claims of tampering of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) in Karnataka Assembly elections. This came after early trends showed the BJP securing a victory in the elections. Swamy had earlier tweeted his prediction for the elections, stating the BJP will win 115 to 130 seats.

text: Indian wheelchair cricket team successfully completed its first international tour, winning a three-match series in Bangladesh, after cricketing legend Sachin Tendulkar donated nearly Ã¢ÂÂ¹4.5 lakh. text: Australia's chief T20 selector Mark Waugh has confirmed he will not renew his contract ending August to take up a commentary role. Australia, who will host the World T20 in 2020, are yet to win the tournament. The vacancy in selection panel comes after Darren Lehmann stepped down as coach amid the ball-tampering scandal and was replaced by Justin Langer.

text: Proofpoint researchers have discovered a 'Vega Stealer' malware which harvests information from Chrome and Firefox browsers. It is capable of stealing data like passwords, credit cards, profiles, and payment information from infected devices. Vega Stealer is spread via emails with subject line "Online store developer required" and contains the attachment to download the Vega Stealer payload.

text: Around 30 million smartphone units were shipped in India in the first quarter of 2018, leading to a year-on-year growth of 11%, according to IDC. As per the data, Xiaomi maintained its lead in the market (30.3%), followed by Samsung (25.1%) and Oppo (7.4%). Online channel accounted for facilitating 36% of the sales in the March quarter, the report added.
summary: Q1 2018 में भारत में भेजे गए 30 मिलियन स्मार्टफोन: रिपोर्ट

text: After being acquitted for culpable homicide in the 1988 road rage case, Punjab Minister Navjot Singh Sidhu said, "I have sent a message to Rahul Gandhi ji and Priyanka Gandhi ji that my life is yours." Calling Congress President Rahul Gandhi "a leader in the ascent", Sidhu said he will stand by him till he has blood in his body.
